detailed_translations.english: An arrangement or deal that is aboveboard is legal and is being carried out openly and honestly. A person who is aboveboard is open and honest about what they are doing.

sentences.chinese: 在此基础上提出了进一步深化节能理念，建立节约型企业所采取的措施。

name: aggrandize
trans: vt.增加、提高（力量、财富、地位、声誉）等

sentences.english: At the dinner table, my father would go on and on, showing off, aggrandizing himself.
sentences.chinese: 吃饭时我父亲总是不停地夸耀和吹嘘自己。

sentences.english: ...plans to aggrandize the building.
sentences.chinese: ...使建筑物更加壮观的计划。

detailed_translations.english: To aggrandize someone means to make them seem richer, more powerful, and more important than they really are. To aggrandize a building means to make it more impressive.

sentences.english: Their money problems were further aggravated by a rise in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 由于利率上调，他们的财务问题更加严重。

sentences.english: Building the new road will only aggravate the situation .
sentences.chinese: 建造那条新路只会使情况恶化。

sentences.chinese: 希拉的所有收入总计为10万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to be a particular amount when added together
the total after a lot of different figures or points have been added together
being the total amount of something after all the figures or points have been added together

sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.

sentences.english: it aggrieved her much that she could not go

sentences.chinese: 你只需要用手指或刷子轻轻搅动水。

detailed_translations.english: to shake or mix a liquid quickly

sentences.english: I’ve been agog all afternoon, waiting for the next part of your story.
sentences.chinese: 整个下午我都在兴奋地期待着，等你讲下一段故事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴奋的， 有强烈兴趣的

sentences.english: As a mother, I agonize over what my children will inherit.

name: alibi
trans: n.不在场的证明；托辞，借口

sentences.english: Make sure that all the holes align.

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things so that they form a line or are parallel to each other, or to be in a position that forms a line etc

sentences.chinese: 总统发表了一项声明以缓解公众的忧虑。

sentences.english: measures to alleviate poverty

detailed_translations.english: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

sentences.english: With friends, she sometimes alluded to a feeling that she herself was to blame for her son's predicament.

sentences.english: The allure and charm of Paris captivate all who visit there.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎的诱惑与魅力吸引了所有到此游玩的人。

sentences.chinese: 它的诱惑与魅力吸引了所有到那游玩的人。

sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟国会议

sentences.chinese: 他将别无选择，只能与这个新运动结盟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同盟国；伙伴；同盟者；助手

If you ally yourself with someone or something, you give your support to them

sentences.english: But in the stratosphere they can stay aloft for years, spread by fast winds known as jets, meaning the threat is global.
sentences.chinese: 但在平流层，它们可以在高处停留数年，高速的风对其进行传播，这意味着全球都受到了威胁。

detailed_translations.english: high up in the air

sentences.english: Beneath that aloof exterior, Gayle is a warm, sympathetic person.
sentences.chinese: 在冷漠的外表下，盖尔是个有同情心的热心人。

sentences.chinese: 许多人无私地选择在发展中国家工作。

detailed_translations.english: when you care about or help other people, even though this brings no advantage to yourself

sentences.english: The firm has amalgamated with another company.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司已经与另一家公司合并了。

detailed_translations.english: if two organizations amalgamate, or if one amalgamates with another, they join and make one big organization

sentences.chinese: 部长的声明措辞很含糊。

detailed_translations.english: that can be understood in more than one way; having different meanings

sentences.chinese: 接下来，你可以将内容小心地浸入芳香美味的CSS暖浴中了。不过在你跳进糖果硬壳之前，还有些额外的考虑。

sentences.chinese: 她一向是个很听话的孩子。

name: amenity
trans: n.（环境、设备等的）舒适，人性化；

sentences.english: The hotel is in the city centre, close to shops and local amenities.

name: amiable

sentences.english: The driver was an amiable young man.
sentences.chinese: 司机是位友善的年轻人。

sentences.english: The injection itself may include local anesthetic and/or saline along with the steroid medication to give immediate pain relief and flush the area of inflammatory agents.

living

sentences.chinese: 正如格言所说，展望未来，忘记过去。话是这样说，但是那些拒绝理解现在的人怎么办呢？

sentences.chinese: 那些都是欺骗顾客花钱的虚假广告。

sentences.chinese: 这座城市集体育活动和文化活动于一身，颇具吸引力。

sentences.chinese: 近期发生的事件使他的主题思想显得更为恰当。

sentences.chinese: 至于最新的进展，他没有什么要说的。

sentences.chinese: 用“一见钟情”来形容他见到她时的感觉再恰当不过。

sentences.chinese: 他20年前来到这个国家，是成功的亚裔商人的典型。

sentences.english: The difficulty and failure both didn't cool his ardor.
sentences.chinese: 困难和失败都没有降低他的热情。

sentences.chinese: “克瑞斯，你那板斧有了新对象了，”他说，“一个纯洁得像白玫瑰的青年，对斯宾塞怀着恋人一样的热情。

sentences.english: Cathy Whitaker: That was the day I stopped believing in the wild ardor of things.
sentences.chinese: 凯西。惠特克：那一天，让我开始不再相信狂野的热情这样的事情。

sentences.chinese: 他遭到逮捕并被指控谋杀。

sentences.english: The aseptic design of centrifugal separator and its application are introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了离心分离机的无菌设计及其在系统中的应用。

sentences.english: Your equipment design and aseptic processing operator competencies appear to contribute to the lack of unidirectionality.
sentences.chinese: 你们的设备设计和无菌处理操作人员资质貌似与不能保证垂直气流有关。

sentences.english: These EM records provide critical data on environmental trends and whether environmental control is maintained during aseptic filling of a batch.
sentences.chinese: 这些EM记录提供了环境趋势的关键数据，以及环境控制在一个批次的无菌灌装期间是否维持良好。

detailed_translations.english: free from living pathogenic organisms; sterile

sentences.english: There were no shutters at the windows, and some of the doors hung askew.
sentences.chinese: 窗户上没有百叶窗，有些门也是歪斜着安装的。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is askew is not straight or not level with what it should be level with
not quite straight or in the right position

sentences.english: a south-facing aspect
sentences.chinese: 朝南方向

detailed_translations.english: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

sentences.english: "I told you Preskel had no idea," remarked Kemp with some asperity.
sentences.chinese: "我跟你说过普瑞克一无所知"，坎普有点儿不耐烦地说。

detailed_translations.chinese: （表面的）粗糙；（气候等的）严酷；艰苦的条件；（性格）粗暴
detailed_translations.english: if you speak with asperity, you say something in a way that is rough or severe, showing that you are feeling impatient

sentences.english: Should you hear my name blackened and maligned, will you credit the aspersion ?
sentences.chinese: 要是你听见我的名誉受到诽谤， 你会相信那谗言吗?。

sentences.english: Rather than casting aspersion on leaks about Mr. Flynn, these commentators praised their contributions to accountability journalism.
sentences.chinese: 这些评论者不但没有对弗林一事的消息泄露做出诽谤，还赞扬这是对问责新闻的贡献。

sentences.english: We cast no aspersion on the man or his program. Mr. Obama, in his short career, has not strongly associated himself with any policy idea.
sentences.chinese: 我们无意诽谤这个人或他的计划，然而奥巴马先生在他短暂的职业生涯里，从未对任何政策主张表现过强烈支持的态度。

sentences.english: ...the young aspirant to power.
sentences.chinese: ...对权力有抱负的年轻人。

sentences.english: ...aspirant politicians.
sentences.chinese: ...有抱负的政治家们。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is an aspirant to political power or to an important job has a strong desire to achieve it
Aspirant means the same as

sentences.english: I assented to the request of the American publishers to write this book.
sentences.chinese: 我同意了美国出版商们写这本书的请求。

detailed_translations.english: to agree to a suggestion, idea etc after considering it carefully
approval or agreement from someone who has authority

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

sentences.english: Women have become more assertive in the past decade.
sentences.chinese: 妇女在过去十年已变得更坚定自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 肯定的；独断的；坚定而自信的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a confident way, so that people notice you

name: assess
trans: v.评估（重要性、尺寸、价值等）

sentences.english: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对估价； 评价， 评论
detailed_translations.english: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

sentences.english: Podulski had been assiduous in learning his adopted language.
sentences.chinese: 珀杜斯基曾经勤奋地学习他所选的外语。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is assiduous works hard or does things very thoroughly

sentences.english: Nothing could assuage his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 什么都不能减轻他的内疚。

detailed_translations.english: to make an unpleasant feeling less painful or severe

name: astounding
trans: adj.令人吃惊的，出乎意料的

sentences.english: The concert was an astounding success.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会出奇地成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人震惊的；令人惊骇的
detailed_translations.english: so surprising that it is almost impossible to believe

sentences.english: an astute politician
sentences.chinese: 机敏的政治家

sentences.english: astute investments
sentences.chinese: 精明的投资

detailed_translations.chinese: 机敏的；狡猾的，诡计多端的
detailed_translations.english: able to understand situations or behaviour very well and very quickly, especially so that you can get an advantage for yourself

detailed_translations.chinese: 分离的； 化为碎片的
detailed_translations.english: If something tears or is torn asunder, it is violently separated into two or more parts or pieces

sentences.english: He applied for asylum in 1987 after fleeing the police back home.
sentences.chinese: 他于1987年逃脱本国的警察之后申请了避难许可。

detailed_translations.english: protection given to someone by a government because they have escaped from fighting or political trouble in their own country

sentences.english: asymmetrical patterns
sentences.chinese: 不对称图案

detailed_translations.english: having two sides that are different in shape

sentences.english: He felt he had atoned for what he had done to his son.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得他已弥补曾对儿子所做的错事。

detailed_translations.english: to do something to show that you are sorry for having done something wrong

sentences.english: The judge said he had committed atrocious crimes against women.
sentences.chinese: 该法官称他对妇女犯下了残暴的罪行。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone's behaviour or their actions as atrocious, you mean that it is unacceptable because it is extremely violent or cruel

sentences.english: The repetition of symbols was to be enough, without trauma, as well, perhaps, to attenuate it, or even jar it altogether loose from her memory.
sentences.chinese: 象征的重复快要足够，即便没有可能的从她记忆中流出的创伤，去减弱它去刺激它。

sentences.english: You could never eliminate risk, but preparation and training could attenuate it.
sentences.chinese: 风险不可能完全消除，但可以通过防范和培训来降低。

detailed_translations.english: To attenuate something means to reduce it or weaken it

sentences.english: the risks involved in such an audacious operation
sentences.chinese: 如此大胆的行动中存在的风险

detailed_translations.chinese: 厚颜无耻的；大胆鲁莽的
detailed_translations.english: showing great courage or confidence in a way that is impressive or slightly shocking

sentences.english: The renewed violence this week hardly augurs well for smooth or peaceful change.
sentences.chinese: 本周新的暴力事件预示着顺利的平稳转变几乎是不可能的。

detailed_translations.english: If something augurs well or badly for a person or a future situation, it is a sign that things will go well or badly

sentences.english: an authentic account
sentences.chinese: 真实可信的说法

detailed_translations.chinese: 真的， 真正的； 可靠的， 可信的
detailed_translations.english: based on facts

sentences.english: an agreement between the US and Colombian authorities
sentences.chinese: 美国和哥伦比亚当局的一份协议

sentences.english: Only the president has the authority to declare war.
sentences.chinese: 只有总统才有权宣战。

sentences.english: I need to speak to someone in authority (= who has a position of power ) .
sentences.chinese: 我得找管事的人谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: [plural] the people or organizations that are in charge of a particular country or area

sentences.english: Many poor countries are abandoning autocracy.
sentences.chinese: 很多贫穷国家都在推翻独裁统治。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独裁政治；专制政治；独裁政府；独裁统治的国家
detailed_translations.english: a system of government in which one person or group has unlimited power

name: autonomy
trans: n.自我主导的自由，（尤其是）精神独立

sentences.english: campaigners who want greater autonomy for Corsica
sentences.chinese: 希望科西嘉有更多自治权的活动家

detailed_translations.english: freedom that a place or an organization has to govern or control itself

sentences.english: He paid a month's rent in advance, just enough to satisfy the landlord's avarice.
sentences.chinese: 他预交了一个月的房租，正好满足了房东的贪心。

detailed_translations.english: a desire to have a lot of money that is considered to be too strong

detailed_translations.chinese: 极力声明； 断言； 证实
detailed_translations.english: to say something firmly and strongly because you are sure that it is true

sentences.english: Some banks are risk averse (=  do not like taking a risk  ) .
sentences.chinese: 有些银行不喜欢冒风险。

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to do something or not liking something

sentences.english: He misses not having enough books because he's an avid reader.
sentences.chinese: 他遗憾没有足够的书，因为他是一个热爱读书的人。

detailed_translations.english: You use avid to describe someone who is very enthusiastic about something that they do

sentences.english: The girls were awed by the splendour of the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 女孩们对大教堂的宏伟气势大为惊叹。

detailed_translations.english: if you are awed by someone or something, you feel great respect and liking for them, and are often slightly afraid of them
a feeling of great respect and liking for someone or something

name: awkward
trans: adj.（处理问题）缺乏手段和智谋的

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

sentences.english: He rushed out, hat awry.
sentences.chinese: 他歪戴着帽子冲了出去。

detailed_translations.english: not in the correct position

sentences.english: Similar to us, birds learn to sing by mimicking the adults, and the early chirps are akin to a baby's babble.
sentences.chinese: 和人类一样，鸟类通过模仿长者学习鸣叫，最开始鸣叫时类似于婴儿的牙牙学语。

sentences.english: If your child often has a pacifier in his mouth, he may be less likely to babble and practice talking, or the pacifier may distort his speech.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的宝宝经常含着奶嘴，那这样可能会减少宝宝牙牙学语，练习说话的机会，或者奶嘴可能会搅乱他的言语发展。

sentences.english: She badgered me for weeks until I finally gave in.
sentences.chinese: 她缠了我好几个星期，直到我最终答应了她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 獾；獾皮；（大写）獾州人（美国威斯康星州人的别称）；<动><澳>毛鼻袋熊
detailed_translations.english: an animal that has black and white fur, lives in holes in the ground, and is active at night
to try to persuade someone by asking them something several times

sentences.english: ...light-hearted badinage.
sentences.chinese: ...轻松的玩笑。

detailed_translations.english: conversation that involves a lot of jokes or humour

sentences.english: We used worms as bait.
sentences.chinese: 我们用小虫子作诱饵。

sentences.english: The fish wouldn’t take the bait .
sentences.chinese: 鱼儿不上钩。

sentences.english: He baited his hook with pie.
sentences.chinese: 他把馅饼放在钓钩上作饵。

sentences.chinese: 男孩子们挖了陷阱，在里面放上诱饵，以便用矛刺杀猎物。

detailed_translations.english: food used to attract fish, animals, or birds so that you can catch them
If you bait a hook or trap, you put bait on it or in it

sentences.english: a bale of straw
sentences.chinese: 一大捆稻草

detailed_translations.english: a large quantity of something such as paper or  hay  that is tightly tied together especially into a block

sentences.english: a baleful look
sentences.chinese: 恶狠狠的目光

detailed_translations.english: expressing anger, hatred, or a wish to harm someone

sentences.english: Even biology undergraduates may balk at animal experiments.
sentences.chinese: 即使是生物专业的大学生都可能会反对动物实验。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone or something from getting or achieving what they want

name: balderdash
trans: n.胡言乱语，废话，无意义的话

detailed_translations.english: talk or writing that is silly nonsense

sentences.english: The company’s debt has ballooned in the past year.
sentences.chinese: 在过去一年里，公司的债务激增。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly become larger in amount
an object made of brightly coloured thin rubber, that is filled with air and used as a toy or decoration for parties

sentences.english: lip balm
sentences.chinese: 润唇膏

detailed_translations.chinese: 香油；镇痛软膏；香峰草，香树膏
detailed_translations.english: an oily liquid with a strong pleasant smell that you rub into your skin, often to reduce pain

sentences.english: conversations about the most banal subjects
sentences.chinese: 最无聊的谈话

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈腐的；平庸的；老一套的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting, because of a lack of new or different ideas

sentences.english: Her brother is the bane of her life .
sentences.chinese: 她弟弟是她生活中的灾星。

sentences.english: John was banished from England.
sentences.chinese: 约翰被逐出英国。

detailed_translations.english: to not allow someone or something to stay in a particular place

sentences.english: As she closed the door, she heard Tom exchanging good-natured banter with Jane.
sentences.chinese: 她关门时听见汤姆与简在开着善意的玩笑。

detailed_translations.english: Banter is teasing or joking talk that is amusing and friendly

sentences.english: The barb stung her exactly the way he hoped it would.
sentences.chinese: 他的讽刺如期伤到了她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 箭头鱼钩等的倒钩；伤人的话
detailed_translations.english: the sharp curved point of a hook,  arrow  etc that prevents it from being easily pulled out

sentences.english: The trade in exotic birds is barbarous.
sentences.chinese: 买卖奇异鸟类是很残忍的。

detailed_translations.english: extremely cruel in a way that is shocking

sentences.english: Why are you telling such barefaced lies ?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么要说这种无耻的谎言？

detailed_translations.chinese: 厚颜无耻的， 公然的
detailed_translations.english: used to describe a remark or action that is clearly untrue or unpleasant, and that shows that you do not care about offending someone

sentences.english: I’ve kept my side of the bargain and I expect you to keep yours.
sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

sentences.english: women bargaining with traders
sentences.chinese: 和商贩讨价还价的女人

detailed_translations.english: an agreement, made between two people or groups to do something in return for something else
to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price

sentences.english: furnished in a baroque style
sentences.chinese: 以巴洛克风格陈设的

detailed_translations.chinese: 巴洛克式的；结构复杂的，形式怪样的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the very decorated style of art, music, buildings etc, that was common in Europe in the 17th and early 18th centuries

detailed_translations.chinese: 巴洛克风格；巴洛克艺术
detailed_translations.english: used to describe baroque art, music, buildings etc

sentences.english: ...a hydro-electric tidal barrage.
sentences.chinese: …一座水力发电潮汐拦河坝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 弹幕；阻塞；齐射式攻击；[水利] 拦河坝
detailed_translations.english: the continuous firing of guns, dropping of bombs etc, especially to protect soldiers as they move towards an enemy

sentences.english: Thousands of years ago the surface was barren desert.
sentences.chinese: 很久很久以前，地面还是一片荒漠。

sentences.english: He prayed that his barren wife would one day have a child.
sentences.chinese: 他祈祷自己不孕的妻子有朝一日能怀上宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: (of land or soil) not good enough for plants to grow on it

sentences.english: The fans were kept back behind barricades.
sentences.chinese: 歌迷们被拦在路障后面。

detailed_translations.english: a temporary wall or fence across a road, door etc that prevents people from going through
to build a barricade to prevent someone or something from getting in

sentences.english: They have been bartering wheat for cotton and timber.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直在用小麦交换棉花和木材。

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行易货贸易；[贸易] 作物物交换；讨价还价
detailed_translations.english: to exchange goods, work, or services for other goods or services rather than for money

detailed_translations.chinese: 易货贸易；物物交换；实物交易
detailed_translations.english: a system of exchanging goods and services for other goods and services rather than using money

sentences.english: I was beguiled by the romance and exotic atmosphere of the souks in Marrakech.
sentences.chinese: 我被马拉喀什剧场浪漫的异国情调迷住了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺骗；使着迷；轻松地消磨
detailed_translations.english: to persuade or trick someone into doing something

sentences.english: ...problems that are befuddling them.
sentences.chinese: ...使他们困惑的问题。

detailed_translations.english: If something befuddles you, it confuses your mind or thoughts

sentences.english: ...flags bedecking the balcony.
sentences.chinese: ... 装饰阳台的旗子。

detailed_translations.english: to decorate something such as a building or street by hanging things all over it

detailed_translations.chinese: 痛打；抨击；过度说明；反复讨论

sentences.english: Curiger sees “a lot of commonalities between the Venetian master's quest and the eagerness of some contemporary artists to defy the conventions which beleaguer art in our time.”
sentences.chinese: Curiger 看到“在威尼斯大师的探求和当代艺术家热心反抗习俗中的许多共性，在我们这个时代，艺术被围攻，这些当代艺术家们敢公然反抗习俗。”

sentences.english: Her pleasant manner belied her true character.
sentences.chinese: 她讨人喜欢的举止掩饰了她真实的个性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩饰；与…不符；使失望；证明…虚假错误
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a false idea about something

sentences.english: the beneficent properties of natural remedies
sentences.chinese: 自然疗法的益处

detailed_translations.english: helping people, or resulting in something good

sentences.english: He shook his head in benign amusement.
sentences.chinese: 他被逗乐了，和蔼地摇了摇头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 良性的；和蔼的，亲切的；吉利的
detailed_translations.english: kind and gentle

sentences.english: Marion berated Joe for the noise he made.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽恩指责乔制造的噪声。

detailed_translations.english: to speak angrily to someone because they have done something wrong

sentences.english: She beseeched him to cut out his drinking and his smoking.
sentences.chinese: 她央求他戒酒戒烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，哀求；乞求，急切地要求得到
detailed_translations.english: to eagerly and anxiously ask someone for something

sentences.english: He has accused local people of trying to besmirch his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他指责当地人企图败坏他的名誉。

detailed_translations.english: If you besmirch someone or their reputation, you say that they are a bad person or that they have done something wrong, usually when this is not true

sentences.english: The blood supply bifurcates between eight and thirty times before reaching each particular location in the body.
sentences.chinese: 血液在到达身体各个特定部位前要分流8到30次。

detailed_translations.english: If something such as a line or path bifurcates or is bifurcated, it divides into two parts which go in different directions

name: bigot
trans: n.固执己见者，有偏见的人

sentences.english: racist bigots
sentences.chinese: 偏执的种族主义者

detailed_translations.chinese: 偏执的人；顽固者；盲信者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is bigoted

sentences.english: a few bland comments
sentences.chinese: 不痛不痒的几句评语

detailed_translations.english: without any excitement, strong opinions, or special character

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…变得淡而无味；除掉…的特性
变得平淡无奇；丧失特性

name: blandishment
trans: n.甜言蜜语，讨好某人的话

sentences.english: You know blandishment ceaselessly cannot be done by everyone.
sentences.chinese: 要知道，时刻地讨好，谁也做不到。

name: blasé
trans: adj.（过度放纵之后）厌倦享乐的，腻烦的

sentences.english: They are blasé about their driving skills.
sentences.chinese: 他们对自己的车技充满信心，以致漫不经心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 厌倦享乐的， 玩厌了的

sentences.english: I had the gas fire going full blast .
sentences.chinese: 我把煤气取暖器开到最大。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement of wind or air
to criticize someone or something very strongly – used especially in news reports

name: blatant
trans: adj.（让人生厌地）惹人注目的

sentences.english: blatant discrimination
sentences.chinese: 公然的歧视

detailed_translations.chinese: 喧嚣的；公然的；炫耀的；俗丽的
detailed_translations.english: something bad that is blatant is very clear and easy to see, but the person responsible for it does not seem embarrassed or ashamed

sentences.english: Contains a heraldic formula or phrase, typically found as part of a blazon , coat of arms, etc.

detailed_translations.english: having knowledge or experience of something

sentences.english: a 19th-century converted barn
sentences.chinese: 由19世纪谷仓改建的房子

detailed_translations.english: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

sentences.english: The public has accepted Camilla, Prince Charles’s former mistress, as his consort.
sentences.chinese: 公众接受了作为前任情妇的卡米拉成为查尔斯王子的新配偶。

sentences.english: Dressed as the Hindu deity Shiva and his consort, Parvati, children beg for money from tourists in Pushkar.
sentences.chinese: 打扮成印度教湿婆神和他的配偶帕尔瓦蒂，儿童从普什卡游客那里乞讨钱财。

detailed_translations.english: the wife or husband of a ruler

sentences.english: It was a reasonable explanation, but his voice lacked conviction .
sentences.chinese: 这解释合情合理，只是他的语气不坚定。

sentences.english: It took her so much effort to speak that what she said carried great conviction (= showed she felt sure of what she said ) .
sentences.chinese: 她费了很大的劲在说，因此说出来的话显得很确定。

sentences.english: They had no previous convictions.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有前科。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sure about something and having no doubts

sentences.english: Separate meetings had been convoked by the two opposing factions.
sentences.chinese: 这两个对立的派别各自召开了会议。

detailed_translations.english: to tell people that they must come together for a formal meeting

sentences.english: long paragraphs and convoluted sentences
sentences.chinese: 冗长的段落和费解的句子

sentences.english: The argument is rather convoluted.
sentences.chinese: 这一论点令人颇为费解。

detailed_translations.english: complicated and difficult to understand

sentences.english: ...a chicken coop.

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…关进笼子里；限制；拘禁
detailed_translations.english: to confine in a restricted area

detailed_translations.chinese: 值勤警察在警车里打瞌睡

detailed_translations.english: a building for small animals, especially chickens

sentences.english: He could drink copious amounts of beer without ill effect.
sentences.chinese: 他可以豪饮啤酒而无不适。

sentences.english: She listened to me and took copious notes .
sentences.chinese: 她边听我说话边记下大量笔记。

detailed_translations.english: existing or being produced in large quantities

sentences.english: In civil litigation, the defendant can offer to countervail creditor's rights in order to ban down creditor's litigant appeal.
sentences.chinese: 民事诉讼中被告可以减少或消灭对方诉讼请求为目的提出债权抵销的主张。

detailed_translations.english: to act or act against with equal power or force

sentences.english: When they first saw each other in royal clothing, the fine robes and shining crowns for their coronation, that was when they fell in love.
sentences.chinese: 当他们第一次看到对方穿着王室的衣服——为他们的加冕礼而穿戴的精美的袍子和华丽的王冠——时，那就是他们坠入爱河的时候。

sentences.english: What they regarded as the end of life was the very preparation for coronation; for Christ was silent that He might live again in tenfold power.
sentences.chinese: 她们所认为的生命末日，殊不知正是加冕大典的筹备过程；基督之所以静默安息，是为了在再醒时能增加十倍的力量。

sentences.english: But the world began to warm in 1650; when Charles II was crowned king of England in 1660, the coronation sparked the Enlightenment era in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 但是从1650年开始，全球开始转暖，当查理二世于1660年在英国即位时，他的加冕礼成为启动欧洲启蒙时代的转机。

detailed_translations.english: the ceremony at which someone is officially made king or queen

sentences.english: corporeal desires
sentences.chinese: 肉欲

detailed_translations.chinese: 肉体的， 身体的； 物质的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the body, rather than to the mind, feelings, or spirit

sentences.english: We now have new evidence to corroborate the defendant’s story.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在有新的证据来证实被告人的说法。

sentences.english: Experiments elsewhere corroborate these results.
sentences.chinese: 其他地方的试验也证实了这些结果。

detailed_translations.english: to provide information that supports or helps to prove someone else’s statement, idea etc

sentences.english: a highly corrosive substance
sentences.chinese: 一种腐蚀性很强的物质

detailed_translations.english: a corrosive liquid such as an acid can destroy metal, plastic etc

sentences.english: corrugated cardboard
sentences.chinese: 瓦楞纸板

detailed_translations.chinese: 波纹的；缩成皱纹的；有瓦楞的
detailed_translations.english: in the shape of waves or folds, or made like this in order to give something strength

name: cosmopolitan
trans: adj.有世界性眼光的，包容的

sentences.english: a vibrant, cosmopolitan city
sentences.chinese: 一个充满活力的国际性都市

sentences.english: a lively hotel with a cosmopolitan atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 一家有着国际化氛围的、热闹的宾馆

detailed_translations.chinese: 世界性的；世界主义的，四海一家的
detailed_translations.english: a cosmopolitan place has people from many different parts of the world – use this to show approval

detailed_translations.chinese: 四海为家者；世界主义者；世界各地都有的东西

sentences.english: He cosseted her with flowers and champagne.
sentences.chinese: 他用鲜花和香槟向她大献殷勤。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone as much care and attention as you can, especially too much

sentences.english: All colour drained from her countenance.
sentences.chinese: 她面无血色。

detailed_translations.english: your face or your expression
to accept, support, or approve of something

sentences.english: They admitted counterfeiting documents.
sentences.chinese: 他们承认伪造了文件。

sentences.english: Levi Strauss says counterfeits of the company's jeans are flooding Europe.
sentences.chinese: 利瓦伊·斯特劳斯说该公司牛仔裤的仿冒品充斥着欧洲市场。

detailed_translations.english: to copy something exactly in order to deceive people
Counterfeit is also a noun
made to look exactly like something else, in order to deceive people

sentences.english: Please countermand our order for same.
sentences.chinese: 对上述订单，请取消。

sentences.english: I can't countermand an order Winger's given.
sentences.chinese: 我无法撤销温格下达的命令。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取消，撤消；下反对命令召回
detailed_translations.english: If you countermand an order, you cancel it, usually by giving a different order

sentences.english: It could not be proved in a court of law.
sentences.chinese: 这无法在法庭上证实。

sentences.english: The court case lasted six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼持续了六个星期。

sentences.english: Four people will appear in court today, charged with fraud.
sentences.chinese: 今天将有四个人因被指控犯有欺诈罪出庭受审。

sentences.english: The court ruled that no compensation was due.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判决不予赔偿。

sentences.english: She threatened to take the magazine to court (= take legal action against them ) if they didn’t publish an immediate apology.
sentences.chinese: 她威胁说如果这家杂志不立刻刊登道歉声明，她就要把他们告上法庭。

detailed_translations.english: the place where a trial is held, or the people there, especially the judge and the jury who examine the evidence and decide whether someone is guilty or not guilty

sentences.english: covert operations
sentences.chinese: 秘密行动

detailed_translations.chinese: 隐藏处；树丛；蔽覆羽翮基部的羽毛
detailed_translations.english: a group of thick bushes where animals can hide

detailed_translations.chinese: 隐蔽的；隐密的；偷偷摸摸的；在丈夫保护下的
detailed_translations.english: secret or hidden

sentences.english: Our cow is carrying again.
sentences.chinese: 我家的母牛又怀胎了。

sentences.english: The cow is expected to calve next week.
sentences.chinese: 这头母牛预期下周生小牛。

sentences.english: The cow cast a calf.
sentences.chinese: 这头母牛早产了。

detailed_translations.english: a large female animal that is kept on farms and used to produce milk or meat

sentences.english: cowardice in the face of danger
sentences.chinese: 面临危险时候的胆怯

detailed_translations.english: lack of courage

sentences.english: The hostages cowered in their seats.
sentences.chinese: 这些人质蜷缩在其座位上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 退缩；抖缩；蜷缩；弯腰屈膝
detailed_translations.english: to bend low and move back because you are frightened
to trick or deceive someone

sentences.english: The kitchen was small and cramped.
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房又小又窄。

sentences.english: a cramped apartment
sentences.chinese: 狭小的公寓套房

sentences.english: The troops slept in cramped conditions with up to 20 in a single room.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们睡在拥挤的环境里，一个房间多达20人。

detailed_translations.english: a cramped room, building etc does not have enough space for the people in it

detailed_translations.chinese: 用夹钳夹；约束（cramp的过去分词）

sentences.english: a crass remark
sentences.chinese: 粗鲁的言语

sentences.english: an act of crass stupidity
sentences.chinese: 愚蠢的行为

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a stupid and offensive way which shows that you do not understand or care about other people’s feelings

sentences.english: an insecure child who craves attention
sentences.chinese: 缺乏安全感、渴望被关注的孩子

detailed_translations.english: to have an extremely strong desire for something

name: craven
trans: adj.非常懦弱的，因胆小而遭人鄙视的

sentences.english: He had a craven fear of flying.
sentences.chinese: 他非常害怕乘飞机。

detailed_translations.english: completely lacking courage

sentences.english: a contingency plan
sentences.chinese: 应变计划

sentences.english: Add up your outgoings, putting on a bit more for contingencies.
sentences.chinese: 把你的经常性开支加起来，再增加些钱用于意外开支。

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶然性， 可能性； 意外事件； 附带事件
detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that might happen in the future, especially one that could cause problems

sentences.english: Good studies are needed to lend credence to the notion that genuine progress can be made in this important field.
sentences.chinese: 要有优秀的研究才能使人相信在这一重大领域能取得真正的进步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 信任；凭证；祭器台（等于credence table，credenza）
detailed_translations.english: the acceptance of something as true

sentences.english: Quinn charmed credulous investors out of millions of dollars.
sentences.chinese: 奎因花言巧语从轻信的投资者那里骗取了数百万美元。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻信的；因轻信而产生的
detailed_translations.english: always believing what you are told, and therefore easily deceived

sentences.english: He crept back up the stairs, trying to avoid the ones that creaked.
sentences.chinese: 他蹑手蹑脚地回楼上，尽量避开那些嘎吱作响的梯级。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；蔓延；慢慢地移动；起鸡皮疙瘩
detailed_translations.english: if something such as an insect, small animal, or car creeps, it moves slowly and quietly

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者

sentences.english: The shouting rose to a deafening crescendo .
sentences.chinese: 喊叫声越来越响，到了震耳欲聋的强度。

sentences.english: The curtains opened as the music reached a crescendo .
sentences.chinese: 当音乐到达高潮时，大幕拉开了。

detailed_translations.english: if a sound or a piece of music rises to a cre-scendo, it gradually becomes louder until it is very loud

sentences.english: exotic birds with colourful crests
sentences.chinese: 羽冠鲜艳多彩的珍禽

detailed_translations.english: the top or highest point of something such as a hill or a wave
to reach the top of a hill or mountain

sentences.english: He came back looking crestfallen .
sentences.chinese: 他回来时看上去垂头丧气的。

detailed_translations.english: looking disappointed and upset

name: cronyism
trans: n. 任人唯亲，对好友的偏袒

detailed_translations.chinese: 任人唯亲； 对好朋友的偏袒
detailed_translations.english: the practice of unfairly giving the best jobs to your friends when you are in a position of power - used to show disapproval

sentences.english: The crooks got away across the park.
sentences.chinese: 那些骗子穿过公园跑掉了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 骗子，坏蛋；弯处，弯曲部分；钩状物
detailed_translations.english: a dishonest person or criminal
if you crook your finger or your arm, you bend it

sentences.english: Sinatra crooning mellow tunes
sentences.chinese: 歌声柔和醇厚的西纳特拉

sentences.english: ‘My child,’ Sarah crooned.
sentences.chinese: “我的孩子。”萨拉柔声说道。

detailed_translations.english: to sing or speak in a soft gentle voice, especially about love

sentences.english: All aspects of the printers system performance culminate at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上的所有方面的印表机系统的性能达到高潮。

sentences.english: We are approaching a Galactic wave right now and it will culminate in the Event.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在即将迎接一道银河能量波，而事件会在这道能量波达到高潮时发生。

name: crucial
trans: adj. 非常重要的，决定性的

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

sentences.english: She crumpled the paper in her hand.
sentences.chinese: 她把手中的纸揉成了一团。

sentences.english: She crumpled up her coffee cup.
sentences.chinese: 她挤瘪了咖啡杯。

detailed_translations.english: If you crumple something such as paper or cloth, or if it crumples, it is squashed and becomes full of untidy creases and folds
Crumple up means the same as

sentences.english: As things got worse at work, he began to use alcohol as a crutch.
sentences.chinese: 工作每况愈下，他就开始借酒消愁。

detailed_translations.english: one of a pair of long sticks that you put under your arms to help you walk when you have hurt your leg

detailed_translations.chinese: 关键；难题；十字架形，坩埚

sentences.english: This thrilling story will keep you on the edge of your seat as you explore the house, collect items and unravel cryptic secrets.
sentences.chinese: 这惊心动魄的故事，将让你在你的座位边，为您探索的房子，收集物品和解开神秘的秘密。

sentences.english: It was the cryptic first sign of a cyberespionage and information-warfare campaign devised to disrupt the 2016 presidential election, the first such attempt by a foreign power in American history.
sentences.chinese: 这是一场网络间谍—信息战行动的第一个神秘迹象，该行动旨在干扰2016年的总统大选，在美国的历史上，这还是第一次有外国势力有这样的举动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的； 含义模糊的
detailed_translations.english: having a meaning that is mysterious or not easily understood

name: culpable
trans: adj. 该受谴责的，有罪的

sentences.english: Both parties were held to be to some extent culpable.
sentences.chinese: 双方都被追究了一定的责任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有罪的；该责备的；不周到的；应受处罚的
detailed_translations.english: deserving blame

sentences.english: We cultivated maize and watermelons.
sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: to plant and take care of a particular crop

sentences.english: Doctors are complaining that the system is cumbersome and bureaucratic.
sentences.chinese: 医生抱怨说该体制复杂繁琐，很官僚。

sentences.english: cumbersome procedures
sentences.chinese: 繁琐的程序

detailed_translations.chinese: 笨重的；累赘的；难处理的
detailed_translations.english: a process or system that is cumbersome is slow and difficult

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

name: curmudgeon
trans: n. 脾气坏的、爱抱怨的人

sentences.english: ...such a terrible old curmudgeon.
sentences.chinese: ...一个脾气如此糟糕的老头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脾气坏的人，乖戾的人；吝啬鬼；存心不良的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is often annoyed or angry, especially an old person

name: cursory
trans: adj. 匆忙的，不注意细节的

sentences.english: Burke cast a cursory glance at the menu, then flapped it shut.
sentences.chinese: 伯克粗略瞥了眼菜单，然后啪地合上了。

detailed_translations.english: done very quickly without much attention to details

name: curt
trans: adj. 言辞简略的，直接（以致显得粗鲁）的

sentences.english: With a curt nod, he turned away and sat down.
sentences.chinese: 他简慢地点点头就转身坐下了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 简略的；简要的；草率的；简单粗暴的
(Curt)人名；(法)屈尔；(英)柯特；(德、西、芬、罗、瑞典)库尔特

sentences.english: The new law will curtail police powers.
sentences.chinese: 这条新法规将削弱警方的权力。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce or limit something

sentences.english: Even hardened cynics believe the meeting is a step towards peace.
sentences.chinese: 就连最顽固的愤世嫉俗者也认为这次会议向和平迈出了一步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤世嫉俗者；犬儒学派的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is not willing to believe that people have good, honest, or sincere reasons for doing something

sentences.english: He dabbled in business.
sentences.chinese: 他曾涉足商界。

detailed_translations.english: to do something or be involved in something in a way that is not very serious

sentences.english: a daft idea
sentences.chinese: 傻主意

sentences.english: Me, jealous? Don’t be daft (= that is a silly idea ) .
sentences.chinese: 我嫉妒？别犯傻了。

sentences.english: She’s as daft as a brush (= extremely silly ) .
sentences.chinese: 她傻得要命。

detailed_translations.english: silly

sentences.english: a dazzling display of football skills
sentences.chinese: 让人眼花缭乱的足球技巧表演

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人眼花缭乱的， 耀眼的
detailed_translations.english: a light that is dazzling is very bright and makes you unable to see properly for a short time

sentences.english: The spikes are believed to be caused by an electrical malfunction; the thud is thought, at least by some, to be just a ventilator damper.
sentences.chinese: 操作员们认为仪表显示峰值只是因为电气故障，而巨响被认为是通风阻尼器所发出的声音，至少有一部分人这么认为。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that stops a piano string from making a sound

name: dandy
trans: n. 纨绔子弟，爱打扮的人

sentences.english: We’re at our hotel, and everything is fine and dandy .
sentences.chinese: 我们在自己的宾馆里，一切都非常好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上等的，极好的（口语）；服装华丽的
detailed_translations.english: very good – often used in a slightly humorous way
a man who spends a lot of time and money on his clothes and appearance

sentences.english: a dank prison cell
sentences.chinese: 阴冷的牢房

detailed_translations.english: unpleasantly wet and cold

sentences.english: a dapper little man in a grey suit
sentences.chinese: 一身灰西装、打扮利落的小个子男人

detailed_translations.chinese: 短小精悍的；衣冠楚楚的；整洁的；整齐的
detailed_translations.english: a man who is dapper is nicely dressed, has a neat appearance, and is usually small or thin

detailed_translations.chinese: (Dapper)人名；(英)达珀；(意)达珀尔；(德)达佩尔

sentences.english: the dappled shade of the trees
sentences.chinese: 斑驳的树影

detailed_translations.english: marked with spots of colour, light, or shade

detailed_translations.chinese: 起斑纹（dapple的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: A new circus is in town, with Siberian white tigers and daredevil bikers.
sentences.chinese: 镇里来了一个新的马戏团，有西伯利亚白老虎和不怕死的自行车表演客。

detailed_translations.english: Daredevil people enjoy doing physically dangerous things

detailed_translations.chinese: 胆大的人， 冒失的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who likes doing dangerous things

name: dart
trans: vi. 突然移动，猛冲，狂奔

sentences.english: a poisoned dart
sentences.chinese: 毒镖

sentences.english: She darted a sly sideways glance at Bramwell.
sentences.chinese: 她狡猾地斜瞟了布莱威尔一眼。

detailed_translations.english: a small pointed object that is thrown or shot as a weapon, or one that is thrown in the game of darts
If you dart a look at someone or something, or if your eyes dart to them, you look at them very quickly
to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction

sentences.english: He felt utterly daunted by the prospect of moving to another country.
sentences.chinese: 他一想到要移居别的国家就感到十分害怕。

sentences.english: Don’t be daunted by all the technology.
sentences.chinese: 不要被所有这些技术给吓住。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel afraid or less confident about something

name: deadpan
trans: n. 无趣的，无生气的，不活泼的

sentences.english: EXCEPT as Pearl, in the dearth of human playmates, was thrown more upon the visionary throng which she created.
sentences.chinese: 只不过是由于缺乏玩伴，她同自己创造出来的幻想中的人群更加接近而己。

sentences.english: So for now, this dearth of data means that scientists must rely on climate models to estimate the effects of large-scale burning by aborigines.

sentences.english: See there is no dearth of knowledge and entrepreneurial skills in we Indians. The only question is that shall we be considered while opting for technology from abroad?

sentences.english: But even your dreams will be but a pale shadow of my true decadence.

sentences.english: America a is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between.
sentences.chinese: 美国是唯一一个直接从野蛮进入颓废、中间没有经过文明阶段的社会。 ?。

trans: vt. 对…有清晰的想法，理解，解读

sentences.chinese: ...能够存在于战争中的绝对堕落。

sentences.chinese: 作为律师，我会反对在现阶段对基因疗法进行任何形式的法律管制。

sentences.chinese: 尽管环境没有嘴巴来反对人类对她所做的一切，她通过行动来报复。

sentences.chinese: 新车掉价很快。

sentences.chinese: 英国不景气的房产市场

sentences.chinese: 她感到孤独和沮丧。

sentences.chinese: 缺乏睡眠会引起精神紊乱。

sentences.chinese: 你不应该嘲笑他们的努力。

sentences.chinese: 金融衍生品市场

sentences.chinese: 我们的飞机开始下降。

sentences.chinese: 这个装置能先把盐水蒸干，再让水蒸气冷凝成可饮用的水。

sentences.chinese: 尽管许多轮虫生活在干燥的栖息地，如短时间的小水塘，但是有许多轮虫却生活在不会干涸的多水环境里。

sentences.english: Tympanic center leaves the alveolus of one desiccate.
sentences.chinese: 鼓膜中心则留下一变干的小孔。

sentences.english: This floor has been designated a no-smoking area.
sentences.chinese: 这楼层已定为无烟区。

sentences.english: Buildings are designated by red squares on the map.
sentences.chinese: 在地图上建筑物用红色方块标明。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that sth has a particular character or name; to describe sth in a particular way

sentences.english: It’s despicable the way he treats those kids.
sentences.chinese: 他那样对待那些孩子，真卑鄙。

sentences.english: a despicable act of terrorism
sentences.chinese: 卑劣的恐怖主义行径

sentences.english: a despicable crime
sentences.chinese: 卑鄙的罪行

sentences.chinese: 她看不起她的邻居。

name: desultory

sentences.chinese: 他们随意地谈了一小会儿。

sentences.chinese: 两名嫌疑人被警方拘留审问。

sentences.chinese: 他因紧急事务耽搁在了华盛顿。

sentences.chinese: 当我走到居委会时，看到前面在修路，于是我绕道而行，从另外一条小路走回家。

sentences.english: But what if you could take a detour through a lobby that exhibits art, or down a lane that borders a green space?
sentences.chinese: 但是，你愿不愿意绕道穿过一个陈列着艺术品的大厅，或者行走在一条毗邻绿色空间的小巷子？

sentences.chinese: 一个在伦敦公共汽车上的一个会议在一个珠宝窃贼夫人克莉丝汀采取了转为医生的最坏的时候，公共汽车需要绕道沙漠般的行星，那里的致命的群等待。

detailed_translations.english: to make a detour

sentences.english: Indeed, once this detritus of our ignorant past has been cleared away, we might see more clearly the nature of good, and pursue it aright at last.
sentences.chinese: 的确，一旦当我们这些琐碎的无知正为过去，我们将看到更加清晰的自然地面目，并且永远追随正确的步伐。

detailed_translations.english: pieces of waste that remain after something has been broken up or used

sentences.chinese: 虔诚的天主徒

detailed_translations.english: someone who is devout has a very strong belief in a religion

name: diaphanous
trans: adj.(质地精致得）几乎透明的

sentences.chinese: ...一件浅金色薄得几乎透明的裙子。

detailed_translations.english: diaphanous cloth is so thin that you can almost see through it

sentences.chinese: 该书是对学术左派的抨击。

sentences.chinese: 他的小说有一种道德说教的口吻。

detailed_translations.english: speech or writing that is didactic is intended to teach people a moral lesson

trans: adj. 顽固的，保守的 n. 顽固的人，保守的人

trans: adj. 鸽派的，爱好和平的

sentences.chinese: 他们的观点很快在欧洲传播开来。

sentences.english: I've digressed a little to explain the situation so far, so let me now recap.

detailed_translations.english: slow in doing something

name: dilettante
trans: n./adj. 业余爱好者（对艺术或知识领域涉猎浅薄者）/缺乏专业技术的

sentences.english: He tolerated the presence of an amateur, idler and dilettante and proved a perfect teacher and matchless travel companion.
sentences.chinese: 他能够容忍我这个业余爱好者的浅薄与无知，当之无愧是一个好老师和一个无与伦比的好伙伴。

sentences.chinese: 这也是一个鼓励业余爱好者深思的现象层。

浅薄的；业余艺术爱好的
（在艺术、科学等方面）浅尝辄止

sentences.english: a diligent student
sentences.chinese: 勤勉的学生

detailed_translations.chinese: 勤勉的；用功的，费尽心血的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is diligent works hard and is careful and thorough

detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

sentences.english: a dingy room
sentences.chinese: 阴暗邋遢的房间

sentences.english: a dingy side-street
sentences.chinese: 昏暗肮脏的小街

detailed_translations.english: dark, dirty, and in bad condition

name: diplomatic
trans: adj. 使用策略的，机智的

sentences.chinese: 停战的外交努力于10月25日开始。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving the work of diplomats

sentences.chinese: 要让叛乱分子解除武装并非易事。

sentences.chinese: 你需要一大串数据才能认清这一趋势。

sentences.english: We could just discern a town in the distance.

detailed_translations.english: to notice or understand something by thinking about it carefully

sentences.english: Sewage is discharged directly into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 污水被直接排放到海里。

sentences.english: the discharge of toxic waste into the sea

when gas, liquid, smoke etc is sent out, or the substance that is sent out

sentences.chinese: …一位信徒遍布欧洲的重要知识分子。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes in the ideas of a great teacher or leader, especially a religious one

sentences.chinese: 州长撤下他计划将让他尤其难堪。

detailed_translations.english: disagreement or arguing between people

sentences.chinese: 然而，我也相信询问、质疑、探索与怀疑，但拒绝轻信或盲从的信仰。

sentences.english: Lily: : But the interviewers don't think so, they discredit the unmarried women above the normal age have mentality defects, although they are turly bright people.
sentences.chinese: 但是面试官却认为年龄这么大了还没结婚也没男朋友，怀疑她们有心理缺陷，尽管她们确实是人才。 。

detailed_translations.english: the loss of other people’s respect or trust

sentences.chinese: 关于共同起源的理论，有一种改进的论点解释了密度的不符。

sentences.chinese: 英国报界不再觉得他们非得审慎对待王室不可了。

sentences.chinese: 法庭的酌情决定权

sentences.english: Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.

sentences.chinese: 极为鄙视的样子

sentences.chinese: 农场工人的子女越来越不愿意务农的趋势

sentences.chinese: 先用碘酒给伤口消毒。

sentences.chinese: 把这个区域彻底消毒。

sentences.chinese: 律师应该提供客观公正的建议。

sentences.chinese: 拖到绘图页上，然后将外部分离强制约束形状连接到被约束的角色。

sentences.chinese: 他向美国请求即时援助，拆除弹头。

sentences.chinese: 想到要离开，他心里充满了忧伤。

sentences.english: The committee was dismayed by what it had been told.
sentences.chinese: 该委员会被所告知的情况搞得焦虑不安。

sentences.chinese: …拉金诋毁文学的倾向。

sentences.chinese: 涉及许多不同议题的会议

sentences.chinese: 我们作为公诉人尽量在经手的案件上不带偏见。

name: dispose

sentences.chinese: 中国花瓶摆放在展馆四周。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things or put them in their places

sentences.chinese: 他指示陪审团忽略证人的最后一句话。

sentences.chinese: 形势一对他有利，亨利就马上开始隐瞒。

sentences.english: Her findings have been widely disseminated .
sentences.chinese: 她的发现已广为传播。

detailed_translations.english: to spread information or ideas to as many people as possible

sentences.chinese: 工党因内部纷争产生分裂。

sentences.english: There are some dissenting voices (= people who do not agree ) among the undergraduates.
sentences.chinese: 大学生中有一些反对的呼声。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you disagree with an official decision or accepted opinion

sentences.english: As he thought it over, his anger gradually dissipated.
sentences.chinese: 他想明白后，怒气就渐渐消了。

sentences.english: Little by little, the smoke was dissipated by the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 在微风的吹拂下烟雾渐渐地消散了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使消散， 使消失， 驱散； 浪费， 挥霍
detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this

sentences.english: Jie was extremely tyrannical and dissolute.
sentences.chinese: 桀是个极端残暴，放荡的人。

sentences.chinese: 妮利结过两次婚，第一次嫁给了一个风流的外交官，外交官死后给他留下了大笔财富，使她成为一个有钱的女人。

sentences.english: I have also heard that he leads a dissolute lifestyle, but that is probably just a nasty rumor.

sentences.chinese: 一直搅拌到糖溶解掉。

name: dissonance

detailed_translations.english: a combination of notes that sound strange because they are not in  harmony

sentences.chinese: 医生曾试图说服病人不要抽烟。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone not to do something
