name: distal
trans: adj. 远离中心的，（神经）末梢的

sentences.english: Blood vessels in the lungs are filled and distend. Capillary changes have been observed in the animal model of simulated microgravity.
sentences.chinese: 肺血管充盈、扩张，并在模拟微重力动物模型中观察到肺微血管损伤。

sentences.english: The primary role of AM is to distend blood vessel and decrease blood pressure, and it can also restrain the migration of vessel smooth muscle cells.
sentences.chinese: AM在休克发生发展过程的作用主要是扩张血管，降低血压，还具有抑制血管平滑肌细胞迁移等作用。

sentences.english: Conclusion:Nifedipine could distend ophthalmic artery and has similar function on other micro-cerebral vessels.
sentences.chinese: 结论：硝苯地平可扩张眼动脉，对脑部其它小动脉可能有相似作用。

name: distill
trans: vt. 对…用蒸馏法提高纯度

sentences.english: distilled water
sentences.chinese: 蒸馏水

detailed_translations.english: to make a liquid such as water or alcohol more pure by heating it so that it becomes a gas and then letting it cool. Drinks such as  whisky  are made this way.

sentences.english: His account was badly distorted by the press.
sentences.chinese: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

sentences.english: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
sentences.chinese: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

detailed_translations.english: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

name: distract
trans: vt. 转移（注意力），使分心

sentences.english: Try not to distract the other students.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要让其他学生分心。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone’s attention away from something by making them look at or listen to something else

name: distraught
trans: adj. 精神狂乱的，极疯狂的

sentences.english: Relatives are tonight comforting the distraught parents.
sentences.chinese: 亲戚们今晚都在安慰这对忧心如焚的父母。

detailed_translations.english: so upset and worried that you cannot think clearly

name: diurnal
trans: adj. 白天发生或行动的

sentences.english: Kangaroos are diurnal animals.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠是昼出动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 白天的；每日的，一日间的
detailed_translations.english: happening or active in the daytime

sentences.english: The two species diverged millions of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这两个物种从数百万年前开始朝不同方向演变。

sentences.english: Global growth rates are diverging markedly.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地的增长率在发生明显的分化。

detailed_translations.english: if similar things diverge, they develop in different ways and so are no longer similar

sentences.english: ...the cultural diversity of Latin America.
sentences.chinese: …拉丁美洲文化的多样性。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of including many different types of people or things

sentences.english: Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.
sentences.chinese: 北行车辆将不得不绕次要道路行驶。

sentences.english: The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
sentences.chinese: 战争把民众的注意力从经济状况上移开了。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth change direction

sentences.english: Officials refuse to divulge details of the negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 官员们拒绝透露谈判的细节。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone information that should be secret

name: dodder
trans: vi. 蹒跚，颤巍巍地行进

sentences.english: He ran across the courtyard, dodging a storm of bullets.
sentences.chinese: 他跑过院子，躲避雨点般的子弹。

detailed_translations.english: to move quickly to avoid someone or something
to deliberately avoid discussing something or doing something

detailed_translations.chinese: 托辞， 伎俩； 躲闪， 躲避
detailed_translations.english: something dishonest that is done to avoid a rule or law

sentences.english: The peasants doff their hats.
sentences.chinese: 农夫们脱去他们的帽子。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the hat you are wearing as a sign of respect

sentences.english: a dogged determination to succeed
sentences.chinese: 不屈不挠的成功决心

detailed_translations.english: dogged behaviour shows that you are very determined to continue doing something

name: dogmatic
trans: adj. 武断的，自以为是的

sentences.english: Her staff find her bossy and dogmatic.
sentences.chinese: 她的员工认为她爱指挥别人而且自以为是。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is dogmatic is completely certain of their beliefs and expects other people to accept them without arguing

sentences.english: Fay is in the doldrums today.
sentences.chinese: 今天费伊情绪低落。

detailed_translations.english: if you are in the doldrums, you are feeling sad

sentences.english: With a broken-hearted smile, he lifted a pair of dolorous eyes.
sentences.chinese: 带著伤心的微笑，他抬起了一双痛苦的眼睛。

sentences.english: Mr Carter's tone was dolorous, but there is an extraordinary lilt to Mr Obama's rhetoric which puts a bounce back into everyone's step.
sentences.chinese: 卡特的语调是忧伤的，而奥巴马的言辞给人的感觉是极其轻快的，给每一个人的前进步伐都带去了动力。

detailed_translations.english: causing or involving pain or sorrow

sentences.english: Military service entails frequent changes of domicile.
sentences.chinese: 服兵役需要频繁更换住所。

detailed_translations.chinese: 住宅；永久居住地；期票支付场所
detailed_translations.english: the place where someone lives

sentences.english: The dominant male gorilla is the largest in the group.
sentences.chinese: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。

sentences.english: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。

sentences.english: its dominant position within the group
sentences.chinese: 它在该组织中的突出地位

detailed_translations.chinese: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
detailed_translations.english: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things

sentences.english: He donned his cloak and gloves.
sentences.chinese: 他穿戴上他的披风和手套。

detailed_translations.chinese: 先生，阁下；指导教师，大学教师
detailed_translations.english: a university teacher, especially one who teaches at the universities of Oxford or Cambridge
to put on a hat, coat etc

sentences.english: We urgently need more assistance from donor countries (= countries that give money, food etc to help in poor countries or disaster areas ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们急需捐赠国的更多援助。

sentences.english: An anonymous donor (= whose name is unknown ) has given £500 towards the restoration fund.
sentences.chinese: 一位匿名捐赠者向重建基金捐了500英镑。

sentences.english: ...the severe shortage of donor organs.
sentences.chinese: …捐献器官的严重匮乏。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group etc that gives something, especially money, to help an organization or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 捐献的；经人工授精出生的
detailed_translations.english: Donor organs or parts are organs or parts of the body which people allow doctors to use to help people who are ill

name: doodle
trans: vi. 漫无目的地打发时光

sentences.english: He looked across at Jackson, doodling on his notebook.
sentences.chinese: 他一边看着对面的杰克逊，一边在笔记本上信手涂鸦。

sentences.english: Dillworthy was staring into space, with a scrawl of doodles on the pad in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 迪尔沃西凝望着天空，面前的纸上满是涂鸦。

detailed_translations.english: When someone doodles, they draw doodles
A doodle is a pattern or picture that you draw when you are bored or thinking about something else

sentences.english: a huge dormant volcano
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的休眠火山

detailed_translations.chinese: 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的
detailed_translations.english: not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later

sentences.english: ...a dour, taciturn man.
sentences.chinese: …一个阴沉、寡言的男人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严厉的；顽强的；阴沉的；不爱讲话的
detailed_translations.english: serious, never smiling, and unfriendly

sentences.english: The pumps were started and the crew began to douse the fire with water.
sentences.chinese: 抽水机启动了，船员们开始用水将火浇灭。

detailed_translations.english: to stop a fire from burning by pouring water on it

name: downplay
trans: vt. 轻描淡写，不予重视

sentences.english: White House officials attempted to downplay the President’s role in the affair.
sentences.chinese: 白宫官员试图为总统在这一事件中的责任开脱。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem less important than it really is

sentences.english: A sense of impending doom (= coming very soon ) gripped her.
sentences.chinese: 她心头被一种大难临头的感觉所笼罩。

sentences.english: The plan was doomed from the start.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划一开始就注定要失败。

detailed_translations.english: something very bad that is going to happen, or the fact that it is going to happen
to make someone or something certain to fail, die, be destroyed etc

name: doyen
trans: n. 有经验的人，资深人士，老司机

sentences.english: Grandad was dozing in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 爷爷在椅子上打瞌睡。

detailed_translations.english: to sleep lightly for a short time

name: draconian
trans: adj. 极其严酷的；十分严厉的

sentences.english: ...indications that there would be no draconian measures to lower U.S. health care costs.
sentences.chinese: …迹象表明将不会有严厉的措施来降低美国的医疗成本。

detailed_translations.english: very strict and cruel

sentences.english: ‘Can’t do that,’ he drawled languidly.
sentences.chinese: “不能那样做。” 他懒洋洋地拖着长音。

sentences.english: Jack's southern drawl had become more pronounced as they'd travelled southward.
sentences.chinese: 随着他们愈往南行，杰克拖腔拉调的南方口音就愈发明显了。

detailed_translations.english: to speak slowly, with vowel sounds that are longer than usual

detailed_translations.chinese: 慢吞吞拉长调子的说话方式
detailed_translations.english: Drawl is also a noun

sentences.english: the same dreary routine
sentences.chinese: 一成不变的、乏味的日常事务

sentences.english: a dreary winter’s day
sentences.chinese: 沉闷的冬日

detailed_translations.english: dull and making you feel sad or bored

sentences.english: They turned fire hoses on the people and drenched them.
sentences.chinese: 他们打开消防水龙头朝人群喷去，把他们浇湿。

sentences.english: ...the idea of spending two whole days hanging on to a raft and getting drenched by icy water.
sentences.chinese: …在筏子上飘流整整两天并让冰冷的水湿透的想法。

detailed_translations.english: To drench something or someone means to make them completely wet

sentences.english: The question is whether one should work for a company that spouts cretinous drivel.
sentences.chinese: 问题的实质是，一个人是否应该为一家滔滔不绝说废话的公司工作。

sentences.english: Why do they want to stir North Korea upmore with their lefty drivel , these people have enough problems .
sentences.chinese: 为什么要用他们左翼的胡言乱语来搅动朝鲜呢，朝鲜已经面临足够多问题了。

sentences.english: What absolute drivel!
sentences.chinese: 一派胡言！

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something that is written or said as drivel, you are critical of it because you think it is very silly

sentences.english: a shy diminutive man
sentences.chinese: 一个腼腆的矮个子男人

detailed_translations.english: small

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱称；指小词；身材极小的人
detailed_translations.english: a word formed by adding a diminutive suffix

name: drone
trans: v. 低沉单调地说；嗡嗡地叫

sentences.english: An airplane droned overhead.
sentences.chinese: 一架飞机在头顶上轰鸣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雄蜂；嗡嗡的声音；懒惰者
detailed_translations.english: a continuous low dull sound
to make a continuous low dull sound

name: drudgery
trans: n. 苦工；单调、卑贱或无趣的工作

sentences.english: People want to get away from the drudgery of their everyday lives.
sentences.chinese: 人们想摆脱日常生活中的苦差事。

detailed_translations.english: hard boring work

name: dubious
trans: adj. 充满不定性的，值得怀疑的

sentences.english: The firm was accused of dubious accounting practices.
sentences.chinese: 该公司被指控有不诚实的会计行为。

sentences.english: Many critics regard this argument as dubious or, at best, misleading.
sentences.chinese: 许多批评家认为这一论点靠不住，或者说至少有误导性。

sentences.english: The assumption that growth in one country benefits the whole world is highly dubious .
sentences.chinese: 一国的经济增长会对全世界有益的假设是很值得怀疑的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的， 犹豫不决的， 无把握的； 有问题的； 靠不住的
detailed_translations.english: probably not honest, true, right etc

sentences.english: In turn, this prevents issues concerning corrosion, as the ductile material doesn't crack.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这也避免了一些腐蚀性问题，比如一些可延展的材料不易开裂。

detailed_translations.english: ductile metals can be pressed or pulled into shape without needing to be heated

name: dulcet
trans: adj. 悦耳的，令人愉悦的

sentences.english: Basil’s dulcet tones could be heard in the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 巴兹尔那 “悦耳” 的嗓音在走廊里都听得见。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s voice – used humorously

sentences.english: In this well-educated family, Darwin was considered to be rather dull. At one time his school headmaster called him a dullard.
sentences.chinese: 在这个很有文化涵养的家庭里，达尔文被看成是相当地迟钝。有一次，他的校长称他是笨蛋。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is stupid and has no imagination

sentences.english: He was accused of being a dupe of the Americans.
sentences.chinese: 他被控是美国人的傀儡。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is tricked, especially into becoming involved in something illegal
to trick or deceive someone

sentences.english: He is a possessive, duplicitous, and unreasonable man.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个占有欲强，奸诈而又不讲理的男人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两面派的， 奸诈的； 双重的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is duplicitous is deceitful

sentences.english: The elephant population is dwindling.
sentences.chinese: 大象的数量在减少。

sentences.english: His money had dwindled away.
sentences.chinese: 他的钱在逐渐变少。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller

detailed_translations.chinese: 消化不良的； 不高兴的
detailed_translations.english: suffering from dyspepsia

sentences.english: a rather earnest young man
sentences.chinese: 相当认真的一个年轻人

sentences.english: Matthews was in earnest conversation with a young girl.
sentences.chinese: 马修斯在和一个年轻姑娘认真地谈话。

sentences.english: an earnest desire to offer something useful to society
sentences.chinese: 为社会做贡献的真诚愿望

detailed_translations.english: very serious and sincere
if something starts happening in earnest, it begins properly – used when it was happening in a small or informal way before

name: embryonic
trans: adj. 初期的，萌芽阶段的

sentences.english: embryonic development
sentences.chinese: 胚胎的发育

sentences.english: embryonic cells
sentences.chinese: 胚胎细胞

detailed_translations.english: relating to an embryo

sentences.english: There was Helena eavesdropping outside the door.
sentences.chinese: 海伦娜当时在门外偷听。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately listen secretly to other people’s conversations

sentences.english: ...the ebullient Russian president.
sentences.chinese: …精力充沛的俄罗斯总统。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as ebullient, you mean that they are lively and full of enthusiasm or excitement about something

name: eccentric
trans: adj. 行为出格的，不循规蹈矩的

sentences.english: His eccentric behaviour lost him his job.
sentences.chinese: 他古怪的行为使他丢了工作。

sentences.english: Aunt Nessy was always a bit eccentric.
sentences.chinese: 内西姑妈总是有点古怪。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is unusual and different from most people
someone who behaves in a way that is different from what is usual or socially accepted

name: eclipse
trans: vt. 使声望下降，使黯然失色

sentences.english: The economy had eclipsed the environment as an election issue.
sentences.chinese: 经济作为竞选话题已经盖过环境问题。

detailed_translations.english: to become more important, powerful, famous etc than someone or something else, so that they are no longer noticed
an occasion when the sun or the moon cannot be seen, because the Earth is passing directly between the moon and the sun, or because the moon is passing directly between the Earth and the sun

sentences.english: ...a state of almost religious ecstasy.
sentences.chinese: …一种近乎宗教极乐的状态。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of extreme happiness

name: ecumenical
trans: adj. 世界范围的，普遍性的

detailed_translations.chinese: 世界范围的， 普遍的

sentences.english: These berries are edible, but those are poisonous.
sentences.chinese: 这些浆果可以吃，但那些有毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可以吃的， 可食用的
detailed_translations.english: something that is edible can be eaten

sentences.english: Their head office was an imposing edifice.
sentences.chinese: 他们的总部大楼是一幢宏伟建筑。

detailed_translations.english: a building, especially a large one

name: efface
trans: vt. 擦掉，抹去；使不明显

sentences.english: Nothing can efface the last picture I have of them from my mind.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能抹去他们在我脑海中留下的最后印象。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抹去，抹掉；使自己不受人注意
detailed_translations.english: to destroy or remove something

sentences.english: effete intellectuals
sentences.chinese: 软弱的知识分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰老的；疲惫的；（土地）贫瘠的；（动植物）不育的

name: effrontery
trans: n. 厚颜无耻，放肆大胆

sentences.english: The man had the effrontery to be sarcastic.
sentences.chinese: 那个男人有冷嘲热讽的放肆劲。

detailed_translations.english: rude behaviour that shocks you because it is so confident
beautiful and bright

name: effusive
trans: adj. 感情泛滥的/溢于言表的；感情表达不节制的/过度的；过分多情的

sentences.english: Our host gave us an effusive welcome.
sentences.chinese: 主人热情地欢迎我们。

detailed_translations.english: showing your good feelings in a very excited way

sentences.english: an egalitarian society
sentences.chinese: 人人平等的社会

detailed_translations.english: based on the belief that everyone is equal and should have equal rights

name: egoistic
trans: adj. 利己的，以自我为中心的

sentences.english: It is not restricted to egoistic goals, much less to economic goals.
sentences.chinese: 它并不限于那种自私自利的目标，也不仅仅是经济上的目标。

sentences.english: The dangers of introspection exist mostly if he is to revel in egoistic thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要通过自省揭示自私自利的想法，潜藏的危险更大。

sentences.english: This is probably the only aspect of life where egoistic adults can leave their success, money, freedom and independence behind for just another chance.
sentences.chinese: 这一点也许是唯一能让自私自利的成年人抛去成功、金钱、自由以及独立性以求新生。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自私自利的，自我中心的

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

name: elastic
trans: adj. 能（迅速从伤痛中）恢复的

sentences.english: a piece of elastic
sentences.chinese: 一根橡皮带

sentences.english: the horny elastic pad in a horse’s hoof
sentences.chinese: 马蹄上粗硬而有弹性的肉掌

detailed_translations.english: a type of rubber material that can stretch and then return to its usual length or size
a material that is elastic can stretch and then go back to its usual length or size

sentences.english: His eye, elate with happiness, was reading eagerly the tearful gaze of Haidée, when suddenly the door opened .
sentences.chinese: 当他那洋溢着幸福的眼睛正在急切地探索海黛那一对润湿眼睛里的所表达的意思的时候，房门突然打开了。

sentences.english: Don't let your sober face elate you, however;
sentences.chinese: 不过，别因为你那张清醒的面孔而得意。

sentences.english: ...a touching elegy for a lost friend.
sentences.chinese: ...致亡友的一首动人挽歌。

detailed_translations.english: a sad poem or song, especially about someone who has died

sentences.english: elephantine footsteps
sentences.chinese: 笨重的脚步声

detailed_translations.english: slow, heavy, and awkward, like an elephant

name: elevate
trans: vt. (在道德、智力、文化水平上）提升

sentences.english: Language has elevated humans above the other animals.
sentences.chinese: 语言使人类高于其他动物。

sentences.english: Gradually elevate the patient into an upright position.
sentences.chinese: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

detailed_translations.english: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

sentences.english: Kepler published his discovery of the elliptical orbits of planets in 1609. 1609
sentences.chinese: 年开普勒公布他的发现，认为行星轨道为椭圆形。

detailed_translations.english: having the shape of an ellipse

sentences.english: The full picture has not yet been elucidated.
sentences.chinese: 详细情况还没有解释清楚。

detailed_translations.english: to explain something that is difficult to understand by providing more information
to become or cause to become abnormally thin

sentences.english: Slaves were emancipated in 1834.
sentences.chinese: 奴隶于1834年获得了解放。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the political or legal rights that they did not have before

sentences.english: The United Nations imposed an arms embargo against the country.
sentences.chinese: 联合国对该国施行了武器贸易禁运。

sentences.english: The fruit was embargoed.
sentences.chinese: 水果被禁运了。

sentences.english: They embargoed oil shipments to the U.S.
sentences.chinese: 他们禁止了对美国石油船运。

detailed_translations.english: an official order to stop trade with another country

detailed_translations.chinese: 禁止， 禁止出入港口
detailed_translations.english: If goods of a particular kind are embargoed, people are not allowed to import them from a particular country or export them to a particular country

sentences.english: He's embarking on a new career as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 他正开始一个当作家的新生涯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上船； 着手， 开始工作
detailed_translations.english: to go onto a ship or a plane, or to put or take something onto a ship or plane

sentences.english: He didn’t want to embarrass her by asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 他不想提问让她尴尬。

sentences.english: The revelations in the press have embarrassed the government.
sentences.chinese: 报纸披露的事实让政府很难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困窘,使局促不安；阻碍,麻烦
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, especially in front of other people

sentences.english: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
sentences.chinese: 负罪感在她的性格里根深蒂固。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…嵌入， 扎牢； 使深留脑中
detailed_translations.english: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

sentences.english: Two managers were charged with embezzling $400,000.
sentences.chinese: 两名经理被控挪用了40万美元。

detailed_translations.english: to steal money from the place where you work

sentences.english: Emboldened by her smile, he asked her to dance.
sentences.chinese: 她的微笑让他鼓起勇气邀请她跳舞。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone more courage

detailed_translations.chinese: 使凸出；在……上作浮雕图案；装饰
detailed_translations.english: to mould or carve (a decoration or design) on (a surface) so that it is raised above the surface in low relief

sentences.english: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。

sentences.english: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣，欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

detailed_translations.english: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc

name: embroider
trans: v. （时常伴有夸张和想象内容地）详细说明

sentences.english: a richly embroidered jacket
sentences.chinese: 刺绣华美的夹克衫

detailed_translations.english: to decorate cloth by sewing a pattern, picture, or words on it with coloured threads

sentences.english: He emigrated to Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 他移民去了比利时。

detailed_translations.english: to leave your own country in order to live in another country

sentences.english: an eminent lawyer
sentences.chinese: 杰出的律师

detailed_translations.english: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

sentences.english: The choice of emollient should be made taking into account budgetary limitations and ease of supply.
sentences.chinese: 选择润肤剂应考虑到预算的多少，以及是否容易供应。

detailed_translations.english: An emollient is a liquid or cream that you put on your skin to make it softer or to reduce pain
making someone feel calmer when they have been angry

sentences.english: He hoped to emulate the success of Wilder.
sentences.chinese: 他希望效仿怀尔德的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿真；模仿；尽力赶上；同…竞争
detailed_translations.english: to do something or behave in the same way as someone else, especially because you admire them

sentences.english: a drama enacted on a darkened stage
sentences.chinese: 在灯光暗淡的舞台上演的戏剧

detailed_translations.chinese: 颁布；制定法律；扮演；发生
detailed_translations.english: to act in a play, story etc

sentences.english: ...a white enamel saucepan.
sentences.chinese: …一个白色搪瓷煮锅。

detailed_translations.english: a hard shiny substance that is put onto metal, clay etc for decoration or protection

sentences.english: The study encompasses the social, political, and economic aspects of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究涵盖了这一局势的社会、政治和经济三方面。

detailed_translations.english: to include a wide range of ideas, subjects, etc

sentences.english: He died in 1874, heavily encumbered by debt.
sentences.chinese: 他于1874年去世，负债累累。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for you to do something or for something to happen

sentences.english: Violent crime is now endemic in parts of Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥一些地区暴力犯罪成患。

detailed_translations.english: an endemic disease or problem is always present in a particular place, or among a particular group of people

sentences.english: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
detailed_translations.english: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

sentences.english: The hot sun enervated her to the point of collapse.
sentences.chinese: 热辣辣的太阳把她晒得快要晕过去了。

detailed_translations.english: to deprive of strength or vitality; weaken physically or mentally; debilitate
deprived of strength or vitality; weakened

name: enfranchise
trans: vt. 给予…权利（例如选举权）

sentences.english: The company voted to enfranchise its 120 women members.
sentences.chinese: 公司投票决定给予其120名女员工选举权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 给予选举权；给予自治权；解放，释放
detailed_translations.english: to give a group of people the right to vote

sentences.english: In such circumstances, governments must do all they can to create and engender trust among its nation’s constituents and institutions.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，政府必须尽其所能在它的国家选民和公共机构之间创造和产生信任。

sentences.english: Retrospectives on the process and working practices regularly capture the lessons learned by the project and engender a culture of continuous process improvement within the project.
sentences.chinese: 对过程和工作实践的回顾有规律地捕捉从项目中得到的经验，并在项目中造成一个持续的过程改进的文化。

sentences.english: The scene was stunning, and for a time engrossed all our attention.
sentences.chinese: 景色非常美丽，一时间把我们都完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: if something engrosses you, it interests you so much that you do not notice anything else

name: enigma
trans: n. 难以理解或解释的事物，谜

sentences.english: Iran remains an enigma for the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗对外部世界而言依然是个谜。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something or someone as an enigma, you mean they are mysterious or difficult to understand

sentences.english: Baldwin enlightened her as to the nature of the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德温给她讲解了这个实验的性质。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone more knowledge and greater understanding about something

sentences.english: I think there is an historic enmity between them.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他们之间存在着宿怨。

detailed_translations.english: Enmity is a feeling of hatred toward someone that lasts for a long time

sentences.english: art which ennobles the human race
sentences.chinese: 使人类更为崇高的艺术

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…成为贵族；使…高贵；授予爵位
detailed_translations.english: to improve your character

sentences.english: The patient's cheerful smile was just a facade ; actually she was suffering from ennui.
sentences.chinese: 那病人愉快的微笑只是表面上的；事实上她倦怠的很。

sentences.english: To overcome ennui, Orbuch said, both parties should focus on adding spice to the relationship, which can be as simple as a new restaurant or vacation spot.
sentences.chinese: 为了克服倦怠，欧布斯说，双方应集中于增加关系的情趣，这些情趣可以是简单的如一间新开的餐厅或是度假地。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being tired, bored, and unsatisfied with your life

sentences.english: I expostulate with her on the impropriety.
sentences.chinese: 因行为不当我向她提出告诫。

sentences.english: ensconced in a chair

detailed_translations.english: to establish or settle firmly or comfortably

sentences.english: If the Europeans did not reduce subsidies, a trade war would ensue.
sentences.chinese: 如果欧洲不减少补贴，贸易战将随即爆发。

detailed_translations.english: If something ensues, it happens immediately after another event, usually as a result of it

sentences.english: Bureaucracy can entangle applications for months.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主义会使申请耽搁数月之久。

detailed_translations.english: to involve someone in an argument, a relationship, or a situation that is difficult to escape from

sentences.english: These are usually episodic in nature and for the most part are a reflection of the immature central nervous system.
sentences.chinese: 这些通常在本质中表现为插曲式的，大多数情况下是未成熟的中枢神经系统的反射。

sentences.english: Examples of this would be a half-hour sitcom, a one-hour drama, an episodic documentary, a how-to program such as cooking or home repair or a reality show.
sentences.chinese: 包括半小时的情景喜剧，一小时的剧情片，一部插话式的纪录片，一个诸如烹饪或家居修补或真人秀的指引类节目。

sentences.english: To influence or lead by means of wiles; entice.
sentences.chinese: 引诱，诱骗通过使用诡计来影响或怂恿；诱使。

sentences.english: To entice all the people looking for a loo-break to stay a bit longer, locals bought the antebellum houses and turned them into restaurants and inns.
sentences.chinese: 为了诱使那些原本只想小憩一会的过客待的更久一些，当地人买下内战前的房子，改装成餐馆和旅店。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something or go somewhere, usually by offering them something that they want

sentences.english: the station entrance
sentences.chinese: 车站的入口处

sentences.english: Bridget made a dramatic entrance into the room.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特动作夸张地进了房间。

detailed_translations.english: a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a place

sentences.english: His friends entreated him not to go.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友们恳求他不要去。

sentences.english: He entreated them to delay their departure.
sentences.chinese: 他恳求他们晚些再走。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone, in a very emotional way, to do something for you

sentences.english: His voice was harsh as he enunciated each word carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他用刺耳的声音小心地一字一句地念着。

sentences.english: She enunciates very slowly and carefully.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢地、仔细地读着。

detailed_translations.english: When you enunciate a word or part of a word, you pronounce it clearly

sentences.english: Fashion is by nature ephemeral.
sentences.chinese: 从本质上说，时尚不过是一时的潮流。

detailed_translations.english: existing or popular for only a short time

sentences.english: an epic tale of mutiny on the high seas
sentences.chinese: 关于公海哗变的惊心动魄的故事

sentences.english: epic poetry
sentences.chinese: 史诗

detailed_translations.english: an epic book, poem, or film tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

detailed_translations.chinese: 史诗；叙事诗；史诗般的作品
detailed_translations.english: a book, poem, or film that tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

sentences.english: Ogre that he was, he spoke like an epicure.
sentences.chinese: 他虽是个吃人恶魔，说话倒像个美食家。

sentences.english: This cookery book is writes by a real epicure.
sentences.chinese: 这本食谱是由一位真正的美食家写的。

sentences.english: This person is a famous eccentric, be like, be addicted to eats life, got however nevertheless " epicure " appellation.
sentences.chinese: 此人是一个有名的怪人，嗜吃如命，不过却得了一个“美食家”的称呼。

detailed_translations.english: someone who enjoys good food and drink
a short sentence that expresses an idea in a clever or amusing way

sentences.english: a disastrous epilogue to his career
sentences.chinese: 他事业的灾难性终结

detailed_translations.english: a speech or piece of writing that is added to the end of a book, film, or play and discusses or explains the ending

sentences.english: But it is impossible to predict the reaction of a man accosted by another with the words "you rat" without referring to the meaning that the man spoken to attaches to the epithet.
sentences.chinese: 但是，当你不带意识地，说出别人的绰号“老鼠”的时候，你还是无法预测这个人会有怎样的反应。

sentences.english: My teen years were marked by the common epithet “Camel Jockey” and the hit AM radio song “Ahab the A-rab.”
sentences.chinese: “骆驼骑师” （Camel Jockey）和调幅电台的热门歌曲“Ahab the A-rab”是我青少年时代人们通用的绰号。

sentences.english: For her part, though, Ono found the epithet less than distressing.
sentences.chinese: 不过，对于她来说，小野发现这一绰号决不她痛心。

name: epitomize
trans: vt.代表，体现，是…的典型范例

sentences.english: This building epitomizes the spirit of the nineteenth century.
sentences.chinese: 这栋建筑体现了19世纪的时代精神。

detailed_translations.english: to be a very typical example of something

sentences.english: a young man with a naturally equable temperament
sentences.chinese: 生性温和的年轻人

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的， 不变的； 温和的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is equable remains calm and happy and does not often get annoyed

sentences.english: a society run on the principles of equity and justice
sentences.chinese: 以公平、正义为原则的社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平，公正；衡平法；普通股；抵押资产的净值
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which all people are treated equally and no one has an unfair advantage

sentences.english: I had no dollars, but offered him an equivalent amount of sterling.
sentences.chinese: 我没有美金，但给了他等值的英镑。

detailed_translations.english: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind
something that has the same value, purpose, job etc as something else

name: equivocate
trans: vi.（带有欺骗目的地）模棱两可地说，说谎话

sentences.english: He is equivocating a lot about what is going to happen if and when there are elections.
sentences.chinese: 他含含糊糊地说着很多如果进行选举会发生的状况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说模棱两可的话；支吾， 躲闪；推诿；含糊其词
detailed_translations.english: to avoid giving a clear or direct answer to a question

sentences.english: empirical evidence
sentences.chinese: 实验证据

detailed_translations.english: based on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas

sentences.english: Usually his cases involved errant husbands and wandering wives.
sentences.chinese: 通常他接手的案子都涉及出轨的丈夫和离家出走的妻子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不定的；周游的；错误的；偏离正路的
detailed_translations.english: Errant is used to describe someone whose actions are considered unacceptable or wrong by other people. For example, an errant husband is unfaithful to his wife.

sentences.english: His breathing was becoming erratic.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸越来越不均匀。

sentences.english: his erratic behaviour
sentences.chinese: 他难以捉摸的行为

detailed_translations.english: something that is erratic does not follow any pattern or plan but happens in a way that is not regular

detailed_translations.chinese: 漂泊无定的人；古怪的人

sentences.english: There’s also the intrinsic pleasure you get from boosting your knowledge and becoming more erudite.
sentences.chinese: 这也有利于你发自内心地努力奋进获得更多学识变得更博学。

sentences.english: The supreme symbol for the author is the word; the erudite Hirst in The Voyage Out has the forename St John recalling the evangelist whose opening line was ‘In the beginning was the Word’.
sentences.chinese: 文字是作家最有力的表达符号，《远航》中博学的赫斯特的教名为圣·约翰，取自感召福音的传教士之名。 他在小说中的开场白为：“语言是世界的初始”。

detailed_translations.english: showing a lot of knowledge based on careful study

sentences.english: The costs were escalating alarmingly.
sentences.chinese: 成本在以惊人的速度增长。

sentences.english: policies that escalate their own costs
sentences.chinese: 促使其自身成本增加的政策

sentences.english: escalating crime
sentences.chinese: 愈演愈烈的犯罪活动

detailed_translations.english: to become higher or increase, or to make something do this

sentences.english: I had eschewed politics in favour of a life practising law.
sentences.chinese: 我选择从事律师职业，有意避开了政治。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately avoid doing or using something

sentences.english: ...esoteric knowledge.
sentences.chinese: …深奥难懂的知识。

detailed_translations.chinese: 秘传的；限于圈内人的；难懂的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as esoteric, you mean it is known, understood, or appreciated by only a small number of people

sentences.english: She ran away with him to Mexico and espoused the revolutionary cause.
sentences.chinese: 她与他一起逃到了墨西哥，支持革命事业。

detailed_translations.english: to support an idea, belief etc, especially a political one

sentences.english: Peden was greatly esteemed by the people of Ayrshire.
sentences.chinese: 佩登深受艾尔郡人的尊敬。

sentences.english: He was esteemed as a literary wit.
sentences.chinese: 他被尊为文学才子。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something

sentences.english: ...the estimable Miss Cartwright.
sentences.chinese: ...令人仰慕的卡特赖特小姐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可估计的；可尊敬的；有价值的
detailed_translations.english: deserving respect and admiration

name: estrange
trans: vt.使疏远，离间，使感情失和

sentences.english: The more the physical causes incline mankind to inaction, the more the moral causes should estrange them from it.
sentences.chinese: 所以，物质的因素越使他们趋于懈怠时，精神的因素就越使他们远离物质的因素。

sentences.english: Their specific treatment of volume, apertures, and overall geometry interested us as tools to estrange conventional ideas of residential housing.
sentences.chinese: 该建筑在体量、孔径和整体几何形状上的处理手法都激发我们有了远离传统住宅的想法。

sentences.english: A laser is used to etch a pattern in the smooth surface of the disc.
sentences.chinese: 激光器用于在光盘的光滑表面刻录图案。

detailed_translations.english: to cut lines on a metal plate, piece of glass, stone etc to form a picture or words

sentences.english: the Christian promise of eternal life
sentences.chinese: 基督教承诺的永生

sentences.english: She’s an eternal optimist (= she always expects that good things will happen ).
sentences.chinese: 她永远是个乐观主义者。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for ever and having no end

sentences.english: ethereal beauty
sentences.chinese: 超凡的美丽

sentences.english: His music is ethereal.
sentences.chinese: 他的音乐超凡脱俗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 优雅的；轻飘的；缥缈的；超凡的
detailed_translations.english: very delicate and light, in a way that does not seem real

sentences.english: Refugee workers said such action was a violation of medical ethics.
sentences.chinese: 难民工作者称这种行为违背了医学道德。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理学；伦理观；道德标准
detailed_translations.english: Ethics are moral beliefs and rules about right and wrong

sentences.english: The poem does not eulogize the dead soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 这首诗并未歌颂阵亡的士兵。

sentences.english: Commentators are eulogizing about the 17-year-old left-hander.
sentences.chinese: 解说员都在夸赞这位17岁的左撇子选手。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something very much

sentences.english: ‘Pass away’ is a euphemism for ‘die’.
sentences.chinese: “去世”是“死”的委婉语。

detailed_translations.english: a polite word or expression that you use instead of a more direct one to avoid shocking or upsetting someone

sentences.english: The sound of whistle is euphonious , emotional, and melodic.
sentences.chinese: 口哨的音色悦耳动听，抒情性极强，极富歌唱性。

sentences.english: By accident, some sweet and euphonious proverbs made her obsessed with language learning.
sentences.chinese: 一个偶然的机会，一些美妙悦耳的谚语使她迷恋上了语言学习。

sentences.english: “The music wasn’t bad,” Kathy replied. “I thought the violin and the piano produced a euphonious combination.”
sentences.chinese: “音乐还不错，”凯西回答，“我觉得小提琴和钢琴演奏出了悦耳的合音。”

detailed_translations.english: denoting or relating to euphony; pleasing to the ear

sentences.english: There was a general atmosphere of pessimism after the euphoria of last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年的狂喜过后出现了普遍的悲观气氛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神欢快，[临床] 欣快；兴高采烈；欣快症；幸福愉快感

sentences.english: Police evacuated the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方将该地区人员全部疏散。

detailed_translations.english: to send people away from a dangerous place to a safe place

sentences.english: ...the evanescent scents of summer herbs.
sentences.chinese: ...夏季香草逐渐消散的味道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 容易消散的；逐渐消失的；会凋零的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is evanescent gradually disappears from sight or memory

sentences.english: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
sentences.chinese: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含
detailed_translations.english: to involve something as a necessary part or result

sentences.english: everlasting fame
sentences.chinese: 永久的名声

sentences.english: I just decided I was a bit too frivolous to be a doctor.

sentences.chinese: 我们小时候被教育要节俭和勤劳。

sentences.english: Goods which are not fungible shall be deemed fungible for the purposes of this act to the extent that under a particular agreement or document unlike units are treated as equivalents.
sentences.chinese: 为本法的目的，并使在一项特定协议或档中的不相似单位也可被视为相等物，则非可替代货物应被视为可替代的。

sentences.english: ...a soft but full-bodied wine with concentrated blackcurrant flavour.
sentences.chinese: ...一种不含酒精但带有浓厚的浓缩黑醋栗味道的酒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 魁梧的； 浓烈的； 重要的
detailed_translations.english: a full-bodied wine or other drink has a pleasantly strong taste

sentences.english: The newspapers fulminate against the crime.
sentences.chinese: 报纸严厉谴责这个罪行。

detailed_translations.english: to criticize someone or something angrily

sentences.english: She reached round to fumble the light on.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手摸索着去开灯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 喧闹， 轰动； 盛怒

sentences.chinese: 他的行为有点鬼鬼祟祟。

detailed_translations.english: behaving as if you want to keep something secret

sentences.chinese: 我气得发抖。

sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子挑食。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or to disagree with someone

sentences.english: He's as bitter as gall at your desertion and its consequences: don't expect thanks for this noble devotion.
sentences.chinese: 他对于你的遗弃和这后果是怨恨透啦；对于你这种高尚的爱情不要期待感谢吧。

sentences.english: a gallant attempt to save lives

sentences.chinese: 他们的宗教禁止饮酒和赌博。

to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be

detailed_translations.english: If animals or people gambol, they run or jump about in a playful way

sentences.chinese: 我用一条毛巾塞住他的嘴。

the act of garbling

sentences.chinese: “请不要嘲笑我，”利迪娅说。“我觉得自己令人讨厌，渺小，像恐怖类电影描述的那些致命的细菌那样。”

sentences.english: Don't gloat,the same misfortune may happen to you one day.

sentences.chinese: 然而，在向美国和世界宣布这个消息时，奥巴马却显的小心谨慎，没有表现出一点幸灾乐祸，因为他的前任乔治·布什任期内没有完成的事情被他完成了。

sentences.chinese: 当酷酷的大学运动员和热辣的女友坐他的爱车失事后，特别是这人有些自以为是，那么幸灾乐祸的想法是很自然会产生的。

trans: v.敷衍潦草做事（甚至忽略）

sentences.chinese: 用了这种发胶，即使最干枯的头发也会增添光泽。

sentences.chinese: 这种粘酱尝起来感觉不自然。

sentences.chinese: ...柔软粘稠的泥巴。

sentences.chinese: 提供经济援助是政治改革的推动力。

sentences.english: The gobble sound, from the male turkeys, on the other hand, sounds exactly like you’d expect from the name and they do this all the time.

sentences.chinese: 她瞪着我看。

sentences.chinese: 这种领袖人物的缺乏可能也是一个大后意识形态时代的重要象征，在这个时代，人们更少需要一个统一的教义或是一个提供给大众的浮夸形象。

name: grate

sentences.chinese: 漂亮的碧眼
