sentences.english: When it comes to spreading ridicule, the Web is now a hodgepodge of celebrity takedowns and videos of ugly brides or of kids who can't sing in the school play.
sentences.chinese: 网络已经成为传播尴尬事情的主渠道，其内容堪比大杂烩，既有名人的露丑记录，又有难看的新娘，还有在学校表演中唱不出歌的小孩子。

sentences.english: Singapore is an extraordinary hodgepodge of health care principles, but it's also a city-state whose health care system is comprised of fewer than 30 hospitals.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡的医疗体系不仅仅是一个各种医疗政策的大杂烩，可惜新加坡本身只是一个仅有30家医院的城市国家。

sentences.english: The film pays homage to Martin Scorsese’s ‘Mean Streets’.
sentences.chinese: 该影片向马丁·斯科塞斯的《穷街陋巷》致敬。

detailed_translations.english: something you do to show respect for someone or something you think is important

name: homely
trans: adj. 其貌不扬的，朴素简单的

sentences.english: homely cooking
sentences.chinese: 家常烹调

detailed_translations.english: simple and good

name: homily
trans: n. 冗长乏味的道德讲演或训诫

sentences.english: ...a receptive audience for his homily on moral values.
sentences.chinese: ...乐于倾听他关于道德价值观说教的观众。

detailed_translations.english: advice about how to behave that is often unwanted

sentences.english: plans to homogenize the various school systems
sentences.chinese: 统一各类不同学制的计划

detailed_translations.english: to change something so that its parts become similar or the same

sentences.english: Leading companies spend time and money on honing the skills of senior managers.
sentences.chinese: 龙头公司会花费时间和金钱提高高层管理人员的技能。

detailed_translations.english: a fine whetstone, esp for sharpening razors
to make knives, swords etc sharp

sentences.english: People expect others to be honest, which is why conmen find it so easy to hoodwink people.
sentences.chinese: 人们期待他人是诚实的，所以骗子很容易行骗得逞。

detailed_translations.english: to trick someone in a clever way so that you can get an advantage for yourself
tending to exhort; encouraging

sentences.english: a heartfelt apology
sentences.chinese: 真诚的道歉

detailed_translations.chinese: 衷心的；真诚的；真心真意的
detailed_translations.english: very strongly felt and sincere

sentences.english: ...a tale of how an honourable man pursuing honourable goals was afflicted with hubris and led his nation toward catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: ...一个有关追求崇高目标的磊落君子如何因自高自大、而将自己的国家引向灾难的故事。

detailed_translations.english: too much pride

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

sentences.english: You’re hedging again - have you got the money or haven’t you?
sentences.chinese: 你又在闪烁其词了，你究竟有没有钱？

sentences.english: ‘That depends on my partner,’ she hedged.
sentences.chinese: “那取决于我的合伙人。”她避重就轻地答道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 避免直接回答；   套头交易； 以套期保值避免损失
detailed_translations.english: to avoid giving a direct answer to a question

detailed_translations.chinese: 保值措施；套期保值；树篱；防备；障碍物；套头，两面下注以避免损失
detailed_translations.english: a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, usually dividing one field or garden from another

sentences.english: I like your sense of humor.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢你的 幽默感。

sentences.english: His remarks participated of the sense of humor.
sentences.chinese: 他的话里带有几分幽默感。

sentences.english: She loved everything about him -- his personality, his humor, the way he dressed.
sentences.chinese: 她爱他的一切——他的性格，他的幽默，还有他的衣着打扮。

name: hurricane
trans: n. 飓风般的事物，引起动荡的事物

sentences.english: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得三十年前袭击我们的一次飓风。

sentences.english: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱，不剧烈，不炙热，可是任凭海啸飓风，也矢志不渝。

sentences.english: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

detailed_translations.english: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

sentences.english: Have you met my husband Roy?
sentences.chinese: 你见过我的丈夫罗伊吗？

detailed_translations.english: the man that a woman is married to

sentences.english: There you are, in the coffin, or in an urn, your body reduced to a husk of meant-to-be's.
sentences.chinese: 你现在是这副样子，躺在棺材里，或者骨灰盒里。 你的身体沦为一张毫无意思的臭皮囊。

sentences.english: All the days of his separation shall he eat nothing that is made of the vine tree, from the kernels even to the husk.
sentences.chinese: 在一切离俗的日子，凡葡萄树上结的，自核至皮所作的物，都不可吃。

sentences.english: How can we remove the husk of the grains?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样去掉谷物的外皮？

detailed_translations.english: to remove the husks from grains, seeds etc
the dry outer part of corn, some grains, seeds, nuts etc

name: husky
trans: adj. （尤指声音）沙哑的，粗糙的

sentences.english: ‘Come quickly,’ she said in a husky whisper.
sentences.chinese: “快来。”她用沙哑的嗓音低声说道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声音沙哑的；有壳的；强壮的
detailed_translations.english: a husky voice is deep, quiet, and attractive

detailed_translations.chinese: 强壮结实之人；爱斯基摩人
detailed_translations.english: a dog with thick hair used in Canada and Alaska to pull  sledges  over the snow

name: hybrid
trans: n. 杂交品种，混合品种

sentences.english: hybrid architecture
sentences.chinese: 具有混合风格的建筑

sentences.english: ...the hybrid corn seed.
sentences.chinese: …杂交玉米种子。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant produced from parents of different breeds or types
Hybrid is also an adjective

sentences.english: He liked to sing hymns as he worked.
sentences.chinese: 他工作时喜欢唱赞美诗。

detailed_translations.english: a song of praise to God

sentences.english: It was not hyperbole to call it the worst storm in twenty years.
sentences.chinese: 称它是20年来最大的风暴并不为过。

detailed_translations.english: a way of describing something by saying it is much bigger, smaller, worse etc than it actually is

sentences.english: a hypnotic trance
sentences.chinese: 催眠后的恍惚状态

detailed_translations.chinese: 催眠的，催眠术的；易于催眠的
detailed_translations.english: relating to  hypnosis
a drug that helps you to sleep

sentences.english: It would be hypocritical to say I travel at 70 mph simply because that is the law.
sentences.chinese: 如果仅仅因为法律规定的时速是70英里我就说自己的行驶时速是70英里，那就太虚伪了。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is different from what you claim to believe – used to show disapproval

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶像破坏者；提倡打破旧习的人
奉为偶像， 盲目崇拜

sentences.english: The bombs ignited a fire which destroyed some 60 houses.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹引起了一场火灾，烧毁了大约六十间房屋。

detailed_translations.english: When you ignite something or when it ignites, it starts burning or explodes
to start burning, or to make something start burning

sentences.english: ...the ignominy of being fired.
sentences.chinese: ...被开除的羞辱。

detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that makes you feel ashamed or embarrassed, especially in public

sentences.english: India tolerated dissent, but it also tolerated inefficiency, disease and illiteracy.
sentences.chinese: 印度容许异议，但同时它也容忍了无能、疾病与文盲。

sentences.english: Tackling corruption would be the fastest way to address problems like poverty, disease, and illiteracy, he contended.
sentences.chinese: 他认为，反腐败可能是解决诸如贫困、疾病和文盲等问题的最快途径。

sentences.english: This great institution must work for great purposes -- to free people from tyranny and violence, hunger and disease, illiteracy and ignorance, and poverty and despair.
sentences.chinese: 这个伟大的机构必须努力达到伟大的目的──使人们摆脱暴政与暴力、饥饿与疾病、文盲与愚昧、贫困与绝望。

detailed_translations.english: Illiteracy is the state of not knowing how to read or write

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.chinese: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light

sentences.english: First impressions can often prove illusory.
sentences.chinese: 第一印象往往被证明是不真实的。

detailed_translations.english: false but seeming to be real or true

sentences.english: Both men imbibed considerable quantities of gin.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男人都喝了大量的杜松子酒。

detailed_translations.english: to drink something, especially alcohol – sometimes used humorously

detailed_translations.chinese: 纠纷， 纠葛， 纠缠不清

sentences.english: The remake of ‘Casablanca’ was a pale imitation (= something that is much less good than the thing it imitates ) of the original movie.
sentences.chinese: 重拍的《卡萨布兰卡》远不如原版。

sentences.english: ...a complete set of Dickens bound in imitation leather.
sentences.chinese: …用人造革装帧的一整套《狄更斯全集》。

detailed_translations.english: when you copy someone else’s actions
Imitation things are not genuine but are made to look as if they are

name: immaculate
trans: adj. 完美的，没有任何错误的

sentences.english: her immaculate stage performances
sentences.chinese: 她完美的舞台表演

detailed_translations.chinese: 完美的；洁净的；无瑕疵的
detailed_translations.english: exactly correct or perfect in every detail

sentences.english: Love is a force immanent in the world.
sentences.chinese: 爱是世界上一种无处不在的力量。

detailed_translations.chinese: 内在的， 固有的； 普遍存在的， 无所不在的
detailed_translations.english: a quality that is immanent seems to be present everywhere

sentences.english: If you sign a document, it is wholly immaterial whether you have read it carefully or not.
sentences.chinese: 文件一经签署，是否仔细阅读过文件就完全无关紧要了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非物质的；无形的；不重要的；非实质的
detailed_translations.english: not important in a particular situation

name: immature
trans: adj. （生理、心理）未完全发展的，未发育成熟的

sentences.english: He forgave his son’s immature behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他原谅了儿子的幼稚行为。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不成熟的, 未完全发展的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is immature behaves or thinks in a way that is typical of someone much younger – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: I see the Russian soldiers standing on the threshold of their native land, guarding the fields which their fathers have tilled from time immemorial.
sentences.chinese: 我看见俄国士兵站在祖国的大门口，守卫着他们的祖先自远古以来劳作的土地。

detailed_translations.english: starting longer ago than people can remember, or than written history shows

name: immune
trans: adj. 不易被感染的，有免疫力的

sentences.english: Once we’ve had the disease, we’re immune for life.
sentences.chinese: 我们一旦得过这种病，就获得了终身免疫力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 免疫的， 有免疫力的， 不受影响的； 免除的， 豁免的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is immune to a particular disease cannot catch it

name: immure
trans: vt. 监禁，禁闭；使闭门不出

detailed_translations.english: to shut someone in a place so that they cannot get out

sentences.english: This decision should not be seen as immutable.
sentences.chinese: 不该把这个决定看成是不可改变的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不变的；不可变的；不能变的
detailed_translations.english: never changing or impossible to change

sentences.english: Her impassive face showed no reaction at all.
sentences.chinese: 她表情冷淡，毫无反应。

detailed_translations.english: not showing any emotion

name: impeccable
trans: adj. 无暇的，无可挑剔的

sentences.english: She has taught her children impeccable manners.
sentences.chinese: 她把她的孩子教育得举止十分得体。

sentences.english: a bar with impeccable service
sentences.chinese: 服务无可挑剔的酒吧

detailed_translations.english: without any faults and impossible to criticize

sentences.english: He came from a respectable if impecunious family.
sentences.chinese: 他来自一个没钱但受人尊重的家庭。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不名一文的， 没钱的
detailed_translations.english: having very little money, especially over a long period – sometimes used humorously

sentences.english: Storms at sea impeded our progress.
sentences.chinese: 海上风暴阻碍了我们的航程。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for someone or something to move forward or make progress

sentences.english: On the morning of the expedition, I awoke with a feeling of impending disaster.
sentences.chinese: 远征出发的那天早上，我醒来就有一种大难临头的感觉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 即将发生的；迫切的；悬挂的
detailed_translations.english: an impending event or situation, especially an unpleasant one, is going to happen very soon

name: impenetrable
trans: adj. 不可渗透的，不可穿透的

sentences.english: The trees formed a dark and impenetrable barrier.
sentences.chinese: 这些树形成了一道无法通过的黑暗屏障。

sentences.english: the impenetrable blackness of the night
sentences.chinese: 夜晚伸手不见五指的黑

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能穿过的, 不可理喻的
detailed_translations.english: impossible to get through, see through, or get into

sentences.english: Endless, of the impenitent and unbelieving.
sentences.chinese: 无止境的，对不知悔改的和不信。

sentences.english: We need to remember that God's wrath does burn against impenitent sinners (Psalm 38:1-3).
sentences.chinese: 我们必须铭记上帝的愤怒曾烧死了不知悔改的恶人（圣歌38：1-3）。

sentences.english: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;
sentences.chinese: 你竟任着你刚硬不悔改的心，为自己积蓄忿怒，以致神震怒，显出他公义审判的日子来到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 顽固的人；不知悔改的人

detailed_translations.english: not sorry or penitent; unrepentant

sentences.english: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者，这很重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的；紧急的，极重要的；命令的
detailed_translations.english: extremely important and needing to be done or dealt with immediately

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的事， 必须完成的事； 【语】祈使语气
detailed_translations.english: something that must be done urgently

name: imperial
trans: adj. 巨大的，令人惊叹的

sentences.english: Britain’s imperial expansion in the 19th century
sentences.chinese: 19世纪英帝国的扩张

detailed_translations.english: relating to an empire or to the person who rules it

sentences.english: She raised her hand in an imperious gesture.
sentences.chinese: 她傲慢地扬起手。

detailed_translations.english: giving orders and expecting to be obeyed, in a way that seems too proud

name: impertinent
trans: adj. 粗鲁无礼的，大胆的

sentences.english: He was always asking impertinent questions.
sentences.chinese: 他老是问一些唐突的问题。

sentences.english: You are an impertinent young woman.
sentences.chinese: 你这姑娘真没礼貌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不恰当的；无礼的；粗鲁的；不相干的
detailed_translations.english: rude and not respectful, especially to someone who is older or more important

name: imperturbable
trans: adj. 沉着冷静的，淡定的

sentences.english: Thomas, of course, was cool and aloof and imperturbable.
sentences.chinese: 当然，托马斯冷静、超脱且遇事沉着。

detailed_translations.english: remaining calm and unworried in spite of problems or difficulties

name: impervious
trans: adj. 不可渗透的，不可穿透的

sentences.english: impervious volcanic rock
sentences.chinese: 不透水的火山岩

detailed_translations.chinese: 不受影响的，无动于衷的；不能渗透的
detailed_translations.english: not affected or influenced by something and seeming not to notice it

name: impetuous
trans: adj. 冲动的，性急的，轻率的

sentences.english: He was high-spirited and impetuous.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪高昂，行事鲁莽。

sentences.english: She might live to regret this impetuous decision.
sentences.chinese: 她可能会一辈子为这个鲁莽的决定感到后悔。

detailed_translations.english: tending to do things very quickly, without thinking carefully first, or showing this quality

sentences.english: an impious crime
sentences.chinese: 大不敬之罪

detailed_translations.chinese: 不虔诚的；不孝的；不敬的
detailed_translations.english: lacking respect for religion or God

sentences.english: implacable enemies
sentences.chinese: 死敌

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能安抚的；难和解的；不能缓和的

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

name: implode
trans: v. （使）剧烈收缩，（使）坍缩，（使）内爆

sentences.english: The windows on both sides of the room had imploded.
sentences.chinese: 房间两边的窗户都向内爆碎了。

detailed_translations.english: to explode inwards

sentences.english: One can no longer walk the streets without seeing beggars importuning passersby.
sentences.chinese: 走在这些街道上总能看到乞丐纠缠行人乞讨。

detailed_translations.english: If someone importunes another person, they ask them for something or ask them to do something, in an annoying way

sentences.english: an imposing building
sentences.chinese: 宏伟的建筑

sentences.english: He’s a tall, quietly spoken, but imposing figure.
sentences.chinese: 他高高的个子，说话轻声细语，但气宇轩昂。

detailed_translations.english: large, impressive, and appearing important

sentences.english: The nurse was soon discovered to be an impostor.
sentences.chinese: 那个护士很快被发现是个冒牌货。

sentences.english: Emergency services seem impotent in the face of such a disaster.
sentences.chinese: 面对这种灾难，应急服务机构似乎无能为力。

sentences.english: impotent rage
sentences.chinese: 于事无补的狂怒

detailed_translations.chinese: 无力的；无效的；虚弱的；阳萎的
detailed_translations.english: unable to take effective action because you do not have enough power, strength, or control

sentences.english: vague imprecise estimates
sentences.chinese: 粗略的、不精确的估计

sentences.english: Alcohol affects the brain, making speech slurred and imprecise.
sentences.chinese: 酒精影响大脑，使言语含糊不清。

detailed_translations.english: not clear or exact

sentences.english: When do we make impromptu speeches?
sentences.chinese: 我们什么时候要做即席演讲？

sentences.english: When Marco was asked to give an impromptu speech on“Addictions,”he divided the topic /into/ several parts. Notice how he used the pattern of related subtopics in the outline that follows.
sentences.chinese: 举个例子，马可要做一个关于“嗜好”的即席演讲，他将这个主题分成了几部分，注意下面他在大纲中是如何运用有关联副主题模式的。

detailed_translations.english: done or said without any preparation or planning

sentences.english: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
sentences.chinese: 我忘了带笔记，只好临时发挥。

detailed_translations.english: to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events

sentences.english: The banks made hundreds of imprudent loans in the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪70年代那几家银行轻率地发放了几百笔贷款。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的，鲁莽的；不小心的
detailed_translations.english: not sensible or wise

name: impudent
trans: adj. 放肆大胆的，无礼的

sentences.english: Some of them spoke pleasantly and were well behaved, while others were impudent and insulting.
sentences.chinese: 他们当中的一些人谈吐不俗、举止得体，而另一些人则行为不恭、傲慢无礼。

detailed_translations.english: rude and showing no respect to other people

sentences.english: I did not mean to impugn her professional abilities.
sentences.chinese: 我并不是怀疑她的专业能力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指责，非难；抨击；反驳；对…表示怀疑
detailed_translations.english: to express doubts about someone’s honesty, courage, ability etc

sentences.english: The government has said it was an inadvertent error.
sentences.chinese: 政府声称那是无意的过失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疏忽的；不注意的（副词inadvertently）；无意中做的
detailed_translations.english: An inadvertent action is one that you do without realizing what you are doing

name: inalienable
trans: adj. 不可剥夺的，不能让与的

sentences.english: inalienable human rights
sentences.chinese: 不可剥夺的人权

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可分割的；不可剥夺的；不能让与的
detailed_translations.english: an inalienable right, power etc cannot be taken from you

sentences.english: Most pop lyrics are pretty inane.
sentences.chinese: 大部分流行歌曲的歌词都相当空洞。

sentences.english: an inane remark
sentences.chinese: 空话

detailed_translations.chinese: 无意义的， 空洞的； 愚蠢的
detailed_translations.english: very stupid or without much meaning

sentences.english: an inanimate object
sentences.chinese: 无生命的物体

detailed_translations.english: not living

sentences.english: He will be inaugurated (as) President in January.
sentences.chinese: 他将于一月份就任总统。

sentences.english: The moon landing inaugurated a new era in space exploration.
sentences.chinese: 登陆月球开创了太空探索的新纪元。

detailed_translations.english: to introduce a new public official or leader at a special ceremony

name: incandescent
trans: adj. 热情饱满的，感情强烈的

sentences.english: the invention of the incandescent lamp
sentences.chinese: 白炽灯的发明

detailed_translations.chinese: 辉耀的；炽热的；发白热光的
detailed_translations.english: producing a bright light when heated

sentences.english: a book of spells and incantations
sentences.chinese: 符咒书

detailed_translations.english: special words that someone uses in magic, or the act of saying these words

name: incarnate
trans: vt. 使（思想，理论）具化，体现

sentences.english: Jesus, the incarnate Son of God
sentences.chinese: 耶稣，上帝之子的化身

sentences.english: The media cast him as the devil incarnate (= someone very evil ).
sentences.chinese: 媒体把他描述成魔鬼的化身。

sentences.english: The iniquities of the regime are incarnated in one man.
sentences.chinese: 该体制的种种劣迹集中体现于一人。

sentences.english: ...a writer who incarnates the changing consciousness of the Americas.
sentences.chinese: ...典型地体现出美洲观念变化的一位作家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 化身的；人体化的；肉色的
detailed_translations.english: having taken human form

detailed_translations.chinese: 体现；使…具体化；使实体化
detailed_translations.english: If you say that a quality is incarnated in a person, you mean that they represent that quality or are typical of it in an extreme form

sentences.english: A shower of incendiaries struck the Opera House.
sentences.chinese: 阵雨般的燃烧弹击中了歌剧院。

detailed_translations.chinese: 燃烧弹；纵火犯，放火者；煽动者
detailed_translations.english: a bomb designed to cause a fire
an incendiary speech, piece of writing etc is intended to make people angry

sentences.english: a church filled with the smell of incense
sentences.chinese: 充满焚香气味的教堂

sentences.english: lighted incense sticks
sentences.chinese: 点燃的棒香

detailed_translations.english: a substance that has a pleasant smell when you burn it
to make someone very angry

sentences.english: a CD collection covering the band from its inception in 1994
sentences.chinese: 一套包括该乐队自1994年成立以来所有曲目在内的激光唱片

detailed_translations.english: the start of an organization or institution

sentences.english: The child’s incessant talking started to irritate her.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子喋喋不休，她开始烦躁起来。

sentences.english: incessant rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing without stopping

sentences.english: The curtains were an inch too short.
sentences.chinese: 窗帘短了一英寸。

sentences.english: Rainfall here is under 15 inches a year.
sentences.chinese: 本地的年降雨量不到15英寸。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring length, equal to 2.54 centimetres. There are 12 inches in a foot.

sentences.english: His dreams were senseless and inchoate.
sentences.chinese: 他的梦想毫无意义，很不成熟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 早期的；刚开始的；未充分发展的
detailed_translations.english: inchoate ideas, plans, attitudes etc are only just starting to develop

sentences.english: All the infected clothing was incinerated.
sentences.chinese: 所有沾染了细菌的衣服都被焚化了。

detailed_translations.english: to burn something completely in order to destroy it

sentences.english: a sign of incipient madness
sentences.chinese: 精神失常的早期征兆

detailed_translations.chinese: 初期的；初始的；起初的；发端的
detailed_translations.english: starting to happen or exist

sentences.english: They were charged with inciting racial hatred.
sentences.chinese: 他们被指控煽动种族仇恨。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately encourage people to fight, argue etc

sentences.english: Confrontation between the two sides ensued for 3 hours as a result, eventually with the Vietnamese Navy retreating due to inclement weather.
sentences.chinese: 双方的对抗持续了3小时，最终越南海军由于险恶的天气而撤退。

sentences.english: This space wraps around the southern side of the house, and is covered by an overhanging roof. A fireplace allows residents to enjoy the outdoors, even in inclement weather.
sentences.chinese: 这部分空间包裹着建筑的南面，被悬挑屋顶覆盖。即使在恶劣的天气情况下，壁炉的存在使居民可以更享受户外空间。

detailed_translations.english: inclement weather is unpleasantly cold, wet etc

name: incogitant
trans: adj. 考虑不周的，不体谅的

detailed_translations.chinese: 未经思考的， 考虑不周的
detailed_translations.english: thoughtless

name: incongruent
trans: adj. 不全等的；不一致的

detailed_translations.chinese: 不协调的， 不和谐的， 不合适的

sentences.english: inconsequential but amusing chatter
sentences.chinese: 无谓但有趣的闲扯

detailed_translations.chinese: 不重要的；不合理的；不合逻辑的
detailed_translations.english: not important

sentences.english: CCTV provided incontrovertible evidence that he was at the scene of the crime.
sentences.chinese: 闭路电视提供了案发时他在犯罪现场的确凿证据。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无可争议的；无疑的；明白的
detailed_translations.english: definitely true and impossible to be proved false

name: incorrigible
trans: adj. 不可救药的，积习难改的

sentences.english: "Sunita, you are incorrigible!" he said.
sentences.chinese: “苏尼塔，你真是屡教不改啊！”，他说道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可救药的；积习难改的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is incorrigible is bad in a way that cannot be changed or improved – often used humorously

sentences.english: He claimed that the drugs had been planted to incriminate him.
sentences.chinese: 他声称那些毒品是有人为了栽赃陷害他而放在那里的。

detailed_translations.english: If something incriminates you, it suggests that you are responsible for something bad, especially a crime

sentences.english: The birds returned to their nests and continued to incubate the eggs.
sentences.chinese: 那些鸟儿返巢继续孵卵。

detailed_translations.chinese: 孵化；培养；温育；逐渐发展
detailed_translations.english: if a bird incubates its eggs, or if the eggs incubate, they are kept warm until they hatch(= the birds inside are born )
to incriminate; cause blame to be imputed to

sentences.english: ...armed incursions into border areas by rebel forces.
sentences.chinese: ...叛军武装入侵边境地区。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden attack into an area that belongs to other people

sentences.english: Her words left an indelible impression on me for years to come.
sentences.chinese: 她的话多年来我都难以忘怀。

detailed_translations.english: impossible to remove or forget

name: indemnity
trans: n. (损害，伤害等的）保险赔偿

sentences.english: insurance providing indemnity against future liabilities
sentences.chinese: 对将来的债务提供保障的保险

detailed_translations.english: protection against loss or damage, especially in the form of a promise to pay for any losses or damage

sentences.english: He was later indicted on corruption charges.
sentences.chinese: 他后来被控贪污。

detailed_translations.english: to officially charge someone with a criminal offence

name: indifferent
trans: adj. 不感兴趣的，冷漠的

sentences.english: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

name: indigenous
trans: adj. 与生俱来的，先天的

sentences.english: the many indigenous cultures which existed in Siberia
sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

sentences.english: No where in the article does it mention her financial status. So…what is it that leads everyone to assume she was indigent?
sentences.chinese: 在文章中哪也没提及她的财务状况。那么…究竟是什么导致每个人都认为她是贫困的？

sentences.english: They "either fail to pay anything or pay a greatly-reduced amount designed for indigent or low income patients lacking insurance, " according to DHS.
sentences.chinese: 他们“一分钱都不付或者只支付非常少的费用，原先为贫困或短缺保险的低收入病人设定的费用。”

detailed_translations.english: very poor

name: indispensable
trans: adj. 必不可少的，不可或缺的

sentences.english: Mobile phones have become an indispensable part of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 移动电话已经成为我们生活中的必需品。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

sentences.english: People were indoctrinated not to question their leaders.
sentences.chinese: 人们被灌输对领导人不得置疑的观念。

detailed_translations.english: to train someone to accept a particular set of beliefs, especially political or religious ones, and not consider any others

sentences.english: The former investment banker has not been indolent: his department has been a factory for acronyms since the crisis began.
sentences.chinese: 这位前投资银行家并非懒惰，自危机开始以来，他的部门已成为加工厂的代称。

sentences.english: In a 1942 presentation at the New York Academy of Medicine, the scientists reported that after lobotomy, patients did sometimes become “indolent” or “outspoken.
sentences.chinese: 在1942年纽约医学专科学院的一个介绍会中，一些科学家提出，额叶切除术后，病人的确有时变得“懒惰”或“直言”。

detailed_translations.english: lazy

sentences.english: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

name: indulgent
trans: adj. （对己）放纵的，（对他人）纵容的

sentences.english: toys bought by their indulgent grandparents
sentences.chinese: 溺爱孩子的(外)祖父母买的玩具

detailed_translations.english: willing to allow someone, especially a child, to do or have whatever they want, even if this is not good for them

name: indurate
trans: adj. 铁石心肠的，冷酷无情的

sentences.english: She was an industrious and willing worker.
sentences.chinese: 她是个勤劳肯干的工人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is industrious works hard

sentences.english: ineffable joy
sentences.chinese: 难以形容的喜悦

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可言喻的， 难以表达的； 避讳的
detailed_translations.english: too great to be described in words

name: ineluctable
trans: adj. 无法逃避的，必然的

sentences.english: ...the ineluctable tendency of populations to exceed resources.
sentences.chinese: ...人口超出资源承载限度的不可避免的趋势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可避免的；无法逃避的
detailed_translations.english: impossible to avoid

name: inept
trans: adj. 不称职的，无能力的

sentences.english: inept leadership
sentences.chinese: 拙劣的领导

sentences.english: He was criticized for his inept handling of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他因处理这个问题不力而遭到批评。

detailed_translations.english: not good at doing something

name: inert
trans: adj. （人）懒惰缺乏活力的；（物品）惰性的

sentences.english: inert gases
sentences.chinese: 惰性气体

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 惰性的；呆滞的；迟缓的；无效的
detailed_translations.english: not producing a chemical reaction when combined with other substances

name: inevitable
trans: adj. 不可避免的，必然的

sentences.english: A further escalation of the crisis now seems inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 危机的进一步升级现在看来已不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: certain to happen and impossible to avoid

name: inexorable
trans: adj. 无法劝阻的，不为所动的

sentences.english: the inexorable decline of Britain’s manufacturing industry
sentences.chinese: 英国制造业无可挽回的衰落

sentences.english: the seemingly inexorable rise in crime
sentences.chinese: 似乎无法遏止的犯罪率上升势头

detailed_translations.chinese: 无情的；不屈不挠的；不可阻挡的；无法改变的
detailed_translations.english: an inexorable process cannot be stopped

sentences.english: an infamous killer
sentences.chinese: 臭名昭著的杀手

sentences.english: Los Angeles’ infamous smog
sentences.chinese: 恶名远播的洛杉矶雾霾

detailed_translations.chinese: 声名狼藉的；无耻的；邪恶的；不名誉的
detailed_translations.english: well known for being bad or evil

sentences.english: North Korea is a more extreme example of external power being incommensurate with internal stability and wealth.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜是一个外部力量与内部稳定和财富不相称的更极端例子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不成比例的， 不相称的
detailed_translations.english: not commensurate; disproportionate

sentences.english: Police attempts to infiltrate neo-Nazi groups were largely unsuccessful.
sentences.chinese: 警方想打入新纳粹团体的行动基本上不成功。

detailed_translations.english: to secretly join an organization or enter a place in order to find out information about it or harm it

sentences.english: The universe is infinite.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙是无限的。

detailed_translations.english: without limits in space or time

name: infirm
trans: adj. 不果断的，优柔寡断的

sentences.english: ...her aging, infirm husband.
sentences.chinese: …她那年迈体弱的丈夫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰弱的；意志薄弱的；不坚固的
detailed_translations.english: A person who is infirm is weak or ill, and usually old

sentences.english: The shooting inflamed ethnic tensions.
sentences.chinese: 枪击事件加剧了种族间的紧张局势。

name: infelicitous
trans: adj. 不适当的，不合时宜的

sentences.english: Infelicitous remark; infelicitous phrasing infelicitous typesetting was due to illegiblecopy.
sentences.chinese: 不恰当的评论；不贴切的措辞；错误的排版是因为原稿潦草难认。

sentences.english: An infelicitous remark; infelicitous phrasing; the infelicitous typeset ting was due to illegible copy.
sentences.chinese: 不恰当的评论；不贴切的措辞；错误的排版是因为原稿潦草难认。

detailed_translations.english: not felicitous; unfortunate

sentences.english: ...problems caused by the influx of refugees.
sentences.chinese: …难民大量涌入所造成的问题。

detailed_translations.english: the arrival of large numbers of people or large amounts of money, goods etc, especially suddenly

sentences.english: Her actions infuriated her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她的举动使她母亲极为生气。

sentences.english: It infuriated him that Beth was with another man.
sentences.chinese: 贝丝和另一个男人在一起，这使他极为愤怒。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone extremely angry

sentences.english: All those lives maintained in the rarefied air of the absurd could not persevere without some profound and constant thought to infuse its strength into them.
sentences.chinese: 没有某种深邃的思想一成不变地为之输入力量，所有这些在荒谬的稀薄空气中维持的生命都无法继续。

detailed_translations.english: to fill something or someone with a particular feeling or quality

name: ingenious
trans: adj. 聪明的，有创造才能的

sentences.english: an ingenious device
sentences.chinese: 精巧的装置

sentences.english: an ingenious cook
sentences.chinese: 心灵手巧的厨师

detailed_translations.english: (of an object, a plan, an idea, etc.) very suitable for a particular purpose and resulting from clever new ideas

sentences.english: Often the initial topology does not call for another intermediary, so this becomes a good choice.
sentences.chinese: 通常，最初的拓扑结构并不要求另外的中介，因此这成为了一个好的选择。

detailed_translations.chinese: 中间人；仲裁者；调解者；媒介物
detailed_translations.english: a person or organization that tries to help two other people or groups to agree with each other

sentences.english: He seemed too ingenuous for a reporter.
sentences.chinese: 他好像太天真诚实，不适合做记者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 天真的；坦白的；正直的；朴实的
detailed_translations.english: an ingenuous person is simple, trusting, and honest, especially because they have not had much experience of life

sentences.english: ...side effects occurring in fish that ingest this substance.
sentences.chinese: ...在吃了此物质的鱼身上产生的副作用。

detailed_translations.english: to take food or other substances into your body

name: ingrained
trans: adj. 本质的，根深蒂固的

sentences.english: Morals tend to be deeply ingrained.
sentences.chinese: 道德观念往往是根深蒂固的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 根深蒂固的；彻头彻尾的；生染的
detailed_translations.english: ingrained attitudes or behaviour are firmly established and therefore difficult to change

detailed_translations.chinese: 使根深蒂固（ingrain的过去分词形式）；生染；就原料染色

name: ingratiating
trans: adj. 逢迎的，意在奉承的

sentences.english: He said this with an ingratiating smile.
sentences.chinese: 他说这个的时候面带讨好的微笑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 逢迎的，讨好的；迷人的，吸引人的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone or their behaviour as ingratiating, you mean that they try to make people like them

sentences.english: Every business has its own inherent risks.
sentences.chinese: 每笔生意本身都有风险。

sentences.english: I’m afraid the problems you mention are inherent in the system.
sentences.chinese: 你提及的这些问题恐怕本来就存在于这个体制中。

detailed_translations.english: a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it

sentences.english: But allowing vigilantes to even the score will only lead to a spiral of violence that is hard to stop and inimical to democratic evolution.
sentences.chinese: 但是由治安委员会成员来弥补裂痕只能导致暴力事件的盘旋上升，这种事件又是难以遏制的，同时对民主进程又是极其有害的。

sentences.english: When Krugman repeated one of his "debt is good" posts, posters linked to the economic science from Reinhardt and Rogoff showing that high debt is inimical to economic recovery.
sentences.chinese: 当克鲁格曼重复发了一篇他的“举债是美德”博文时，回帖的网民用链接把人们引向了莱因哈特和罗格夫，揭示了巨额债务对经济复苏有害。

sentences.english: To the popular mind, science is completely inimical to religion: science embraces facts and evidence while religion professes blind faith.
sentences.chinese: 在大众的心目中，科学与宗教完全敌视：科学拥抱事实与证据，而宗教宣示盲目的信仰。

name: inimitable
trans: adj. 无法仿效的，独特的

sentences.english: He makes his own point in his own inimitable way.
sentences.chinese: 他以他独有的的方式阐述了自己的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独特的；无比的；无法仿效的
detailed_translations.english: You use inimitable to describe someone, especially a performer, when you like or admire them because of their special qualities

sentences.english: They were trying to protect their son from iniquity.
sentences.chinese: 他们竭力保护儿子免受不公正待遇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 邪恶， 不公正， 不道德
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very unfair or evil, or something that is very unfair

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

sentences.english: I had an inkling that she was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我隐约知道她怀孕了。

detailed_translations.english: a slight idea about something

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗示 （inkle的ing形式）；略知；低声说出

sentences.english: an innocuous remark
sentences.chinese: 无恶意的话

sentences.english: He’s a perfectly innocuous young man.
sentences.chinese: 他是个毫无恶意的年轻人。

detailed_translations.english: not offensive, dangerous, or harmful

sentences.english: an innovative approach to language teaching
sentences.chinese: 创新的语言教学法

sentences.english: innovative schemes for recycling waste materials
sentences.chinese: 废物回收利用的创新计划

detailed_translations.english: an innovative idea or way of doing something is new, different, and better than those that existed before

sentences.english: I’d have asked more questions, but I didn’t want to seem inquisitive.
sentences.chinese: 我本想问更多的问题，但我不想看上去那么爱打听。

detailed_translations.chinese: 好奇的；好问的，爱打听的
detailed_translations.english: asking too many questions and trying to find out too many details about something or someone

sentences.english: He fell to the ground, insensible.
sentences.chinese: 他跌倒在地，失去了知觉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏迷的；无知觉的；麻木不仁的
detailed_translations.english: unable to feel something or be affected by it

sentences.english: The accounts of the witnesses are inconsistent.
sentences.chinese: 几位目击者的说法不一致。

detailed_translations.english: two statements that are inconsistent cannot both be true

name: insentient
trans: adj. 无感觉的，无知觉的
adj. 一知半解的，略懂的

sentences.english: The evidence against the two men was inconclusive.
sentences.chinese: 针对这两个人的不利证据并不令人信服。

sentences.english: A coalition government was formed after inconclusive elections.
sentences.chinese: 选举没有结果，于是成立了一个联合政府。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不确定的；非决定性的；无结果的
detailed_translations.english: not leading to a clear decision or result

sentences.english: an insipid pasta dish
sentences.chinese: 一盘没有味道的意大利面食

detailed_translations.english: food or drink that is insipid does not have much taste

sentences.english: an insolent tone of voice
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的语气

sentences.english: You insolent child!
sentences.chinese: 你这个没礼貌的孩子！

detailed_translations.chinese: 无礼的；傲慢的；粗野的；无耻的
detailed_translations.english: rude and not showing any respect

name: insouciant
trans: adj. 无忧虑的，不在乎的

sentences.english: Television producers seem irresponsibly insouciant about churning out violence.
sentences.chinese: 电视制片人似乎对大量制作暴力节目抱着不负责任的无所谓的态度。

detailed_translations.english: An insouciant action or quality shows someone's lack of concern about something that they are expected to take more seriously

sentences.english: He will instate Mason to a high position of power.
sentences.chinese: 他会任命梅森一个位高权重的职位。

detailed_translations.english: to place in a position or office; install

sentences.english: Abettors, who instigate others to commit crimes, are not only the instigators but also the disseminator of criminal intent.
sentences.chinese: 教唆犯作为教唆他人犯罪的人，不仅是犯意的挑起者，也是犯意的传播者。

sentences.english: This paper can be divided into four parts. The first part briefly outlines the previous achievements on"instigate the lawsuits".
sentences.chinese: 本文分为四部分，第一部分对有关“教唆词讼”的先行研究作了一个简要的概述。

sentences.english: We must instill a sense of duty in our children.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在我们的孩子当中灌输一种责任感。

sentences.english: I aim to instill in them the pleasure of giving.
sentences.chinese: 我的目的在于灌输给他们给予的乐趣。

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

sentences.english: In industry, a worker who is grossly insubordinate is threatened with discharge.
sentences.chinese: 在企业界，拒不服从指令的工人面临被解雇的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is insubordinate, you mean that they do not obey someone of higher rank

name: insular
trans: adj. （观念，想法等）孤立狭隘的

sentences.english: an insular community
sentences.chinese: 保守封闭的社团

detailed_translations.chinese: 孤立的；与世隔绝的；海岛的；岛民的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or like an island

name: insulate
trans: vt. 使绝缘，使隔离，不受外界影响

sentences.english: an insulated attic
sentences.chinese: 隔热[隔音]的阁楼

sentences.english: Pipes may need insulating against the cold.
sentences.chinese: 管道可能需要隔温以防冰冻。

detailed_translations.english: to cover or protect something with a material that stops electricity, sound, heat etc from getting in or out

sentences.english: There, she worked as a low-level intelligence analyst helping her unit assess insurgent activity in the area.
sentences.chinese: 在那里，她是一名初级情报分析员，工作内容是帮助所在部队评估该地区的叛乱活动。

sentences.english: But new reports show a sharp rise in insurgent attacks -- including a 55% increase in children being injured.
sentences.chinese: 但有新的报告显示，叛乱者发动的袭击数量大幅上升，儿童受伤人数也上升了55%。

detailed_translations.english: one of a group of people fighting against the government of their own country, or against authority

name: intangible
trans: adj. 无法感知的，无形的

sentences.english: The island has an intangible quality of holiness.
sentences.chinese: 该岛屿有一种难以形容的神圣感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无形的，触摸不到的；难以理解的
detailed_translations.english: an intangible quality or feeling is difficult to describe exactly

sentences.english: Rituals, celebrations, and festivals form an integral part of every human society.
sentences.chinese: 仪式、庆典和节日是每个人类社会不可缺少的组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is an integral part of something is an essential part of that thing

sentences.english: I have always regarded him as a man of integrity.
sentences.chinese: 我一直把他当作一个正直诚实的人。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest and strong about what you believe to be right

sentences.english: His reply was barely intelligible.
sentences.chinese: 他的回复几乎让人听不懂。

detailed_translations.english: if speech, writing, or an idea is intelligible, it can be easily understood

name: intemperate
trans: adj. 无节制的，极端的，不温和的

sentences.english: In Junethe civil war intensified.
sentences.chinese: 6月份内战更加激烈了。

sentences.english: His mother’s death intensified his loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 母亲的过世使他感到更加孤单。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in degree or strength, or to make something do this

sentences.english: The team of archaeologists found the spot where his bones were originally interred.
sentences.chinese: 这队考古学家发现了起初埋葬他骸骨的地方。

detailed_translations.english: to bury a dead person

name: interim
trans: n. 中间过渡时期，间隔

sentences.english: an interim report
sentences.chinese: 中期报告

sentences.english: He received an interim payment of £10,000.
sentences.chinese: 他收到暂时支付的一万英镑。

sentences.english: An interim government was established.
sentences.chinese: 一个临时政府成立了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 临时的，暂时的；中间的；间歇的
detailed_translations.english: intended to be used or accepted for a short time only, until something or someone final can be made or found

detailed_translations.chinese: 过渡时期，中间时期；暂定
detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two events

sentences.english: a puzzle with 500 interlocking pieces
sentences.chinese: 由500个紧密相扣的块组成的拼图

detailed_translations.english: if two or more things interlock, or if they are interlocked, they fit firmly together

sentences.english: interminable delays
sentences.chinese: 无休止的拖延

detailed_translations.english: very long and boring

sentences.english: The weather forecast is for sun, with intermittent showers.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报为晴，有阵雨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 间歇的；断断续续的；间歇性
detailed_translations.english: stopping and starting often and for short periods

sentences.english: The police interrogated the suspect for several hours.
sentences.chinese: 警察盘问了这名嫌疑犯好几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone a lot of questions for a long time in order to get information, sometimes using threats

name: intimate
trans: adj. 有紧密联系的，亲密无间的

sentences.english: an intimate friend of Picasso’s
sentences.chinese: 毕加索的一个密友

sentences.english: an intimate relationship
sentences.chinese: 亲密的关系

sentences.english: She’s on intimate terms with people in government.
sentences.chinese: 她与政府官员关系密切。

detailed_translations.english: having an extremely close friendship
a close personal friend
to make people understand what you mean without saying it directly

sentences.english: Attempts to intimidate her failed.
sentences.chinese: 恐吓她的企图失败了。

detailed_translations.english: to frighten or threaten someone into making them do what you want

name: intoxicant
trans: n. 使人陶醉的东西（尤指饮料）

sentences.english: It should be sweet, very intoxicant.
sentences.chinese: 它应该是甜甜的，很醉人的。

sentences.english: Now evening what evening, in the air has filled the intoxicant happiness.
sentences.chinese: 今夕何夕，空气里都充满了醉人的甜蜜。

sentences.english: In a word, a man in a crowd behaves as though he had swallowed a large dose of some powerful intoxicant.
sentences.chinese: 总之，群体中个人的表现就像注射了大剂量的麻醉药一样。

detailed_translations.english: causing intoxication

sentences.english: an intransigent attitude
sentences.chinese: 不妥协的态度

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to change your ideas or behaviour, in a way that seems unreasonable

sentences.english: intrepid explorers
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的探险家

detailed_translations.english: willing to do dangerous things or go to dangerous places – often used humorously

sentences.english: Other people’s houses always intrigued her.
sentences.chinese: 别人的房子总令她好奇。

detailed_translations.english: to make secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power
if something intrigues you, it interests you a lot because it seems strange or mysterious

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴谋， 诡计， 密谋
detailed_translations.english: the making of secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power, or a plan of this kind

sentences.english: the intrinsic interest of the subject
sentences.chinese: 该话题本身的趣味

detailed_translations.english: being part of the nature or character of someone or something

sentences.english: He seemed to have an intuitive awareness of how I felt.
sentences.chinese: 他好像凭直觉就知道我的感受。

detailed_translations.english: an intuitive idea is based on a feeling rather than on knowledge or facts

sentences.english: The tidal wave inundated vast areas of cropland.
sentences.chinese: 海啸淹没了大片农田。

detailed_translations.english: to cover an area with a large amount of water

name: inure
trans: vt. 使习惯接受不好的东西

sentences.english: We should inure ourselves to hard life.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该使自己习惯艰苦生活。

detailed_translations.english: to cause to accept or become hardened to; habituate

sentences.english: The deputy leader of the group, which is based in Baghdad, explained its campaign using a stream of homophobic invective.
sentences.chinese: 这个组织总部设在巴格达，其副首领用一连串谩骂同性恋者的语言解释了这个运动。

sentences.english: Is it true that they and the entire  political culture will stop the self-sustaining and self-serving pendulum  of blame and invective only after a congressman has been shot?
sentences.chinese: 我们整个政治文化会出现终止自我维持和面对指责和谩骂时的自私摇摆不定的态度，改变从议员被枪杀开始吗？

sentences.english: A country whose politics have been damaged recently by bitter, racially tinged invective offered hundreds of thousands of visitors an affectionate welcome.
sentences.chinese: 就是这样一个被尖锐，夹带谩骂种族问题损害的政体的国家给了成百上千的来访者们热情的欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: rude and insulting words that someone says when they are very angry

name: inveigh
trans: vi. 激烈抗议，表示强烈不满

sentences.english: A lot of his writings inveigh against luxury and riches.
sentences.chinese: 他的许多作品猛烈抨击了奢侈和富有。

detailed_translations.english: If you inveigh against something, you criticize it strongly

sentences.english: She inveigles Paco into a plot to swindle Tania out of her savings.
sentences.chinese: 她把帕科诱骗进了一个骗取塔尼娅积蓄的阴谋里。

detailed_translations.english: If you inveigle someone into doing something, you cleverly persuade them to do it when they do not really want to

sentences.english: ...one inventory of twelve sails for each yacht.
sentences.chinese: …为每艘游艇配备12张帆的存货。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细目录， 存货清单
detailed_translations.english: a list of all the things in a place

sentences.english: ...an inveterate gambler.
sentences.chinese: ...一个恶心成瘾的赌徒。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as, for example, an inveterate liar or smoker, you mean that they have lied or smoked for a long time and are not likely to stop doing it

sentences.english: By innocently lying to detectives, she’d put herselfinaninvidious position.
sentences.chinese: 由于无意间向侦探撒了谎，她把自己置于一个尴尬的境地。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诽谤的；不公平的；引起反感的；易招嫉妒的
detailed_translations.english: unpleasant, especially because it is likely to offend people or make you unpopular

name: invigorate
trans: vt. 使精神，使强壮，鼓舞激励

sentences.english: Carey’s hope was that the church would be renewed and invigorated.
sentences.chinese: 凯里希望教会能复兴。

detailed_translations.english: to make the people in an organization or group feel excited again, so that they want to make something successful

name: invincible
trans: adj. 不可战胜的，不可超越的

sentences.english: an invincible army
sentences.chinese: 无敌的军队

sentences.english: Young athletes think of themselves as invincible.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的运动员自认为是战无不胜的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能征服的， 无敌的
detailed_translations.english: too strong to be destroyed or defeated

sentences.english: a painting that invokes images of the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 使人联想到落基山脉的画

sentences.english: During his speech, he invoked the memory of Harry Truman.
sentences.chinese: 他演讲时使人想起哈里 · 杜鲁门。

detailed_translations.english: to make a particular idea, image, or feeling appear in people’s minds by describing an event or situation, or by talking about a person

sentences.english: an irascible old man
sentences.chinese: 一位脾气暴躁的老人

detailed_translations.english: easily becoming angry

sentences.english: The owner was so irate he almost threw me out of the place.
sentences.chinese: 主人那么生气，他差点儿把我从那个地方赶出去。

detailed_translations.english: If someone is irate, they are very angry about something

sentences.english: small iridescent blue flies
sentences.chinese: 色彩变幻的蓝色小苍蝇

detailed_translations.english: showing colours that seem to change in different lights

sentences.english: The rehearsal process also irked him increasingly.
sentences.chinese: 排练过程也更加让他厌烦。

detailed_translations.english: if something irks you, it makes you feel annoyed

name: ironclad
trans: adj. 非常坚固的，坚不可摧的

detailed_translations.chinese: 无法根除的， 根深蒂固的

sentences.english: itinerant labourers
sentences.chinese: 流动劳工

detailed_translations.english: travelling from place to place, especially to work

sentences.english: The water in Lake Powell is used to irrigate the area.
sentences.chinese: 包尔湖的水被用来灌溉该地区。

detailed_translations.english: to supply land or crops with water

sentences.english: It really irritates me when he doesn’t help around the house.
sentences.chinese: 家里的事情他一点都不帮忙，真让我恼火。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel annoyed or impatient, especially by doing something many times or for a long period of time

sentences.english: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.chinese: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

detailed_translations.chinese: 发行； 分发， 发出
detailed_translations.english: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

sentences.english: The tourists were jabbering away on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 那些游客在公共汽车上叽叽呱呱地说话。

detailed_translations.english: to talk quickly in an excited and unclear way – used to show disapproval

name: jaded
trans: adj. 厌倦的，没兴趣没热情的

sentences.english: The concert should satisfy even the most jaded critic.
sentences.chinese: 这场音乐会应该能让最不易打动的评论家都觉得满意。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is jaded is no longer interested in or excited by something, usually because they have experienced too much of it

detailed_translations.chinese: 厌倦（jade的过去分词）；变得疲倦；精疲力竭

detailed_translations.english: to joke or jest (about)

sentences.english: Keep it simple and avoid the use of jargon.
sentences.chinese: 简单点，避免使用术语。

detailed_translations.english: words and expressions used in a particular profession or by a particular group of people, which are difficult for other people to understand – often used to show disapproval

name: jaundice
trans: n. (因嫉妒或厌世而产生的）偏见

sentences.english: Leptospirosis causes severe jaundice, kidney failure and bleeding in the lungs.
sentences.chinese: 钩端螺旋体导致严重的黄疸、肾衰竭和肺出血。

sentences.english: The "yellow" in the name is explained by the jaundice that affects some patients, causing yellow eyes and yellow skin.
sentences.chinese: 名称中的“黄”字由影响一些患者的黄疸使眼睛和皮肤颜色发黄而得到解释。

detailed_translations.english: a medical condition in which your skin and the white part of your eyes become yellow

sentences.english: He had a jaunty walk.
sentences.chinese: 他步履轻快。

sentences.english: Her hat was set at a jaunty angle.
sentences.chinese: 她歪戴着帽子，显得很活泼。

detailed_translations.english: showing that you are confident and happy

sentences.english: jejune political opinions
sentences.chinese: 幼稚的政治观点

detailed_translations.english: ideas that are jejune are too simple

name: jettison
trans: vt. 放弃，拒绝接受（想法，计划等）

sentences.english: We're going to jettison the cargo.
sentences.chinese: 我们正准备投弃货物。

detailed_translations.english: to throw things away, especially from a moving plane or ship

sentences.english: Thousands of jobs are in jeopardy.
sentences.chinese: 数千个工作岗位岌岌可危。

detailed_translations.english: in danger of being lost or harmed

sentences.english: I wasn’t sure whether to treat her words as a jest.
sentences.chinese: 我吃不准是否该把她的话当成玩笑。

detailed_translations.english: something you say that is intended to be funny, not serious
to say things that you do not really mean in order to amuse people

sentences.english: "No doubt he'll give me the chance to fight him again," he jibed.
sentences.chinese: “毫无疑问，他会给我机会与他再打一次。”他嘲讽道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 嘲笑, 与一致, 使转向
detailed_translations.english: To jibe means to say something rude or insulting that is intended to make another person look foolish

name: jingoist
trans: n. 极端爱国激进分子（通常表现为好战的对外政策）

sentences.english: He sounded in a jocular mood.
sentences.chinese: 他听上去心情很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱开玩笑的；打趣的；滑稽的
detailed_translations.english: joking or humorous

sentences.english: A poet could not but be gay in such a jocund company.
sentences.chinese: 一个诗人在这种兴高采烈的同伴中自然而然地会快乐。

sentences.english: Her jocund character made her the most popular girl in the county.
sentences.chinese: 她快乐的个性使她成为这个郡最受欢迎的女孩。

detailed_translations.english: of a humorous temperament; merry

sentences.english: I go jogging every morning.
sentences.chinese: 我每天早晨都去慢跑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 慢跑；轻推；蹒跚行进；使颠簸
detailed_translations.english: to run slowly and steadily, especially as a way of exercising
a slow steady run, especially done as a way of exercising

sentences.english: We jolted along rough wet roads through an endless banana plantation.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿崎岖潮湿的公路颠簸着驶过无边无际的香蕉种植园。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly and roughly, or to make someone or something move in this way

detailed_translations.chinese: 颠簸；摇晃；震惊；严重挫折
detailed_translations.english: a sudden shock

sentences.english: Could you just jot his name on there?
sentences.chinese: 你能就把他的名字简单记在那儿吗？

detailed_translations.english: If you jot something short such as an address somewhere, you write it down so that you will remember it

sentences.english: Father Whittaker appeared to be in a jovial mood.
sentences.chinese: 惠特克神父似乎心情非常好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 天性快活的；主神朱庇特的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person as jovial, you mean that they are happy and behave in a cheerful way

sentences.english: Radicals were jubilant at getting rid of him.
sentences.chinese: 激进分子因为除掉了他而欣喜若狂。

sentences.english: The fans were in jubilant mood as they left the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 球迷们离开体育场时兴高采烈。

detailed_translations.english: extremely happy and pleased because of a success

sentences.english: a judicious choice
sentences.chinese: 审慎而明智的选择

detailed_translations.chinese: 明智的；头脑精明的；判断正确的
detailed_translations.english: done in a sensible and careful way

name: juggernaut
trans: n. 无法阻挡的力量，摧毁一切的强大力量

sentences.english: mysteries beyond our ken
sentences.chinese: 我们无法理解的神秘事物

detailed_translations.chinese: 视野范围，见地，知识范围
detailed_translations.english: if something is beyond your ken, you have no knowledge or understanding of it

sentences.english: Police appealed for wit­nesses after a woman was kidnapped at gunpoint.
sentences.chinese: 一名妇女遭到持枪绑架，警方呼吁目击者挺身而出。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone somewhere illegally by force, often in order to get money for returning them

sentences.english: We watched as the fire slowly kindled.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着火慢慢地燃烧起来。

detailed_translations.english: to start burning; to make a fire start burning

name: kindred
trans: adj. 类似的；具有相似或相近的起源、本性或性质的

sentences.english: The protest included members of Free the Streets and kindred organisations.
sentences.chinese: 参加此次抗议的包括“解放街头”组织以及类似团体的成员。

detailed_translations.english: belonging to the same group or family
your whole family

sentences.english: He's got the knack of getting people to listen.
sentences.chinese: 他有让人们倾听的诀窍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诀窍；本领；熟练技术；巧妙手法
detailed_translations.english: a natural skill or ability

sentences.english: My grandmother taught me how to knit.
sentences.chinese: 我祖母教过我编织。

sentences.english: She’s knitting a sweater.
sentences.chinese: 她在织毛衣。

detailed_translations.english: to make clothing out of wool, using two knitting needles

sentences.english: a knotty problem
sentences.chinese: 棘手的问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 多节的， 多瘤的； 困难的， 棘手的
detailed_translations.english: knotty wood contains a lot of hard round places where branches once joined the tree

sentences.english: He acquired kudos just by appearing on television.
sentences.chinese: 他上电视后就出名了。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being admired and respected for being important or for doing something important

sentences.english: Such physical entanglements are usually labile.
sentences.chinese: 这种物理缠结往往是不稳定的。

sentences.english: It not only constraint the development of state economy, but also increase polarize very probably, result in labile factor and serious potential problem for social security.
sentences.chinese: 解决的不好，它不但会制约社会经济的发展，而且很有可能加大两极分化，造成不稳定因素，为社会安全带来巨大隐患。

sentences.english: By using sequential fumigation-incubation method, the soil labile carbon in a secondary Quercus variabilis forest and a Pinus taeda plantation in hilly area of South Jiangsu, China was investigated.
sentences.chinese: 采用重复熏蒸-培养法研究了苏南丘陵地区具有代表性的栓皮栎次生林和火炬松人工林土壤有效碳的变化特征。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易变化的， 不稳定的
detailed_translations.english: (of a compound) prone to chemical change

sentences.english: the laborious business of drying the crops
sentences.chinese: 把收获的庄稼晒干这一艰苦的工作

detailed_translations.english: taking a lot of time and effort

name: labyrinth
trans: adj. 迷宫似的，复杂曲折的

sentences.english: ...the labyrinth of corridors.
sentences.chinese: …迷宫般的走廊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迷宫；[解剖] 迷路；难解的事物
detailed_translations.english: a large network of paths or passages which cross each other, making it very difficult to find your way

sentences.english: Its claws lacerated his thighs.
sentences.chinese: 它的爪子挠伤了他的大腿。

detailed_translations.english: If something lacerates your skin, it cuts it badly and deeply

name: lachrymose
trans: adj. 催人泪下的，悲伤的

sentences.english: ...the tears of lachrymose mourners.
sentences.chinese: ...止不住哭泣的送葬者的泪水。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱哭的； 引人落泪的
detailed_translations.english: often crying

name: laconic
trans: adj. 简洁（以至于显得粗鲁或难以理解）的

sentences.english: Usually so laconic in the office, Dr. Lahey seemed less guarded, more relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 平常在办公室里寡言少语的莱希医生似乎少了些拘谨，多了几分轻松。

detailed_translations.english: using only a few words to say something

sentences.english: And you can be sure that when the referee cheats our boys, I'll be ready to lambaste him.
sentences.chinese: 而且你可以放心，如果裁判对孩子们不公平，我会公开斥责他。

detailed_translations.english: If you lambaste someone, you criticize them severely, usually in public

name: lament
trans: v.为…哀悼，表达痛苦或遗憾

sentences.english: The nation lamented the death of its great war leader.
sentences.chinese: 举国上下都在哀悼他们伟大的战时领袖。

detailed_translations.english: to express feelings of great sadness about something
a song, piece of music, or something that you say, that expresses a feeling of sadness

name: libelous
trans: adj. 恶意中伤的，诽谤的

sentences.english: An alternative to monetary damages is an injunction prohibiting publication of the allegedly libelous material.
sentences.chinese: 除经济赔偿之外的另一种做法是颁布禁令，禁止发表被指称诽谤的材料。

sentences.english: This borderline-libelous MTV advert produced for World Aids Day highlights how your partner's past conquests may come back to haunt them, and you.
sentences.chinese: 这则疑似诽谤的MTV广告为世界艾滋病日而作。 它强调了你以往的交往对象们也许会困扰你们。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister was frequently lampooned in political cartoons.
sentences.chinese: 首相在政治漫画里频遭嘲讽。

sentences.english: ...his scathing lampoons of consumer culture.
sentences.chinese: ...他对消费文化的尖刻讥讽。

sentences.english: The style Shelley is using here is that of popular lampoon.
sentences.chinese: 这里雪莱用的是通俗的嘲讽手法。

detailed_translations.english: to criticize someone or something in a humorous way that makes them seem stupid
A lampoon is a piece of writing or speech which criticizes someone or something very strongly, using humorous means

name: languid
trans: adj. 没精打采的，虚弱的

sentences.english: He greeted Charles with a languid wave of his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他无精打采地挥挥手，算是和查尔斯打招呼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倦怠的；呆滞的；软弱无力的

sentences.english: The housing market continues to languish.
sentences.chinese: 住宅市场继续疲软。

sentences.english: The shares are languishing at just 46p after yesterday’s fall.
sentences.chinese: 股价经历了昨天的下跌后，就停滞在46便士上了。

sentences.english: West Ham United are currently languishing at the bottom of the league.
sentences.chinese: 西汉姆联队目前在联赛中一直排名垫底。

detailed_translations.english: ifsomething languishes, it fails to improve and develop or become successful

detailed_translations.chinese: 疲倦；无精打采；柔情；呆滞

name: lank
trans: adj. 不僵硬的，柔软松弛的

detailed_translations.chinese: 细长的； 长、 直且柔软的

sentences.english: I had a little lapse of concentration in the middle of the race.
sentences.chinese: 我在比赛中走了一下神。

sentences.english: He was a genius and because of it you could accept lapses of taste.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个天才，因此他偶失得体，人们也可以接受。

detailed_translations.english: A lapse of something such as concentration or judgment is a temporary lack of that thing, which can often cause you to make a mistake

sentences.english: Giant waves lashed the sea wall.
sentences.chinese: 巨浪拍打着海堤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鞭打；冲击；摆动；扎捆；煽动；讽刺
detailed_translations.english: to tie something tightly to something else with a rope

detailed_translations.chinese: 鞭打；睫毛；鞭子；责骂；讽刺
detailed_translations.english: a hit with a whip, especially as a punishment

sentences.english: Symptoms of anaemia include general fatigue and lassitude.
sentences.chinese: 贫血症状包括全身疲劳和困乏。

detailed_translations.english: tiredness and lack of energy or interest

sentences.english: latent aggression
sentences.chinese: 潜在的侵略

detailed_translations.english: something that is latent is present but hidden, and may develop or become more noticeable in the future

sentences.english: The birds breed in northern latitudes.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟在北纬地区繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: The latitude of a place is its distance from the equator.

sentences.english: a laudatory biography
sentences.chinese: 颂扬有加的传记

detailed_translations.english: expressing praise

name: lavish
trans: adj. 奢侈的，大量的 ，无节制的

sentences.english: a royal palace on a lavish scale
sentences.chinese: 庞大的皇宫

detailed_translations.english: very generous
to give someone or something a lot of love, praise, money etc

name: leaven
trans: vt. 在…中加入轻松、活泼或变更的因素

sentences.english: Made light and high by yeast or other leaven.
sentences.chinese: 发酵的用酵母或其它发酵剂使… 轻而高。

sentences.english: These men have been the leaven in the lump of the race.
sentences.chinese: 如果说这个种族是块面团，这些人便是发酵剂。

sentences.english: ...men standing around, swilling beer and occasionally leering at passing females.
sentences.chinese: …男人们站在周围，大口喝着啤酒，偶尔色迷迷地斜瞟着过路的女性。

detailed_translations.english: If someone leers at you, they smile in an unpleasant way, usually because they are sexually interested in you

sentences.english: Executives say they are leery of the proposed system.
sentences.chinese: 行政人员们说他们对拟建的系统持怀疑态度。

sentences.english: They were leery about investing in a company controlled by a single individual.
sentences.chinese: 他们不太放心把资金投向一间由一人独自操控的公司。

detailed_translations.english: If you are leery of something, you are cautious and suspicious about it and try to avoid it

sentences.english: She received a small legacy from her aunt.
sentences.chinese: 她从姨妈那里继承了一小笔遗产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产，遗赠；先人(或过去)留下的东西
detailed_translations.english: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

sentences.english: Thousands of ex-army officers have found lucrative jobs in private security firms.
sentences.chinese: 成千上万的退役军官在私人保安公司找到了薪水丰厚的工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有利可图的，赚钱的；合算的
detailed_translations.english: a job or activity that is lucrative lets you earn a lot of money

sentences.english: ...the Sudan-based troops of the Libyan Islamic Legion.
sentences.chinese: …在苏丹驻扎的利比里亚伊斯兰教军团部队。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of soldiers, especially in ancient Rome
very many

sentences.english: the lenient sentences handed down by some judges
sentences.chinese: 一些法官作出的宽大判决

sentences.english: School examiners say that marking has become more lenient in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 学校的阅卷人称近年来评分标准放宽了。

detailed_translations.english: not strict in the way you punish someone or in the standard you expect

name: lethal
trans: adj. 非常有害的，致命的

sentences.english: a lethal dose of heroin
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的海洛因

sentences.english: a lethal weapon
sentences.chinese: 致命的武器

sentences.english: death by lethal injection
sentences.chinese: 注入致命剂量造成的死亡

sentences.english: a lethal cocktail of drink and pills
sentences.chinese: 一种酒和药的致命混合物

detailed_translations.english: causing death, or able to cause death

name: lethargic
trans: adj. 没精打采的，行动迟缓的

sentences.english: The cat became lethargic and had trouble breathing.
sentences.chinese: 这只猫整天昏睡而且呼吸困难。

sentences.english: The koala seemed to be asleep, and I wondered for the first time just how one went about startling such a lethargic creature.
sentences.chinese: 那只树熊似乎睡着了。 第一次干这活儿，我真不知怎么去惊吓一只昏睡的动物。

sentences.chinese: 主办方表示他们也在考虑颁一个奖给速度最慢的细胞，因为这种昏睡细胞也是癌症治疗的福音。

sentences.english: Its argument is tightly constructed, and its forthright, lucid style exemplifies levelheaded and penetrating criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这本书的主题结构紧密， 直率、 明晰的风格例示了一种冷静而敏锐的文学评论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 头脑冷静的， 清醒的

sentences.english: At the time, Arnold had disapproved of such levity.
sentences.chinese: 那时候，阿诺德不赞成如此的轻浮行为。

detailed_translations.english: lack of respect or seriousness when you are dealing with something serious

sentences.english: Tenants have legal liability for any damage they cause.
sentences.chinese: 承租人造成任何损坏都要负法律责任。

sentences.english: The company had assets of $138 million and liabilities of $120.5 million.
sentences.chinese: 该公司有1.38亿美元资产和1.205亿美元的负债。

detailed_translations.english: legal responsibility for something, especially for paying money that is owed, or for damage or injury

sentences.english: I had quite liberal parents.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母思想很开明。

sentences.english: a liberal supply of drinks
sentences.chinese: 饮料的充足供应

detailed_translations.english: willing to understand and respect other people’s ideas, opinions, and feelings

sentences.english: She felt a little upset about her licentious behavior.
sentences.chinese: 她对他放肆的行为感到有点不舒服。

sentences.english: She felt a bit comfortlessness to his licentious behavior.
sentences.chinese: 她对他放肆的行为感到有点不舒服。

sentences.english: Saint Augustine, as you know before he became a Christian, had quite a kind of licentious life, sexually, and lived with women and … that kind of thing.
sentences.chinese: 我们都知道圣奥古斯丁在信主前过着一种性生活非常放纵的生活，诸如和很多女人同居之类。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a sexually immoral or uncontrolled way

sentences.english: She likens marriage to slavery.
sentences.chinese: 她把婚姻比作奴役。

detailed_translations.english: If you liken one thing or person to another thing or person, you say that they are similar

sentences.english: a limp handshake
sentences.chinese: 无力的握手

sentences.english: His body suddenly went limp.
sentences.chinese: 他突然身子一软。

detailed_translations.english: not firm or strong

detailed_translations.chinese: 跛行，一拐一拐地走；缓慢费力地前进
detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly and with difficulty because one leg is hurt or injured
the way someone walks when they are limping

sentences.english: He surprised all the doctors by lingering on for several weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他拖了几个星期才去世，让所有的医生都很惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: to continue looking at or dealing with something for longer than is usual or desirable
supple in the limbs or body; lithe; flexible

sentences.english: Make a list of all the things you have to do.
sentences.chinese: 把你必须做的所有事情列一个清单。

sentences.english: The first person on my list is Mrs Gilling.
sentences.chinese: 我的名单上排在第一位的是吉林夫人。

sentences.english: The guidebook lists 1,000 hotels and restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 旅游手册上列有1,000家宾馆和餐厅。

detailed_translations.english: a set of names, numbers etc, usually written one below the other, for example so that you can remember or check them
to write a list, or mention things one after the other

sentences.english: the strong lithe bodies of gymnasts
sentences.chinese: 体操运动员强壮柔韧的身体

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻盈的（等于lithesome）；柔软的；易弯曲的
detailed_translations.english: having a body that moves easily and gracefully

sentences.english: Sarah was loath to tell her mother what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉不愿意告诉母亲所发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: to be unwilling to do something

sentences.english: He loathes their politics.
sentences.chinese: 他讨厌他们那一套政治。

detailed_translations.english: to hate someone or something very much

sentences.english: He stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel, from whose lofty heights he could see across New York.
sentences.chinese: 他住在四季酒店，从酒店高处可以看到纽约的全景。

sentences.english: lofty ideals of equality and social justice
sentences.chinese: 平等和社会正义的崇高理想

detailed_translations.english: (of buildings, mountains, etc.) very high and impressive

sentences.english: He was lolling on the sofa in the shadows near the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他懒洋洋地躺在炉火边一个背光的沙发上。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or lie in a very lazy and relaxed way

sentences.english: a lopsided 8-0 victory
sentences.chinese: 8比0一边倒的胜利

detailed_translations.english: unequal or uneven, especially in an unfair way

sentences.english: He said that despite older adults being less “loquacious” or talkative than their younger adult counterparts, they elicit much more vocal responses when calling.
sentences.chinese: 他说，不管老人不太“饶舌”还是比年轻同伴更多话，他们呼叫时都能激发更多的语音回应。

detailed_translations.english: a loquacious person likes to talk a lot

sentences.english: I was appalled by the loutish behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 这种粗野行为令我大为震惊。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe a man or a boy as loutish, you are critical of them because their behaviour is impolite and aggressive

sentences.english: Lubricate all moving parts with grease.
sentences.chinese: 给所有活动部件加润滑油。

detailed_translations.chinese: 润滑；涂油；起润滑剂作用
detailed_translations.english: to put a lubricant on something in order to make it move more smoothly

name: lucid
trans: adj.表达清晰的，简单易懂的

sentences.english: You must write in a clear and lucid style.
sentences.chinese: 你的写作风格一定要清楚易懂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 明晰的；透明的；易懂的；头脑清楚的
detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is clear and easy to understand

sentences.english: You big lug!
sentences.chinese: 你这个大笨蛋！

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that sticks out and can be used as a handle or a support
to pull or carry something heavy with difficulty

sentences.english: his lugubrious tear-stained face
sentences.chinese: 他那张忧伤、泪痕斑斑的脸

detailed_translations.english: very sad and serious – sometimes used humorously

sentences.english: The hum of the tyres on the road lulled her to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 一路上滚滚的车轮声使她昏昏欲睡。

sentences.english: There was a lull in political violence after the election of the current president.
sentences.chinese: 现任总统选举结束以后，政治暴力曾暂时平息。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calm or as if they want to sleep
A lull is a period of quiet or calm in a longer period of activity or excitement

sentences.english: The mother was crooning a lullaby to her baby.
sentences.chinese: 母亲正对着婴儿哼着摇篮曲。

sentences.english: The mother was crooning a lullaby to her baby.
sentences.chinese: 母亲正对婴儿哼着摇篮曲。

sentences.english: The lullaby had the baby into the land of Nod in no time.
sentences.chinese: 催眠曲一下子就把婴儿送入了睡乡。

detailed_translations.english: a slow quiet song sung to children to make them go to sleep

sentences.english: A blue bus lumbered past.
sentences.chinese: 一辆蓝色公共汽车慢吞吞地驶过。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伐木；喧闹地向前走；笨重地行动，缓慢地移动
detailed_translations.english: to move in a slow awkward way

detailed_translations.chinese: 木材；废物，无用的杂物；隆隆声
detailed_translations.english: pieces of wood used for building, that have been cut to specific lengths and widths

sentences.english: luminaries of Parisian society
sentences.chinese: 巴黎社会的名流

detailed_translations.chinese: 发光体；杰出人物；知识渊博的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is very famous or highly respected for their skill at doing something or their knowledge of a particular subject

sentences.english: The property sector was another casualty of the lurch toward higher interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 房地产业是利率突然提高的又一受损行业。

detailed_translations.english: Lurch is also a noun
to walk or move suddenly in an uncontrolled or unsteady way

sentences.english: a dark formless danger, lurking in the shadows
sentences.chinese: 一种潜藏在阴影里的无形危险

detailed_translations.english: to wait somewhere quietly and secretly, usually because you are going to do something wrong

sentences.english: lush carpets
sentences.chinese: 华丽的地毯

detailed_translations.chinese: 丰富的，豪华的；苍翠繁茂的
detailed_translations.english: very beautiful, comfortable, and expensive
an  alcoholic

sentences.english: Her hair was beautifully dark and lustrous.
sentences.chinese: 她的秀发乌黑光亮。

detailed_translations.english: shining in a soft gentle way

sentences.english: a luxurious 30-room villa
sentences.chinese: 一栋有30个房间的豪华度假别墅

detailed_translations.english: very expensive, beautiful, and comfortable

sentences.english: Wordsworth was one of the greatest lyric poets of his time.
sentences.chinese: 华兹华斯是他那个时代最伟大的抒情诗人之一。

detailed_translations.english: expressing strong personal emotions such as love, in a way that is similar to music in its sounds and  rhythm
