sentences.chinese: 一旦有新的产量信息，世卫组织将能够修订其对大流行性流感疫苗供应的估算。

sentences.english: These recommendations are prudent measures which can limit the spread of many communicable diseases and not only the pandemic (H1N1) 2009 virus.
sentences.chinese: 这些建议均为审慎措施，可以限制许多传染病，不仅仅是2009年H1N1流感大流行病毒的传播。

sentences.english: There was complete pandemonium in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 厨房里乱哄哄的。

sentences.english: When the verdict was read pandemonium broke out in the courtroom.
sentences.chinese: 宣判的时候法庭上乱成一团。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is a lot of noise because people are angry, confused or frightened

sentences.english: The book is a panegyric on the intoxicating effects of marijuana.
sentences.chinese: 该书是一篇对大麻兴奋陶醉效应的颂词。

detailed_translations.english: a speech or piece of writing that praises someone or something a lot

sentences.english: The terrain's high points provide a panoramic view of Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 这一地带的制高点可以看见洛杉矶的全景。

detailed_translations.english: If you have a panoramic view, you can see a long way over a wide area

sentences.english: The provenance of the paintings is unknown.
sentences.chinese: 这些画出处不详。

detailed_translations.english: the place where something originally came from

sentences.english: ...a new paradigm of production.
sentences.chinese: …一种新的生产范例。

detailed_translations.english: a very clear or typical example of something

sentences.english: The Koran describes paradise as a place containing a garden of delight.
sentences.chinese: 《古兰经》把天堂描绘成一个拥有快乐花园的地方。

detailed_translations.english: in some religions, a perfect place where people are believed to go after they die, if they have led good lives

sentences.english: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
sentences.chinese: 悖论就是: 如果渔夫减少捕鱼，反而会打到更多的鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

sentences.english: We don't expect candidates to be paragons of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 我们不指望候选人都是道德完人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 模范；完美之物；优秀之人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is perfect or is extremely brave, good etc – often used humorously

sentences.english: During a war the interests of the state are paramount, and those of the individual come last.
sentences.chinese: 战争时期国家利益是首要的，个人利益置于最后。

sentences.english: Women’s role as mothers is of paramount importance to society.
sentences.chinese: 女性作为母亲的角色对社会至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最重要的，主要的；至高无上的
detailed_translations.english: more important than anything else

name: paranoid
trans: adj.多疑的，对他人极端恐惧和怀疑的

sentences.english: a patient suffering from paranoid schizophrenia
sentences.chinese: 一个偏执型精神分裂症病人

sentences.english: ...these sad, deluded paranoids.
sentences.chinese: …这些可悲的、被蒙蔽的妄想狂们。

detailed_translations.chinese: 类似妄想狂的；属于偏执狂的
detailed_translations.english: suffering from a mental illness that makes you believe that other people are trying to harm you

detailed_translations.chinese: 患妄想狂的人；偏执狂患者
detailed_translations.english: A paranoid is someone who is paranoid

sentences.english: The last two clauses were an exact quote rather than a paraphrase of Mr. Forth's remarks.
sentences.chinese: 最后两个分句是对福思先生言论的准确引用而不是改述。

to express in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written

sentences.english: These grains may parch, but they will not pop.
sentences.chinese: 这些谷类只能被烤干，却不可能爆开。

detailed_translations.english: if the sun or wind parches something, it makes it very dry

sentences.chinese: 插一句，我想补充的是这些结果还未得到证实。

detailed_translations.english: if you say something in parenthesis, you say it while you are talking about something else in order to add information or explain something

sentences.english: Women have yet to achieve wage or occupational parity in many fields.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们在许多领域尚有待获得薪酬或职业的平等。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平价；同等；相等；胎次；分娩
detailed_translations.english: the state of being equal, especially having equal pay, rights, or power

name: parody
trans: n.（以嘲笑原作作者的）模仿作品，恶搞

sentences.english: Her performance contains a strong element of self-parody (= when someone makes fun of their own style ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的表演包含了强烈的自嘲元素。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拙劣的模仿；诙谐的改编诗文
detailed_translations.english: something that is not a correct or acceptable example of something

sentences.chinese: 他突然勃然大怒。

sentences.chinese: 我们鹦鹉学舌般机械地背诵诗歌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鹦鹉；学舌者，应声虫；机械模仿别人的人
detailed_translations.english: a tropical bird with a curved beak and brightly coloured feathers that can be taught to copy human speech

sentences.english: It is far easier to parry a direct blow than to stop it forcibly.
sentences.chinese: 面对直接击打，挡开要比硬碰容易得多。

detailed_translations.english: to defend yourself against someone who is attacking you by pushing their weapon or hand to one side

detailed_translations.chinese: 吝啬的；过于节俭的；质量差的
detailed_translations.english: extremely unwilling to spend money

sentences.english: The exhibition was only a partial success.
sentences.chinese: 那次展会只获得部分成功。

sentences.english: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford

sentences.english: I might be accused of being partial.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会被人指责是偏袒的。

detailed_translations.english: not complete

sentences.english: Mr. Johnson particularizes the general points he wants to make.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊先生举例说明了他想要表达的主要观点。

detailed_translations.english: to give the details of something

sentences.english: British newspapers are highly partisan .
sentences.chinese: 英国报纸的立场壁垒分明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 党派的；效忠的；偏袒的；盲目推崇的
detailed_translations.english: strongly supporting a particular political party, plan or leader, usually without considering the other choices carefully
a member of an armed group that fights against an enemy that has taken control of its country

sentences.english: His bathroom is a brilliant pastiche of expensive interior design.
sentences.chinese: 他的浴室是高档室内设计的集大成之作。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing, music, film etc that is deliberately made in the style of someone or something else

sentences.english: ...new offices divided only by glass partitions.
sentences.chinese: …仅仅用玻璃隔板隔开的新办公室。

detailed_translations.chinese: 划分，分开；[数] 分割；隔墙；隔离物
detailed_translations.english: a thin wall that separates one part of a room from another
to divide a country, building, or room into two or more parts

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

sentences.english: a pathological hatred of women
sentences.chinese: 对女人的病态憎恨

sentences.english: a pathological liar
sentences.chinese: 病态说谎者

detailed_translations.chinese: 病态的， 不理智的； 病理学的

name: patina
trans: n.（由内而外散发的）氛围，气场

sentences.english: It has been suggested the founders were not true patriots but men out to protect their own interests.
sentences.chinese: 有人指出创建者并非真正的爱国者，而是一些维护自己利益的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who loves their country and is willing to defend it – used to show approval

name: patronize
trans: vt.以高人一等的态度对待

sentences.chinese: 别对我摆出一副纡尊降贵的样子！

sentences.english: The program focuses on kids’ interests without patronizing them.

sentences.english: Computers were once the exclusive province of scientists and mathematicians.
sentences.chinese: 计算机一度为科学家和数学家专用。

detailed_translations.english: a subject that someone knows a lot about or something that only they are responsible for

sentences.chinese: 已是冬天了，麻雀们能找到什么就啄食什么。

sentences.chinese: 戴高乐生来喜欢教育人。

sentences.chinese: “不完全是那个意思。”“书呆子。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 学究；书呆子；卖弄学问的人；空谈家
detailed_translations.english: someone who pays too much attention to rules or to small unimportant details, especially someone who criticizes other people in an extremely annoying way

sentences.chinese: 今天注定改变不了被强J的命运吗？

trans: adj.平庸无奇的，令人厌倦的

sentences.english: More than a third of all pedestrian injuries are to children.
sentences.chinese: 所有受伤的行人中有1/3以上是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is walking, especially along a street or other place used by cars

sentences.chinese: “十四分钟，”克里斯瞥了一眼手表说道。

sentences.chinese: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。

sentences.chinese: 对强硬派共和党来说，“自由”一词已成了贬义词。

sentences.chinese: 清澈的小溪

sentences.english: Mr English, an associate editor of the Guardian, is a polymath who wears his learning lightly.
sentences.chinese: 英格力士先生是《卫报》的副编辑，是一位略显才华的博学者。

sentences.chinese: 沈括（1031~1095 ），科学家、博学者、将军、外交家、财务官员，发明了指南针。

sentences.english: Explorer, , polymath, friend of Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, Thomas Jefferson and Simon Bolívar, Alexander von Humboldt was one of the greatest scientists of the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 探险家，博学者，歌德、杰弗逊和玻利瓦尔的朋友，洪堡是十九世纪最伟大的科学家之一，他的想法至今都没有过时。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has a lot of knowledge about many different subjects

sentences.chinese: 对跑车的酷爱

sentences.english: a penitent expression
sentences.chinese: 愧疚的表情

detailed_translations.english: feeling sorry because you have done something wrong, and are intending not to do it again
someone who is doing  penance

sentences.english: Jan looked pensive.
sentences.chinese: 简神情忧伤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉思的，忧郁的；悲伤的，哀愁的

sentences.chinese: 1644年他穷困潦倒而死。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being very poor

sentences.chinese: 根据传统法律要求市镇行政管理委员会成员每隔五年巡视边界一次。

sentences.chinese: 微小但可以察觉的变化

sentences.chinese: 那声音几乎听不见。

sentences.chinese: 要人肃静的蛮横要求

sentences.english: the parochial church council
sentences.chinese: 教区的教堂理事会

detailed_translations.chinese: 教区的；狭小的；地方范围的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular church and the area around it

sentences.english: Willful betrayal of fidelity, confidence, or trust; perfidy.
sentences.chinese: 背叛对忠诚、信任或信赖的有意背叛；

detailed_translations.english: when someone is not loyal to another person who trusts them

sentences.english: A broken rib had perforated her lung.
sentences.chinese: 一根肋骨骨折，刺穿了她的肺部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 穿孔于，打孔穿透；在…上打齿孔
detailed_translations.english: to make a hole or holes in something

sentences.english: She gave him a perfunctory smile.
sentences.chinese: 她对他漫不经心地笑了笑。

sentences.english: The applause was perfunctory.
sentences.chinese: 掌声听上去是在敷衍了事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 敷衍的；马虎的；得过且过的
detailed_translations.english: a perfunctory action is done quickly, and is only done because people expect it

sentences.english: ...the perimeter of the airport.
sentences.chinese: …机场周边。

detailed_translations.english: the whole length of the border around an area or shape

name: periodical
trans: adj.周期性的，有固定间隔的

sentences.english: She made periodical visits to her dentist.
sentences.chinese: 她定期去看牙医。

detailed_translations.english: Periodical events or situations happen occasionally, at fairly regular intervals
a magazine, especially one about a serious or technical subject

sentences.english: a peripatetic music teacher
sentences.chinese: 在多所学校任教的音乐教师

detailed_translations.english: travelling from place to place, especially in order to do your job

sentences.english: a diplomat who had a peripheral role in the negotiations
sentences.chinese: 在谈判中发挥辅助作用的外交官

sentences.english: Her involvement in the case was peripheral.
sentences.chinese: 她在这宗案件中是从犯。

detailed_translations.english: not as important as other things or people in a particular activity, idea, or situation
a piece of equipment that is connected to a computer and used with it, for example a  printer

sentences.english: Hundreds perished when the ship went down.
sentences.chinese: 轮船沉没，数百人罹难。

detailed_translations.english: to die, especially in a terrible or sudden way

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

sentences.english: the permeable cell membrane
sentences.chinese: 渗透性的细胞膜

detailed_translations.english: material that is permeable allows water, gas etc to pass through it

sentences.english: The smell of diesel oil permeated the air.
sentences.chinese: 空气里充斥着柴油的气味。

detailed_translations.english: if liquid, gas etc permeates something, it enters it and spreads through every part of it

sentences.english: the pernicious effects of poverty
sentences.chinese: 贫穷的危害性

sentences.english: the media’s pernicious influence
sentences.chinese: 媒体的有害影响

detailed_translations.chinese: 有害的；恶性的；致命的；险恶的
detailed_translations.english: very harmful or evil, often in a way that you do not notice easily

sentences.english: the perpetual snows of the mountaintops
sentences.chinese: 山顶的终年积雪

detailed_translations.english: permanent

sentences.english: The Puritans left England to escape being persecuted.
sentences.chinese: 清教徒离开了英国以躲避迫害。

detailed_translations.english: to treat someone cruelly or unfairly over a period of time, especially because of their religious or political beliefs

sentences.english: Her persistence paid off when she was offered the job of manager.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了经理的职位，不懈坚持终于有了回报。

sentences.chinese: “我为什么不能去？”威尔不死心地又问了一遍。

detailed_translations.english: determination to do something even though it is difficult or other people oppose it

sentences.english: ...one of the most perspicacious and perceptive historians of that period.
sentences.chinese: ...那个时期最敏锐、最有洞察力的历史学家之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有洞察力的；聪颖的；敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: good at judging and understanding people and situations

sentences.english: Secondly, this paper analyzes the relations between product perspicuity, which is treated as the key dimension of construction project, and transaction cost.
sentences.chinese: 其次，本文以产品明晰度为建设项目的关键特性，详细分析了它与各项建设项目交易成本的密切联系。

sentences.english: We can say: not only Marxist philosophy but also the whole philosophy history has ever been the history of the gradually perspicuity and deepenness of "practice" conception.
sentences.chinese: 可以这样说：不仅马克思主义哲学，而且整个哲学史都是“实践”范畴不断明晰、不断深化的发展史。

sentences.english: Secondly, carrying out MBO is beneficial to the perspicuity of the property right of the state-owned enterprises and the settlement of the problem of the "Red Hat" enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 第二个方面，笔者以为，通过MBO可以明晰国有企业产权，解决历史遗留下来的“红帽子”企业问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: （语言、文章、表达等的）明晰；简明
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being perspicuous

sentences.english: ...matters pertaining to naval district defence.
sentences.chinese: …与海军区域防卫有关的问题。

detailed_translations.english: If one thing pertains to another, it relates, belongs, or applies to it

sentences.english: Whenever they encounter something, they manage to see it through, strive forward toward it and deal with it confidently with indomitable will and pertinacious perseverance.
sentences.chinese: 无论他们遇到什么，他们将设法正视它，努力朝它前进，然后依靠顽强的意志和坚强的毅力自信地解决它。

sentences.english: Among the many traits that made Charles Darwin one of the greatest minds in science was his pertinacious personality.
sentences.chinese: 达尔文的各种特质中，让他成为最伟大科学智者之一的，是他执著的个性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 突如其来的；猛地落下的；急促的

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 沉淀，[化学] 沉淀物；降水；冰雹；坠落；鲁莽
detailed_translations.english: rain, snow etc that falls on the ground, or the amount of rain, snow etc that falls

sentences.english: a precipitous path
sentences.chinese: 陡峭的小路

detailed_translations.english: dangerously high or steep

sentences.english: rules that preclude experimentation in teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 禁止进行教学方法试验的规定

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something or make something impossible

sentences.english: Error is often the precursor of what is correct.
sentences.chinese: 错误常常是正确的先导。

sentences.english: Viewed as a precursor to a wider open data movement, it could be as important as any we have seen in the web era.
sentences.chinese: 它被视为更宽泛的数据开放运动的先导，它将像我们在互联网时代看到的所有重要的事物一样重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that happened or existed before something else and influenced its development

sentences.english: Kennedy’s predecessor as President was the war hero Dwight Eisenhower.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪总统的前任是战争英雄德怀特·艾森豪威尔。

sentences.chinese: ...他对跑车和骏马的偏爱。

sentences.english: Bombastic boasts—"We are positioned to become the preeminent provider of XYZ"—do not constitute a position.
sentences.chinese: 言过其实的自夸——“我们定位于成为XYZ的卓越供应商”——并不能构建其地位。

sentences.english: And there is every reason to think America will once again regain its preeminent role as an American powerhouse.
sentences.chinese: 我们也完全有理由相信，美国将再次赢得美利坚强国的卓越地位。

sentences.english: Sweden cars are extremely prestigious and reliable in the world for its preeminent safety performance, including SAAB.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典制造的轿车在世界上最为有口皆碑的是其超群的安全性能，萨博也不例外。

sentences.english: The law would preempt stronger local rules.
sentences.chinese: 该法律将预先制止更强硬的地方性法规。

sentences.english: "the survival of the fittest," a slogan that virtually preempted all debate.
sentences.chinese: “适者生存”，一个几乎无可辩驳的口号。

detailed_translations.chinese: 预先制止； 抢在…之前做或说
detailed_translations.english: If you preempt an action, you prevent it from happening by doing something that makes it unnecessary or impossible

sentences.english: 50% of men under 35 spend at least 20 minutes preening themselves every morning in the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 50%的35岁以下男性每天早上至少花20分钟在盥洗室精心打扮。

detailed_translations.english: if a bird preens or preens itself, it cleans itself and makes its feathers smooth using its beak

sentences.english: ...the preface to Kelman's novel.
sentences.chinese: …凯尔曼小说的前言。

sentences.english: I will preface what I am going to say with a few lines from Shakespeare.
sentences.chinese: 我将引用莎士比亚的几行诗作为我讲话的开场白。

detailed_translations.english: an introduction at the beginning of a book or speech
If you preface an action or speech with something else, you do or say this other thing first

sentences.english: care for pregnant women
sentences.chinese: 孕妇保健

sentences.english: I knew right away that I was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我立即明白我怀孕了。

sentences.english: I thought I was too old to get pregnant .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己年龄太大，已经不能怀孕了。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to get her pregnant (= make her pregnant ) .
sentences.chinese: 我没想让她怀孕。

sentences.english: His wife was heavily pregnant (= almost ready to give birth ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子即将临产。

sentences.chinese: 卡鲁佐斯的诗歌表现出对东正教的深切关注。

sentences.english: Livestock husbandry in grassland is the preponderant industry in Inner Mongolia.
sentences.chinese: 草原畜牧业是内蒙古的优势产业和基础产业。

sentences.english: Indium is one of Chinas preponderant scattered metals; it is often associated with polymetallic zinc ores and enriched into zinc sulfide concentrates after beneficiation.
sentences.chinese: 铟是我国的一种优势稀散金属资源，常与多金属锌矿伴生，经过选矿后，铟主要富集于硫化锌精矿中。

detailed_translations.english: greater in weight, force, influence, etc

sentences.english: The whole idea sounds absolutely preposterous!

sentences.english: This is nothing new.We have never been good at foretelling the future, but when the news isfavorable, others forgive our lack of prescience.
sentences.chinese: 像以往一样，我们从来不擅长对未来的预测，但是当都是好消息的时候，别人总是原谅我们缺乏预知。

sentences.english: That lack of prescience is hurting.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏先见之明，带来的是伤害。

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

sentences.english: a primitive society
sentences.chinese: 原始社会

sentences.english: a primitive nomadic tribe
sentences.chinese: 原始的游牧部落

sentences.english: primitive art
sentences.chinese: 原始艺术

sentences.chinese: 国王想通过战争来提高自己的威信。

sentences.english: This little-known British firm has now gained considerable prestige .
sentences.chinese: 这家名不见经传的英国公司如今已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: "Without being presumptuous, "he reports, "it has been my main objective for those twenty years to keep the highest possible level of service on what is, after all, a train.
sentences.chinese: “没有放肆，”他说，“这是我的主要目标是为那些二十年保持最高水准的服务是什么，毕竟，一列火车。”

sentences.english: Using as little pretense as possible (ideally none), ask the person if he or she would like to get together for a cup of coffee or do something similarly casual.
sentences.chinese: 在问对方是否愿意出来喝杯咖啡或做一些其他类似的事情的时候，尽量不要用虚伪的借口（理想中应该是一点虚假也没有）。

sentences.english: He felt possessed of a preternatural strength and fearlessness.
sentences.chinese: 他感到自己拥有异乎寻常的力量和勇气。

sentences.chinese: 该医生的预后是劳伦斯可能在12个月之内能走动。

sentences.chinese: 在我们的交往中，我一贯认为班特纳是诚实的典范。

sentences.chinese: 当时仍然很难获得食品、燃料和其他日用必需品。

sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

detailed_translations.english: able to do something well or skilfully

sentences.chinese: 能源浪费

sentences.chinese: ...一条令人愉悦的河，岸上开满了野花。

sentences.chinese: 计算机课程层出不穷。

sentences.chinese: 任何一个痛恨卡扎菲说话罗嗦的人，尤其是阿拉伯独裁君主们，他们例行公事似地攻击卡扎菲是“穿着长袍的老女人”，“犹太复国主义走狗”，和“懦夫和小偷”。

sentences.chinese: 有利时机

detailed_translations.english: good and likely to bring good results

sentences.chinese: 哈尔西被认为是进步教育价值观的首要支持者。

sentences.chinese: 严格遵守礼节的

sentences.chinese: 乏味的写作风格

sentences.chinese: 这项法令禁止种族歧视。

detailed_translations.english: to officially say that something is not allowed to exist or be done

sentences.chinese: 刑事诉讼

sentences.english: The evidence is not sufficient to bring a prosecution against him.
sentences.chinese: 现有证据不足以对他提出起诉。

detailed_translations.english: when a charge is made against someone for a crime, or when someone is judged for a crime in a court of law

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

sentences.english: a prosperous landowner
sentences.chinese: 富裕的土地拥有者

detailed_translations.english: rich and successful

sentences.chinese: 他们发现他趴在地板上。

sentences.english: They prostrated themselves before their king.
sentences.chinese: 他们向他们的国王跪拜行礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 俯卧的；拜倒的；降伏的；沮丧的
detailed_translations.english: lying on your front with your face towards the ground
If you prostrate yourself, you lie down flat on the ground, on your front, usually to show respect for God or a person in authority

sentences.english: He is a protean stylist who can move from blues to ballads and grand symphony.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位富有变化的艺术家，能从布鲁斯转换到民谣以及雄壮的交响乐。

sentences.chinese: 违反外交礼节

sentences.english: Delay always breeds danger; and to protract a great design is often to ruin it.
sentences.chinese: 推迟经常孕育危险；拖延一个伟大的工程常常意味着毁灭它。

sentences.english: To protract the suspense, he paused for a considerable period of time before telling us the result of the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 为了延长悬念，他在告诉我们实验结果之前停顿了相当一段时间。

sentences.english: ...a huge round mass of smooth rock protruding from the water.
sentences.chinese: …从水中突出来的一块光滑的圆形巨石。

sentences.chinese: 卢娜那双向外突出的眼睛惊讶地转向了他。

detailed_translations.english: careful and sensible in the way you plan things, especially by saving money for the future

sentences.english: The pistols were loaded so our escape is indeed providential.
sentences.chinese: 手枪是上了子弹的，所以我们能逃脱实在幸运。

detailed_translations.english: a providential event is a lucky one

sentences.chinese: 省级选举

sentences.english: the provincial government of Quebec
sentences.chinese: 魁北克省政府

sentences.english: We accept provisional bookings by phone.
sentences.chinese: 我们接受电话临时预约。

detailed_translations.english: great skill at doing something

if someone is on the prowl, they are moving around different places, looking for an opportunity to do something

name: prude
trans: n.过分正经的人：一个过分关心自己是否得体、谦逊或正确的人

sentences.english: Caroline was very much a prude. She wouldn't let me see her naked.
sentences.chinese: 卡罗琳是个过于一本正经的人。她不肯让我看到她的裸体。

sentences.chinese: 目的：建立雌性鹌鹑高尿酸血症模型并探讨其病理特征。

sentences.chinese: 他们为此仅支付给他10美元，真让人气愤。

sentences.chinese: 在圆柱腔体内插入一个内导体将会使工作模式附近的模谱变稀，从而有效的抑制模式竞争。

sentences.english: The parliaments of Australia and Indonesia have yet to ratify the treaty.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚和印度尼西亚议会还未批准该条约。

sentences.chinese: 布什皈依基督教福音派，该派强调主观情绪，尤其是狂热的再生体验，要凌驾于推理之上。

sentences.chinese: 合情推理是数学发现的重要方法，本文介绍了合情推理的概念、作用、途径。所论及的内容对数学教学有参考价值。

sentences.english: Fuel was rationed during the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争期间，燃油定量供应。

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

sentences.english: He was still ranting and raving the next morning.
sentences.chinese: 第二天上午他仍在大叫大嚷。

detailed_translations.english: to talk in an angry, uncontrolled, or crazy way

detailed_translations.chinese: 使纠缠， 纠结； 拆开， 拆散

sentences.english: She'll never know how close she came to being dragged off and ravished.
sentences.chinese: 她永远都不会知道她差一点就被人拖走强暴了。

sentences.english: In 1162 Milan was razed to the ground by imperial troops.
sentences.chinese: 1162年米兰被帝国军队夷为平地。

detailed_translations.chinese: 夷为平地；破坏；消除；拆毁
detailed_translations.english: to completely destroy a town or building

sentences.english: a family row
sentences.chinese: 家庭争吵

sentences.english: He had just had a row with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚和妻子吵了一架。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry argument, especially between people who know each other well

sentences.english: reactionary attitudes
sentences.chinese: 反动的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 保守的，反动的；反动主义的；反对改革的
detailed_translations.english: very strongly opposed to any social or political change - used to show disapproval

detailed_translations.chinese: 反动分子；反动派；保守派
detailed_translations.english: someone who strongly opposes any social or political change - used to show disapproval

sentences.english: an agreement which was to have significant ramifications for British politics
sentences.chinese: 后来对英国政治产生重大影响的一个协议

sentences.chinese: 老师们安慰焦急的父母。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less worried or frightened about a problem or situation

sentences.english: He received a humiliating rebuff from his manager.
sentences.chinese: 他遭到经理的断然拒绝，十分丢脸。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断然拒绝；回绝；漠不关心
detailed_translations.english: an unkind or unfriendly answer to a friendly suggestion or offer of help
If you rebuff someone or rebuff a suggestion that they make, you refuse to do what they suggest

sentences.chinese: 一名不服管教的学生

sentences.chinese: 新的基因出现并支配，不在隐性潜伏，然后生物就突变了。

detailed_translations.english: a recessive  gene  is passed to children from their parents only if both parents have the gene

name: recidivate
trans: vi.回到原先的习惯，尤指重新犯罪

sentences.english: When he spoke I was expected to reciprocate with some remark of my own.
sentences.chinese: 他在说话时，我也应该说点什么回应他。

detailed_translations.english: to do or give something, because something similar has been done or given to you

name: reckless
trans: adj.不考虑后果的，大胆鲁莽的

sentences.english: He was accused of causing death by reckless driving .
sentences.chinese: 他被控因鲁莽驾驶致人死亡。

sentences.english: a reckless disregard for safety
sentences.chinese: 不顾安全的鲁莽行为

sentences.english: He ran into the burning house with reckless abandon (= without caring about the danger ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不顾危险冲入着火的房子里。

detailed_translations.english: not caring or worrying about the possible bad or dangerous results of your actions

name: recluse
trans: n.隐士/adj.隐居的，不爱社交的

sentences.english: Stained glass windows, ceramic chimney and floral motifs adorn the house and make it an awe inspiring space for recluse.
sentences.chinese: 彩色玻璃窗户，陶瓷灯罩和花纹图案装饰的房子，让它对隐士来说成为一个令人敬畏的空间。

sentences.english: Nancy: Well, suit yourself. I don't recommend turning down too many invitations or you'll get a reputation for being a recluse.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，随你吧。我不建议你拒绝太多邀请，不然你会被别人当成一个隐居者（孤僻的人）

sentences.english: Terror of the lecher hope of the mad recluse: the sky! Black cover of the great cauldron in which boils vast imperceptible humanity.
sentences.chinese: 纵欲者的恐惧，疯隐士的希望：天空！那口大锅的黑色盖子锅中沸煮着无数渺小的人类。

detailed_translations.english: someone who chooses to live alone, and does not like seeing or talking to other people

sentences.english: We recoil in horror from the thought of subjecting someone to extreme pain.
sentences.chinese: 想到要让一个人经受极度的痛苦，我们就会恐惧地退缩。

sentences.english: ...his small body jerking in recoil from the volume of his shouting.
sentences.chinese: …他小小身体在他大声的叫喊中畏缩地抽搐着。

detailed_translations.english: to move back suddenly and quickly from something you do not like or are afraid of
Recoil is also a noun

sentences.english: The possibility remains that the two theories may be reconciled.
sentences.chinese: 这两种理论仍是有可能协调的。

sentences.english: The pair were reconciled after Jackson made a public apology.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊公开道歉之后，这两个人又言归于好了。

detailed_translations.english: if you reconcile two ideas, situations, or facts, you find a way in which they can both be true or acceptable

sentences.english: Her poems are modishly experimental in style and recondite in subject matter.
sentences.chinese: 她的诗在风格上时尚朦胧，在主题上深奥难懂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 深奥的；隐藏的；默默无闻的
detailed_translations.english: recondite facts or subjects are not known about or understood by many people

sentences.english: Google Earth has given scientists a way to scout terrain and cheaply reconnoiter habitats likely to produce new finds.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌地球（Google Earth）使科学家能够廉价地侦察地形，探索那些有可能出现新物种的栖息地。

sentences.english: Malicious users can use this information to reconnoiter the naming schema in your organization and attack key infrastructure services.
sentences.chinese: 恶意用户可以使用这个信息来侦察您的组织机构的名计划，并攻击关键基本设施服务。

sentences.english: Malicious users can use this information to reconnoiter the naming schema in your organization and attack key infrastructure services.
sentences.chinese: 恶意用户可以行使这个信息来侦察您的构造机构的名筹划，并进攻关键根本办法做事。

name: reconstitute
trans: vt.重建，（尤其是通过加水）使复原

sentences.english: The committees will be reconstituted after the election.
sentences.chinese: 委员会将在选举后改组。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新组成, 重新设立
detailed_translations.english: to form an organization or a group again in a different way

sentences.english: He was feeling guilty and depressed, repentant and scared.
sentences.chinese: 他现在觉得既内疚又沮丧，既悔恨又害怕。

detailed_translations.english: sorry for something wrong that you have done

sentences.english: ...people of the utmost moral rectitude.
sentences.chinese: ...道义上极度正直的人。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is honest and morally correct

sentences.english: He looked down at the recumbent figure.
sentences.chinese: 他向下看着躺着的身影。

detailed_translations.chinese: 靠着的， 斜躺着的； 休息的
detailed_translations.english: lying down on your back or side

sentences.english: We’ve recuperated our losses.
sentences.chinese: 我们已挽回损失。

detailed_translations.english: to get better again after an illness or injury

sentences.english: ...percussion instruments, redolent of Far Eastern cultures.
sentences.chinese: ...使人联想到了远东文化的打击乐器。

detailed_translations.chinese: 芬芳的；有…香味的；令人想起…的
detailed_translations.english: making you think of something

sentences.english: He is a redoubtable fighter.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位可敬的战士。

sentences.english: The redoubtable American woman played her part.
sentences.chinese: 可敬的美国妇女作出了其贡献。

sentences.english: A strong continuity of tradition and custom had guided the redoubtable islanders of the far east across the centuries .
sentences.chinese: 传统和习俗的牢固延续，曾经引导这些可畏的远东岛民度过许多世纪。

sentences.english: Seventy factory workers were made redundant in the resulting cuts.
sentences.chinese: 在继而发生的裁员中，70名工厂工人被解雇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过剩的；失业的，被解雇的
detailed_translations.english: if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you

sentences.english: Andy reeled away from the bar and knocked over his stool.
sentences.chinese: 安迪踉跄着离开吧台，把凳子都撞倒了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 摇摇晃晃地移动，蹒跚；眩晕，发昏
detailed_translations.english: to walk in an unsteady way and almost fall over, as if you are drunk
a round object onto which film, wire, a special string for fishing etc can be wound
to wind (cotton, thread, etc) onto a reel

name: referee
trans: n.仲裁者；裁判员/vt.（就纠纷或争议）给出意见

sentences.english: His headmaster agreed to act as his referee.
sentences.chinese: 他的校长同意做他的推荐人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who makes sure that the rules of a sport such as football,  basketball  , or  boxing  , are followed
to be the referee of a game

sentences.english: Oil is refined to remove naturally occurring impurities.
sentences.chinese: 油经过提炼去除天然生成的杂质。

detailed_translations.english: When a substance is refined, it is made pure by having all other substances removed from it

sentences.english: The drop in consumer spending reflects concern about the economy.
sentences.chinese: 消费支出的下降反映出人们对经济的担忧。

detailed_translations.english: if a person or a thing is reflected in a mirror, glass, or water, you can see an image of the person or thing on the surface of the mirror, glass, or water

sentences.english: ...refractory priests who refused to side with the king.
sentences.chinese: ...拒绝支持国王的桀骜不驯的牧师。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难治的；难熔的；不听话的
detailed_translations.english: a refractory disease or illness is hard to treat or cure

sentences.english: Answer: Anyone can use a happy feeling to wish a refulgent result.
sentences.chinese: 答：任何人都可以用幸福的心情期待辉煌的成果。

sentences.english: "Lange" wants to create more refulgent tomorrow in the field of decoration.
sentences.chinese: “兰格”在装饰领域要创造更加辉煌的明天。

sentences.english: The development and progress of sentiment-area need your support! I hope that all of us will get together to build sentiment-area more refulgent ! thank you!
sentences.chinese: 情感区的发展和进步需要你们的帮助！我希望我们能一起把情感区建设得更加辉煌！谢谢！

detailed_translations.english: shining, brilliant, or radiant

sentences.english: It was the kind of rumour that it is impossible to refute.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种不可能推翻的谣言。

detailed_translations.english: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

name: regenerate
trans: vt.使重获新生，使焕然一新

sentences.english: Small nodules form as the liver cells regenerate.
sentences.chinese: 肝细胞再生时会形成一些小结节。

detailed_translations.chinese: 新生， 再生， 起革新作用
detailed_translations.english: to grow again, or make something grow again
to grow again, or make something grow again

sentences.english: Patients maintain a strict dietary regimen.
sentences.chinese: 病人严格遵守饮食规律。

detailed_translations.chinese: [医] 养生法；生活规则；政体；支配
detailed_translations.english: a special plan of food, exercise etc that is intended to improve your health

sentences.english: If your child regresses to babyish behaviour, all you know for certain is that the child is under stress.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的孩子退步到幼稚的行为，你可以肯定的是孩子正处在压力之下。

detailed_translations.english: When people or things regress, they return to an earlier and less advanced stage of development

sentences.english: a special unit for rehabilitating stroke patients
sentences.chinese: 协助中风患者康复的特殊病房

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复地位；使残疾者恢复正常的生活
detailed_translations.english: to help someone to live a healthy, useful, or active life again after they have been seriously ill or in prison

sentences.english: a wedding rehearsal
sentences.chinese: 婚礼的预演

detailed_translations.chinese: 排演；预演；练习；训练；叙述
detailed_translations.english: a time when all the people in a play, concert etc practise before a public performance

name: reign
trans: n.统治权/vi.占统治地位或盛行

sentences.english: Last night confusion reigned about how the debate, which continues today, would end.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，这场在今天继续进行的辩论将如何结束的问题令人困惑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 当政， 统治； 占主导地位
detailed_translations.english: If you say, for example, that silence reigns in a place or confusion reigns in a situation, you mean that the place is silent or the situation is confused

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主的统治，君主的统治时期
detailed_translations.english: the period when someone is king, queen, or  emperor

sentences.english: Cord held the reins while the stallion tugged and snorted.
sentences.chinese: 当那匹牡马使劲挣扎，打着响鼻的时候，科德勒紧了缰绳。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow band of leather that is fastened around a horse’s head in order to control it

detailed_translations.chinese: 勒缰使停步； 控制， 约束

sentences.english: Let me reiterate the most important points.
sentences.chinese: 我来把最重要的几点重申一遍。

detailed_translations.english: to repeat a statement or opinion in order to make your meaning as clear as possible

sentences.english: Today you may rejoice because of contacts, news or visits from friends who live in another city or country.
sentences.chinese: 今天您可能因为得到来自另一个城市或国家的朋友的联系、消息或拜访而感到高兴。

sentences.english: Why is it that we rejoice at a birth and grieve at a funeral? Is it because we are not the person concerned?
sentences.chinese: 我们为何在（人家）出生之时高兴而在殡殓之时又悲伤呢？是否因为我们不属于关人士才这样的？

sentences.english: "I wish I did," said Phil Jordan, relapsing into his usual gloom.
sentences.chinese: “我要是做了就好了，”菲尔•乔丹说着，回到平时的忧郁中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故态复萌；旧病复发；再度堕落；再陷邪道
detailed_translations.english: to become ill again after you have seemed to improve

detailed_translations.chinese: 复发，再发；故态复萌；回复原状
detailed_translations.english: when someone becomes ill again after having seemed to improve

sentences.english: her relentless determination to succeed
sentences.chinese: 她要成功的坚定决心

sentences.english: a regime that was relentless in its persecution of dissidents
sentences.chinese: 无情迫害持不同政见者的政权

detailed_translations.chinese: 无情的；残酷的；不间断的
detailed_translations.english: strict, cruel, or determined, without ever stopping

sentences.english: Relevant documents were presented in court.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.english: We received all the relevant information.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

detailed_translations.english: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

sentences.english: Her face wore a reminiscent smile.
sentences.chinese: 她面带微笑，沉浸在往事之中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀旧的，回忆往事的；耽于回想的
detailed_translations.english: thinking about the past

sentences.english: No one wants to relinquish power once they have it.
sentences.chinese: 人一旦有了权就不想放弃。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone else have your position, power, or rights, especially unwillingly

sentences.english: I relish the challenge of doing jobs that others turn down.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢接受挑战做别人拒绝做的工作。

sentences.english: The three men ate with relish.
sentences.chinese: 那3个人吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: to enjoy an experience or the thought of something that is going to happen
Relish is also a noun

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

sentences.english: I would be remiss if I did not do something about it.
sentences.chinese: 如果我对此不做点儿什么，就是懈怠。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怠慢的；迟缓的；不小心的
detailed_translations.english: If someone is remiss, they are careless about doing things that ought to be done

sentences.english: Paul resented the fact that Carol didn’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 保罗非常气愤，因为卡萝尔不信任他。

detailed_translations.english: to feel angry or upset about a situation or about something that someone has done, especially because you think that it is not fair

sentences.english: angry remonstrances
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的抗议

detailed_translations.english: a complaint or protest

sentences.english: Throughout the trial, he had shown no remorse .
sentences.chinese: 整个审判过程中，他没有表示出一丝悔意。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of being sorry that you have done something very bad

sentences.english: You will be remunerated and so will your staff.
sentences.chinese: 你将会得到报酬，你的员工也会。

detailed_translations.english: If you are remunerated for work that you do, you are paid for it

sentences.english: ...pain that rends the heart.
sentences.chinese: ...撕心裂肺的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to tear or break something violently into pieces

sentences.english: a renegade army unit
sentences.chinese: 一支变节的陆军分队

detailed_translations.english: someone who leaves one side in a war, politics etc in order to join the opposing side – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: Edward renounced his claim to the French throne.
sentences.chinese: 爱德华宣布放弃对法国王位的继承权。

sentences.english: She renounced her citizenship.
sentences.chinese: 她宣布放弃国籍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣布放弃；与…断绝关系；垫牌
detailed_translations.english: if you renounce an official position, title, right etc, you publicly say that you will not keep it any more

sentences.english: The hotel has been renovated and redecorated.
sentences.chinese: 酒店已经翻新，并重新装饰。

detailed_translations.english: to repair a building or old furniture so that it is in good condition again

sentences.english: witty repartee
sentences.chinese: 机智的应答

detailed_translations.english: conversation which is fast and full of intelligent and amusing remarks and replies

sentences.english: After the war, prisoners were repatriated.
sentences.chinese: 战后，战俘被遣返。

detailed_translations.english: to send someone back to their own country

sentences.english: The government has just repealed the law segregating public facilities.
sentences.chinese: 政府刚刚废除了隔离公共设施的法令。

sentences.english: Next year will be the 60th anniversary of the repeal of Prohibition.
sentences.chinese: 明年将是禁酒令废止的60周年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 废除；撤销；废止；放弃；否定
detailed_translations.english: if a government repeals a law, it officially ends that law
Repeal is also a noun

sentences.english: The smell repelled him.
sentences.chinese: 这气味让他反感。

detailed_translations.english: if something repels you, it is so unpleasant that you do not want to be near it, or it makes you feel ill

name: repertoire
trans: n.（技术、设备或原料等的）详单

sentences.english: the behavioural repertoire of infants
sentences.chinese: 婴幼儿的行为能力

detailed_translations.english: all the plays, pieces of music etc that a performer or group knows and can perform

sentences.english: This is the common fate of mortal men, useless it is to repine .
sentences.chinese: 这是凡人的共同命运，抱怨也没有用。

detailed_translations.english: to be fretful or low-spirited through discontent

sentences.english: The harbour was replete with boats.
sentences.chinese: 港口里满是船只。

detailed_translations.english: full of something

sentences.english: The delightful sofa invites repose.
sentences.chinese: 这么舒适的沙发不由得让人想躺下休息。

sentences.english: Near the Azores, just below the sunlit Atlantic surface, sperm whales float in vertical repose.
sentences.chinese: 在亚速尔群岛附近，大西洋表面太阳照射不到的地方，抹香鲸垂直着身体休息。

detailed_translations.english: if something reposes somewhere, it has been put there

sentences.english: Peter should withdraw and that St. Paul should publicly reprehend him, for the instruction of all.
sentences.chinese: 他们一致认为，应撤销圣彼得和圣保罗应当公开申斥他的指示所有。

name: repress
trans: vt.阻止（正常的表达、活动或发展等）

sentences.english: He had long ago repressed the painful memories of his childhood.
sentences.chinese: 他长久压抑着儿时的痛苦记忆。

detailed_translations.english: if someone represses upsetting feelings, memories etc, they do not allow themselves to express or think about them

sentences.english: As for my unlikely allies, I think that I shall allow them a reprieve.
sentences.chinese: 至于我的盟友们，我想我应该给他们一个缓刑的机会。

sentences.english: You will be converted—you will be converted just as soon as every effort to compass pardon, commutation, or reprieve HAS failed—and then!
sentences.chinese: 您会痛悔前非——就在人们为您恳求赦免、申请减刑、或改判缓刑的一切努力统告失败的时候，您会痛悔前非的。

detailed_translations.english: to officially stop a prisoner from being killed as a punishment
a delay before something bad happens or continues to happen

sentences.english: ‘You don’t need me,’ she said quietly, without reproach.
sentences.chinese: “你不需要我。”她语气平静，没有丝毫责备。

detailed_translations.english: criticism, blame, or disapproval

name: reprobate
trans: n.堕落者，道德败坏的人/adj.堕落的，放荡的

sentences.english: Surely His pleading with the lost, His offers of mercy to the reprobate, and the call of the gospel to all who hear are all sincere expressions of the heart of a loving God.
sentences.chinese: 他对迷失方向的的人的恳求，他对堕落的人的同情，他对所有听到他声音的人施与福音，这一切真挚的表达都源于他充满爱的心。

sentences.english: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
sentences.chinese: 他们说是认识神行事却和他相背。 本是可憎恶的，是悖逆的，在各样善事上是可废弃的。

sentences.english: She greeted me with a look of cold reproof.
sentences.chinese: 她对我报以冷淡、责备的目光。

detailed_translations.english: blame or disapproval

sentences.english: "There's no call for talk like that," Mrs. Evans reproved him.
sentences.chinese: “没有必要说那种话，”埃文斯太太责备他道。

detailed_translations.english: to criticize someone for something that they have done

sentences.english: He repudiated all offers of friendship.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝任何人给他的友谊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝；否定；批判；与…断绝关系；拒付
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept or continue with something

sentences.english: Everything about the affair was repugnant to her.
sentences.chinese: 有关那件事的一切令她反感。

sentences.english: Government troops repulsed an attack by rebel forces.
sentences.chinese: 政府军击退了叛军的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: to fight someone and successfully stop their attack on you

sentences.english: Under his leadership, the U.N.'s repute has risen immeasurably.
sentences.chinese: 在他的领导下，联合国的名望得到了极大提升。

detailed_translations.english: reputation

sentences.english: I represent all of the children to guarantee : we 'll study hard to requite you !
sentences.chinese: 我代表所有的孩子们保证：我们会努力学习来报答您！

sentences.english: But if any widow have children or nephews , let them learn first to shew piety at home , and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God .
sentences.chinese: 若寡妇有儿女，或有孙子孙女，便叫他们先在自己家中学着行孝，报答亲恩，因为这在神面前是可悦纳的。

detailed_translations.english: to give or do something in return for something done or given to you

name: requisite
trans: n.必需品/adj.必不可少的，必备的

sentences.english: He lacks the requisite qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他缺少必要的资历。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必备的，必不可少的；需要的
detailed_translations.english: needed for a particular purpose
something that is needed for a particular purpose

sentences.english: The governor does not have the authority to rescind the ruling.
sentences.chinese: 该州长无权撤销这项裁决。

detailed_translations.english: to officially end a law, or change a decision or agreement

sentences.english: He was unemotional, quiet, and reserved.

sentences.chinese: 一个身高六英尺四英寸的壮汉

sentences.chinese: 在旧式学校里，很多学习都是靠死记硬背。

sentences.chinese: 我逐渐掌握了基本的音乐知识。

detailed_translations.english: a rudimentary knowledge or understanding of a subject is very simple and basic

sentences.chinese: 她开始后悔认识了亨利。

sentences.chinese: 他亲昵地拨弄她的头发。

sentences.english: One is to see whether you have any worry triggers and to distract yourself when you begin to ruminate.
sentences.chinese: 首先看看你自己是否有担忧的动机，如果当你自己出现“沉思”时，尽量分散自己的注意力。

sentences.chinese: 有些人陷入事情中时，倾向于反刍基本问题来把事情驱逐出脑海。

sentences.chinese: 原因部分是由于真实事件影响着现实世界中的我们，部分是因为我们倾向反复思考现实世界中行为的影响。

sentences.chinese: 他开玩笑地拨弄她的头发。

sentences.chinese: 我知道我对明天的考试准备不足。

sentences.chinese: 阿格尼丝试图想个办法把保罗从屋子里骗出来。

sentences.english: The village had a certain rustic charm .
sentences.chinese: 这个村庄有一种迷人的田园风情。

someone from the country, especially a farm worker

sentences.english: She moved nearer, her long silk skirt rustling around her.
sentences.chinese: 她走近了，真丝长裙窸窣作响。

sentences.chinese: 他把桌上的报纸翻得沙沙响。

sentences.english: Every single plane had been sabotaged.
sentences.chinese: 每架飞机都遭到了破坏。

sentences.english: I hated the movie’s saccharine ending.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌这部影片煽情的结尾。

sentences.english: Stealing from a place of worship was regarded as sacrilege.

sentences.english: It is no surprise that she could saddle the horses.
sentences.chinese: 她能给马备鞍并没有什么值得惊讶的。

sentences.english: Thee bike's frame, wheels, handlebars and saddle are all made of cardboard in this way, and then fitted together.

sentences.english: International safeguards prevent the increase of nuclear weapons.
sentences.chinese: 国际安全条约防止核武器数量增加。

sentences.english: Not everybody is a sage. Who can be entirely free from error?
sentences.chinese: 人非圣贤，孰能无过?

sentences.english: a spartan existence
sentences.chinese: 清苦的生活

detailed_translations.chinese: 斯巴达的；斯巴达式的；（生活方式）简朴的，清苦的。
detailed_translations.english: spartan conditions or ways of living are simple and without any comfort

sentences.english: a marital spat
sentences.chinese: 夫妻间的口角

detailed_translations.english: a short unimportant quarrel

sentences.english: With the drought and wildfires in Russia and the floods in Pakistan, the world's spate of weird weather is already taking its toll on global food prices.
sentences.chinese: 伴随着俄罗斯发生的大火和干旱以及在巴基斯坦的洪水,世界的一连串的怪异天气已经造成了全球粮食价格的上涨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 洪水；一阵；大雨；突然迸发

sentences.english: the sleek lines of the new Mercedes
sentences.chinese: 这款新梅赛德斯汽车的优美外形

detailed_translations.english: sleek hair or fur is straight, shiny, and healthy-looking
to make hair or fur smooth and shiny by putting water or oil on it

sentences.english: a specious argument
sentences.chinese: 貌似有理的 论据

detailed_translations.chinese: 似是而非的；外表美观的；华而不实的；徒有其表的
detailed_translations.english: seeming to be true or correct, but actually false

sentences.english: He has even cut himself shaving. There is a speck of blood by his ear.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至在刮脸时划伤了自己。他耳边有一点血迹。

detailed_translations.english: A speck is a very small stain, mark, or shape

sentences.english: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

sentences.english: The two articles here represent opposite ends of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 这里的两篇文章代表了两个极端的观点。

sentences.english: the electromagnetic spectrum
sentences.chinese: 电磁（波）谱

detailed_translations.english: a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

sentences.english: ...his father's spendthrift ways.
sentences.chinese: ...他父亲挥霍金钱的作风。

detailed_translations.english: someone who spends money carelessly, even when they do not have a lot of it

sentences.english: Sales slumped by 20% last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年销售额骤减 20%。

sentences.english: The council's land is now worth much less than originally hoped because of a slump in property prices.
sentences.chinese: 由于地产价格的暴跌，委员会的土地目前大不如原来所希望的那么值钱了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下降，衰落；倒下；大幅度下降，暴跌
detailed_translations.english: to fall or lean against something because you are not strong enough to stand
Slump is also a noun

sentences.english: spiny sea urchins
sentences.chinese: 多刺的海胆

sentences.english: spiny bushes
sentences.chinese: 多刺的灌木丛

detailed_translations.english: a spiny animal or plant has lots of stiff sharp points

sentences.english: Obviously you’re annoyed, but that doesn’t give you the right to vent your spleen on me (= get angry with me ) .
sentences.chinese: 很显然你心里不痛快，但你也不该把怒气发泄在我身上呀。

detailed_translations.english: an organ near your stomach that controls the quality of your blood

sentences.english: He taught me to edit and splice film.
sentences.chinese: 他教我剪辑和粘接胶片。

detailed_translations.english: to join the ends of two pieces of rope, film etc so that they form one continuous piece

name: spontaneous
trans: adj. 自发的，不经思索的

sentences.english: The crowd gave a spontaneous cheer.
sentences.chinese: 人群自发地欢呼起来。

sentences.english: My spontaneous reaction was to run away.
sentences.chinese: 我的本能反应就是逃跑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自发的， 无意识的； 自然的， 天真率直的
detailed_translations.english: something that is spontaneous has not been planned or organized, but happens by itself, or because you suddenly feel you want to do it

name: spoof
trans: n. 轻松幽默的模仿，小恶搞

sentences.english: There has been sporadic violence downtown.
sentences.chinese: 市中心时有暴力事件发生。

detailed_translations.english: happening fairly often, but not regularly

name: sprawl
trans: v. 杂乱无序地发展，蔓生，蔓延

sentences.english: He sprawled out on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 他摊开手脚躺在沙发上。

sentences.english: I tripped on a stone and went sprawling on the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 我被一块石头绊了一下，四仰八叉地摔在人行道上。

sentences.english: a blow which sent him sprawling
sentences.chinese: 打得他四脚朝天的一拳

detailed_translations.chinese: 蔓延；伸开手足躺；无计划地扩展
detailed_translations.english: to lie or sit with your arms or legs stretched out in a lazy or careless way

detailed_translations.chinese: 蔓生；伸开手足躺卧姿势

name: sprightly
trans: adj. 活泼的，充满活力的

sentences.english: ...the sprightly 85-year-old president.
sentences.chinese: ...那位精力充沛的85岁总统。

detailed_translations.english: an old person who is sprightly is still active and full of energy – used to show approval

sentences.english: The crowd’s reaction only acted as a spur.
sentences.chinese: 人群的反应不过起了刺激作用。

sentences.english: The band were spurred on by the success of their last two singles.
sentences.chinese: 乐队因最近两张单曲唱片的成功而深受鼓舞。

sentences.english: It was an article in the local newspaper which finally spurred him into action .
sentences.chinese: 是当地报纸上的一篇文章最终促使他行动起来。

detailed_translations.english: a fact or event that makes you try harder to do something
to encourage someone or make them want to do something

sentences.english: spurious sympathy
sentences.chinese: 假同情

detailed_translations.english: insincere

sentences.english: With half a smile, and half a spurn.
sentences.chinese: 半带微笑，半带弃绝。

sentences.english: I spurn your offer.
sentences.chinese: 我拒绝你的提议。

name: sanity
trans: n. 心智健全，神智正常

sentences.english: I began to doubt his sanity.
sentences.chinese: 我开始怀疑他是否神志正常。

sentences.english: She wondered if she was losing her sanity .
sentences.chinese: 她怀疑自己是否精神有问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心智健全，神智正常；判断正确
detailed_translations.english: the condition of being mentally healthy

sentences.english: How can anyone live in such squalid conditions?
sentences.chinese: 一个人怎么能住在这样肮脏的环境中？

sentences.english: a tiny squalid apartment
sentences.chinese: 一套又小又脏的公寓

detailed_translations.english: very dirty and unpleasant because of a lack of care or money

sentences.english: There was an infant squalling in the back of the church.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的后面有个婴儿大声啼哭的声音。

sentences.english: ...squalling guitars.
sentences.chinese: ...刺耳的吉他声。

detailed_translations.english: If a person or animal squalls, they make a loud unpleasant noise like the noise made by a crying baby

detailed_translations.chinese: 暴风；麻烦；高声哭喊；尖叫
detailed_translations.english: a shrill or noisy yell or howl

sentences.english: The home team squandered a number of chances in the first half.
sentences.chinese: 主队在上半场浪费了几次机会。

detailed_translations.english: to carelessly waste money, time, opportunities etc

sentences.english: We squatted beside the pool and watched the diver sink slowly down.
sentences.chinese: 我们蹲在池边，看潜水员慢慢沉下水。

detailed_translations.english: to sit with your knees bent under you and your bottom just off the ground, balancing on your feet
a squatting position
short and thick or low and wide, especially in a way which is not attractive

sentences.english: Her creativity had been squelched.
sentences.chinese: 她的创造力受到了压制。

detailed_translations.chinese: 消除；镇压；压碎；使…咯吱咯吱的响
detailed_translations.english: to stop something from continuing to develop or spread

detailed_translations.chinese: 噪声控制；嘎吱声；压倒对方的反驳；压碎的一堆

name: secede
trans: vi. 脱离，退出（组织，团体，联盟等）

sentences.english: Singapore seceded from the Federation of Malaysia and became an independent sovereign state.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡脱离马来西亚联邦成为一个独立的主权国家。

detailed_translations.english: if a country or state secedes from another country, it officially stops being part of it and becomes independent

sentences.english: The original flick is a stalwart of the genre, and it is the duty of everyone, not just horror fans, to watch it at least once.
sentences.chinese: 原版电影是一种坚定的流派，不仅仅是狂热的影迷，每个人都有义务去看至少一遍。

sentences.english: It described the group's head as a "stalwart of the opposition faction", according to the South China Morning Post, which saw the notice on a website run by Minzu University in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 根据南华早报的消息，通知描述了该组织的领导人是一个“反对派坚定的支持者”，南华早报是在北京民族大学运行的网站上看到这则通知的。

detailed_translations.english: strong in appearance
someone who is very loyal to a particular organization or set of ideas, and works hard for them

sentences.english: You need stamina to be a long-distance runner.
sentences.chinese: 当长跑运动员需要耐力。

sentences.english: Elaine has the stamina and the determination to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 伊莱恩具有成功所需的毅力和决心。

detailed_translations.english: physical or mental strength that lets you continue doing something for a long time without getting tired

sentences.english: Whenever he was angry, he would begin to stammer slightly.
sentences.chinese: 他一生气说话就开始有点结巴。

sentences.english: Jeff spoke with a slight stammer.
sentences.chinese: 杰夫说话有点结巴。

detailed_translations.english: to speak with a lot of pauses and repeated sounds, either because you have a speech problem, or because you are nervous, excited etc
a speech problem which makes someone speak with a lot of pauses and repeated sounds

name: startle
trans: vt. 使吓一跳，使大吃一惊

sentences.english: Sorry, I didn’t mean to startle you.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我不是故意吓你一跳的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked

sentences.english: The number of young people obtaining qualifications has remained static or decreased.
sentences.chinese: 获得各种资格证书的年轻人的数量一直保持不变或者已经减少。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is static does not move or change
noise caused by electricity in the air that blocks or spoils the sound from radio or TV

sentences.english: Bernard was short in stature, with a large head.
sentences.chinese: 伯纳德个子矮，头很大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 身高，身材；（精神、道德等的）高度
detailed_translations.english: someone’s height or size

sentences.english: her father’s steadfast love for her
sentences.chinese: 她父亲对她永不改变的爱

detailed_translations.english: being certain that you are right about something and refusing to change your opinion in any way

sentences.english: Cats rely on stealth to catch their prey.
sentences.chinese: 猫科动物靠偷袭捕捉猎物。

detailed_translations.english: when you do something very quietly, slowly or secretly, so that no one notices you

sentences.english: The road became rocky and steep.
sentences.chinese: 路变得崎岖陡峭起来。

sentences.english: a steep climb to the top
sentences.chinese: 到山顶的一段陡坡

sentences.english: steep cuts in benefits
sentences.chinese: 救济金的大幅度削减

detailed_translations.english: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle

sentences.english: the stench of urine
sentences.chinese: 尿臭味

detailed_translations.english: a very strong bad smell

sentences.english: He bellowed in a stentorian voice.
sentences.chinese: 他用洪亮的声音大吼。

detailed_translations.english: a stentorian voice is very loud and powerful

sentences.english: The classrooms are sterile, with no artwork on the walls.
sentences.chinese: 这些教室毫无生气，墙上一张画都没有。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不育的；无菌的；贫瘠的；不毛的；枯燥乏味的
detailed_translations.english: a person or animal that is sterile cannot produce babies

name: stickler
trans: n. 坚持细节的人，一丝不苟的人

sentences.english: Lucy was a stickler for perfection, and everything had to be exactly right.
sentences.chinese: 露西曾是个追求完美的人，凡事都得完全正确。

detailed_translations.english: If you are a stickler for something, you always demand or require it

name: stiff
trans: adj. 僵硬的，无法弯曲的

sentences.english: I never felt stiff after training until I was in my thirties.
sentences.chinese: 三十岁之前，我训练后从不会感到身体发僵。

detailed_translations.chinese: 呆板的；坚硬的；严厉的；拘谨的
detailed_translations.english: a stiff punishment is great or severe

detailed_translations.chinese: 死尸；令人讨厌者；流通票据；劳动者
detailed_translations.english: the body of a dead person

name: stifle
trans: vt. 抑制（声音、呼吸等）；阻止，扼杀

sentences.english: He was almost stifled by the fumes.
sentences.chinese: 他差点被烟熏得窒息了。

detailed_translations.chinese: （马等的）后膝关节；（马等的）[动] 后膝关节病

sentences.english: There is a social stigma attached to single parenthood.
sentences.chinese: 单身父母在社会上的名声不光彩。

sentences.english: In the US, smoking carries a stigma .
sentences.chinese: 在美国，吸烟是不光彩的。

detailed_translations.chinese: [植] 柱头；耻辱；污名；烙印；特征
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling in society that being in a particular situation or having a particular illness is something to be ashamed of
to provide or use too little of something

sentences.english: She’s too stingy to give money to charity.
sentences.chinese: 她很小气，不愿捐钱行善。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吝啬的，小气的；有刺的；缺乏的
detailed_translations.english: not generous, especially with money

sentences.english: ‘Star Wars’ and its sequels
sentences.chinese: 《星球大战》及其续集

detailed_translations.english: a book, film, play etc that continues the story of an earlier one, usually written or made by the same person

sentences.english: Laws stipulate the maximum interest rate that banks can charge.
sentences.chinese: 法律对银行可以收取的最高利率作了规定。

detailed_translations.english: if an agreement, law, or rule stipulates something, it must be done

sentences.english: He had to have ten stitches in his head.
sentences.chinese: 他头上不得不缝了十针。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of thread that has been sewn into a piece of cloth, or the action of the thread going into and out of the cloth
to sew two pieces of cloth together, or to sew a decoration onto a piece of cloth

sentences.english: We stock a wide range of kitchen equipment.
sentences.chinese: 我们备有各种厨房用品。

detailed_translations.english: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell
something that is available in a shop and does not have to be ordered

detailed_translations.chinese: 原料，库存品；股本，公债；世系，血统；汤汁；家畜，牲畜
detailed_translations.english: a liquid made by boiling meat or bones and vegetables, which is used to make soups or to add  flavour  to other dishes

sentences.english: a sectarian school
sentences.chinese: 教派学校

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗派的；偏狭的；党派心强的
detailed_translations.english: supporting a particular religious group and its beliefs

detailed_translations.chinese: 属于宗派的人；宗派心强的人；宗派主义者

sentences.english: The company hasn't been able to shake off its image as stodgy and old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 该公司一直未能摆脱其古板守旧的形象。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something is stodgy, they are dull, unimaginative, and commonplace

sentences.english: I stoked the furnace for the night.
sentences.chinese: 我给火炉添煤让它烧过夜。

detailed_translations.english: to add more coal or wood to a fire

sentences.english: But, in most instances, people living in poverty respond to these societal ills with stoic resilience as they work to escape the degrading reality of their daily lives.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在大多数情况下，生活贫穷的人们以坚忍的韧性来面对这些社会弊疾，努力逃避他们日常生活中有辱尊严的现实。

sentences.english: People of the Tohoku region are stoic, compassionate, calm and humble.
sentences.chinese: 东北地区的人们坚忍顽强、平静怜悯、谦逊大度。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does not show their emotions and does not complain when bad things happen to them

name: stolid
trans: adj. 无动于衷的，感情麻木的

sentences.english: He conceals his feelings behind a rather stolid manner.
sentences.chinese: 他装作无动于衷的样子以掩盖自己的感情。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is stolid does not react to situations or seem excited by them when most people would react – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: I was so hungry my stomach hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我饿得胃都痛了。

sentences.english: His stomach was full of food.
sentences.chinese: 他的胃里塞满了食物。

detailed_translations.english: the organ inside your body where food begins to be  digested
to be able to accept something, especially something unpleasant

sentences.english: The administration is just stonewalling in an attempt to hide their political embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 政府只是在故意拖延，企图掩盖其政治窘态。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖延议事， 设置障碍
detailed_translations.english: to delay a discussion, decision etc by talking a lot and refusing to answer questions

sentences.english: Armed with a stouthearted spirit, the little boy was able to knock the giant down.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩用刚毅的精神鼓舞自己，然后把巨人打倒了。

sentences.english: Trade discounts may be used as a competitive stratagem to secure customer loyalty.
sentences.chinese: 商业折扣可以用作保持顾客忠诚度的一种竞争策略。

detailed_translations.english: a trick or plan to deceive an enemy or gain an advantage

sentences.english: a sonorous voice
sentences.chinese: 洪亮的嗓音

detailed_translations.chinese: 响亮的；作响的；能发出响亮声音的
detailed_translations.english: having a pleasantly deep loud sound

sentences.english: She tried to blow a grey strand of hair from her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她试图吹开眼前的一缕白发。

sentences.english: The climbers had been stranded by a storm.
sentences.chinese: 这些登山者被暴风雨困住了。

detailed_translations.english: a single thin piece of thread, wire, hair etc
If you are stranded, you are prevented from leaving a place, for example because of bad weather

sentences.english: We currently use a large repository of data from our operational systems to help us stratify, or classify, members.
sentences.chinese: 目前，我们使用我们业务系统的一个大型数据存储库来帮助我们对会员进行分层或分类。

sentences.english: They wanted an instrument that could reasonably stratify adults aged 65 or older into those with a low, moderate, or high risk of developing dementia within six years.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要一项工具，它可以合理地将65岁或以上老年人分成6年内具有低风险、中度风险或高度风险罹患痴呆症的人群。

detailed_translations.english: to form or be formed in layers or strata

sentences.english: This will limit the number of stray dogs in the area.
sentences.chinese: 这将会减少流浪狗在这一区域的数量。

sentences.english: As for her personal safety, she said she isn't overly worried but does think about what a stray lunatic could do.
sentences.chinese: 至于她个人的安全，她说她并没有过度担心，但是她的确在考虑一个流浪疯子可以做些什么。

sentences.english: Then let's say you get into horrible, disastrous debt and have to go begging to the government, like a sad little stray.
sentences.chinese: 另外，比如说，你陷入了讨厌的、损失惨重的债务，而且必须像一个可怜的小流浪儿一样向政府祈求。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that is lost or has no home

sentences.english: a strenuous climb
sentences.chinese: 艰难的攀登

sentences.english: The doctor advised Ken to avoid strenuous exercise.
sentences.chinese: 医生建议肯避免剧烈运动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 紧张的；费力的；奋发的；艰苦的；热烈的
detailed_translations.english: needing a lot of effort or strength
to mark with striae

sentences.english: ...Mencken's strictures on the 1920s, with its self-righteous prohibition on alcohol and unconventional ideas.
sentences.chinese: ...门肯对20世纪20年代自以为是的禁酒令及对非传统思想的禁锢的苛评。

detailed_translations.english: You can use strictures to refer to severe criticism or disapproval of something

sentences.english: the strident calls of seagulls
sentences.chinese: 海鸥尖厉的叫声

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺耳的；尖锐的；吱吱尖叫的；轧轧作响的
detailed_translations.english: a strident sound or voice is loud and unpleasant

sentences.english: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.chinese: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

sentences.english: stringent anti-noise regulations
sentences.chinese: 严格的防噪音条例

detailed_translations.chinese: 严格的；严厉的；紧缩的；短缺的
detailed_translations.english: a stringent law, rule, standard etc is very strict and must be obeyed

sentences.english: Strip the beds and wash the sheets.
sentences.chinese: 把床单撤下来清洗。

sentences.english: a strip of paper
sentences.chinese: 一张纸条

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is covering the surface of something else
a long narrow piece of paper, cloth etc

sentences.english: He struts around town like he owns the place.

sentences.chinese: …带刺的山楂树。
