sentences.english: He had slumped into a state of torpor from which nothing could rouse him.
sentences.chinese: 他陷入了一种麻木状态，什么事都不能唤起他的兴趣。

sentences.english: The sick person gradually falls into a torpor.
sentences.chinese: 这位病人逐渐陷入了萎靡状态中。

detailed_translations.english: Torpor is the state of being completely inactive mentally or physically, for example, because of illness or laziness

sentences.english: The storms and torrential rain caused traffic chaos across the country.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨和倾盆大雨造成了全国的交通混乱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奔流的， 洪流的， 湍急的

name: torrid
trans: adj. 热情的，情感深厚的

sentences.english: a torrid love affair
sentences.chinese: 狂热的风流韵事

detailed_translations.english: involving strong emotions, especially of sexual love

sentences.english: a tortuous path over the mountains to Kandahar
sentences.chinese: 翻山越岭通往坎大哈的一条蜿蜒小径

detailed_translations.english: a tortuous path, stream, road etc has a lot of bends in it and is therefore difficult to travel along

sentences.english: ...slick television ads touting the candidates.
sentences.chinese: …吹嘘那些候选人的华而不实的电视广告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兜售；招徕；刺探赛马情报
detailed_translations.english: to try to persuade people to buy goods or services you are offering

name: toy
trans: vi. 草率或不认真地对待

sentences.english: some toys for the baby
sentences.chinese: 宝宝玩的一些玩具

sentences.english: Annie was playing happily with her toys .
sentences.chinese: 安妮正高兴地玩着玩具。

detailed_translations.chinese: 玩具；小装饰品；不值钱的东西
detailed_translations.english: an object for children to play with

detailed_translations.chinese: 玩弄；调情；随随便便地对待

sentences.english: The issues have proved to be less tractable than expected.
sentences.chinese: 结果这些问题比预想的要难以处理。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易于管教的；易驾驭的；易处理的；驯良的
detailed_translations.english: easy to control or deal with

sentences.english: We all like the tranquility of the country life.
sentences.chinese: 我们都喜欢乡村生活的宁静。

sentences.english: For this brings not only the tranquility which comes from doing well, but also that which comes from doing few things.
sentences.chinese: 因为这不仅带来由于做事适当而产生的宁静，而且带来由于做很少的事而产生的宁静。

sentences.english: And while I love my family to death, this time of tranquility is one of absolute bliss for me.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我对我的家庭爱得要死，但这片刻的宁静绝对是我的幸福之一。

sentences.english: The desire for peace transcended political differences.
sentences.chinese: 对和平的渴望超越了政治分歧。

detailed_translations.english: to go beyond the usual limits of something

sentences.english: Her face was transfigured with joy.
sentences.chinese: 她高兴得容光焕发。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使变形；使改观；美化；理想化
detailed_translations.english: to change the way someone or something looks, especially so that they become more beautiful

sentences.english: Orton’s plays transgress accepted social norms.
sentences.chinese: 奥顿的戏剧违背了公认的社会准则。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that is against the rules of social behaviour or against a moral principle

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

sentences.english: Most teenage romances are transitory.
sentences.chinese: 大多数少年时代的罗曼史都转瞬即逝。

detailed_translations.english: continuing or existing for only a short time

sentences.english: Blue veins showed through her translucent skin.
sentences.chinese: 她半透明的皮肤下青筋显现。

detailed_translations.english: not trans-parent, but clear enough to allow light to pass through

name: transparent
trans: adj. 没有歧义的，清晰易懂的

sentences.english: a transparent plastic container
sentences.chinese: 透明的塑料容器

sentences.english: Am I that transparent (= are my intentions that obvious) ?
sentences.chinese: 我就那么没有城府？

detailed_translations.english: allowing you to see through it
a difficult or unpleasant situation, or very tiring work

detailed_translations.chinese: 辛勤努力；经受分娩的阵痛

sentences.english: two minutes to traverse the park
sentences.chinese: 两分钟横穿公园

detailed_translations.english: a sideways movement across a very steep slope in mountain-climbing

detailed_translations.chinese: 穿过；反对；详细研究；在…来回移动
detailed_translations.english: to move across, over, or through something, especially an area of land or water

name: travesty
trans: n./v. 拙劣的、嘲弄性模仿

sentences.english: Their marriage was a complete travesty.
sentences.chinese: 他们的婚姻十分荒唐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 歪曲；滑稽作品；拙劣的模仿作品
detailed_translations.english: used in order to say that something is extremely bad and is not what it is claimed to be

sentences.english: a sly and treacherous woman
sentences.chinese: 一个阴险狡诈的女人

sentences.english: a treacherous plot to overthrow the leader
sentences.chinese: 一个推翻领导人的阴谋

detailed_translations.chinese: 奸诈的，叛逆的，背叛的；危险的；不牢靠的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is treacherous cannot be trusted because they are not loyal and secretly intend to harm you

sentences.english: Stockman became one of the President’s most trenchant critics.
sentences.chinese: 斯托克曼成了总统最尖锐的批评者之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖刻的；锐利的；苛刻的；锋利的（名词trenchancy，副词trenchantly）
detailed_translations.english: expressed very strongly, effectively, and directly without worrying about offending people

sentences.english: With some trepidation, I opened the door.
sentences.chinese: 我有些惴惴不安地打开了门。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of anxiety or fear about something that is going to happen

name: trespass
trans: vi. 非法侵入；违反，冒犯

sentences.english: He will be prosecuted for trespass.
sentences.chinese: 他将因擅闯私地而被起诉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罪过；非法侵入；过失；擅自进入
detailed_translations.english: the offence of going onto someone’s land without their permission

sentences.english: The players wore black armbands as a tribute to their late teammate.
sentences.chinese: 球员们戴着黑纱悼念已故的队友。

sentences.english: I’d like to pay tribute to (= praise and admire publicly ) the party workers for all their hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我谨向党内工作人员致敬，感谢他们的辛苦努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼物；[税收] 贡物；颂词；（尤指对死者的）致敬，悼念，吊唁礼物
detailed_translations.english: something that you say, do, or give in order to express your respect or admiration for someone

name: trickle
trans: vi. 一滴一滴地流，缓慢地流

sentences.english: A tear trickled down the old man's cheek.
sentences.chinese: 一滴泪水顺着老人的面颊流了下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滴；细细地流；慢慢地移动
detailed_translations.english: if liquid trickles somewhere, it flows slowly in drops or in a thin stream
a thin slow flow of liquid

name: trite
trans: adj. 陈腐的，陈词滥调的

sentences.english: Her remarks sounded trite and ill-informed.
sentences.chinese: 她的话听起来没有新意，信息匮乏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈腐的；平庸的；老一套的
detailed_translations.english: a trite remark, idea etc is boring, not new, and insincere

name: trivial
trans: adj. 无足轻重的，不重要的

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

name: truant
trans: adj./n./vi. 逃避责任（的）；逃避责任者

sentences.english: persistent truants
sentences.chinese: 老是逃学的学生

detailed_translations.english: a student who stays away from school without permission

sentences.english: They agreed to call a truce .
sentences.chinese: 他们同意宣布休战。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between enemies to stop fighting or arguing for a short time, or the period for which this is arranged

sentences.english: a truculent attitude
sentences.chinese: 凶狠的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 好斗的；野蛮的；言词刻毒的
detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is truculent, you mean that they are bad-tempered and aggressive

sentences.english: We trudged home through the snow.
sentences.chinese: 我们艰难地穿过雪地走回了家。

sentences.english: We were reluctant to start the long trudge home.
sentences.chinese: 我们不情愿的开始长途跋涉回家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跋涉；步履艰难地走，费力地走
detailed_translations.english: to walk with slow heavy steps, especially because you are tired or it is difficult to walk
Trudge is also a noun

sentences.english: They are proudly trumpeting the fact that they are creating more jobs.
sentences.chinese: 他们得意地宣扬他们是在创造更多的工作岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to tell everyone about something that you are proud of, especially in an annoying way

name: truncate
trans: vt. 截短；缩短（时间、篇幅等）

sentences.english: If the list is too long, it will be truncated by the computer.
sentences.chinese: 如果列表太长，电脑会将其截短。

sentences.english: The report is also available in a truncated version.
sentences.chinese: 该报告还有简缩版。

detailed_translations.english: to make something shorter

sentences.english: Suddenly, there was a tremendous bang, and the whole station shook.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.english: She was making a tremendous effort to appear calm.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。

sentences.english: She praised her husband for the tremendous support he had given her.
sentences.chinese: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。

sentences.english: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年到目前为止，销售额十分惊人。

sentences.english: This plan could save us a tremendous amount of money.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划能给我们节省一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: very big, fast, powerful etc

sentences.english: I could simply not be heard in the tumult.
sentences.chinese: 一片嘈杂声中别人根本听不到我说话。

detailed_translations.english: a confused, noisy, and excited situation, often caused by a large crowd

sentences.english: A fisherman drags nets of oysters from the turbid river water on a breathless summer day.
sentences.chinese: 一个渔民在喘不过气来的夏天从浑浊的河水里拖上了几网牡蛎。

sentences.english: Life is the clear and transparent white spirits, which seems pure at the first glance, but actually is turbid.
sentences.chinese: 生命是明确的和透明的白酒，这似乎纯在乍看之下，但实际上是浑浊。

detailed_translations.english: turbid water or liquid is dirty and muddy

sentences.english: the turbulent times of the French Revolution
sentences.chinese: 法国大革命的动荡时期

sentences.english: He has had a turbulent political career.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治生涯动荡不定。

detailed_translations.english: a turbulent situation or period of time is one in which there are a lot of sudden changes

name: turgid
trans: adj. 浮夸的，过分装饰的

sentences.english: a turgid Social Science textbook
sentences.chinese: 一本枯燥乏味的社会科学教科书

detailed_translations.english: full and swollen with liquid or air

sentences.english: She lived through the turmoil of the French Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 她经历过法国大革命的混乱之后仍旧活着。

detailed_translations.english: a state of confusion, excitement, or anxiety

sentences.english: Casson was publicly criticized as a turncoat and a traitor.
sentences.chinese: 卡森被公开指责为叛党分子和叛徒。

detailed_translations.english: someone who stops supporting a political party or group and joins the opposing side

sentences.english: Let every declamation turn upon the beauty of liberty and virtue, and the deformity, turpitude, and malignity of slavery and vice.
sentences.chinese: 让每一篇演讲都来谈自由和道德之美，都来谈奴役和邪恶之丑陋、卑鄙和恶毒。

sentences.english: The scrutiny of investors, directors, regulators and media, may find out these tyro corporate leaders before they can do much damage.
sentences.chinese: 股东、董事、监管机构和媒体的仔细审视，或许会在这些新手企业领袖造成重大损害前发现问题。

sentences.english: Only the ineducable tyro can fail to sense the presence or absence of wolves, or the fact that mountains have a secret opinion about them.
sentences.chinese: 只有最不堪造就的新手，才感觉不到狼的存在与否，才不晓得大山对狼有着隐秘的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a novice or beginner

name: ubiquitous
trans: adj. 无所不在的，普通的

sentences.english: Coffee shops are ubiquitous these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今好像到处都是咖啡馆。

sentences.english: a French film, starring the ubiquitous Gérard Depardieu
sentences.chinese: 一部法国电影，由家喻户晓的热拉尔·德帕迪约主演

detailed_translations.chinese: 普遍存在的；无所不在的
detailed_translations.english: seeming to be everywhere – sometimes used humorously

name: unassailable
trans: adj. 无可争辩的，无法否认的，不可亵渎的

sentences.english: an uncanny coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不可思议的巧合

detailed_translations.english: very strange and difficult to explain

name: uncouth
trans: adj. 粗俗的，没有品味的

sentences.english: His nephew is an uncouth young man.
sentences.chinese: 他的侄子是一个粗野的年轻人。

sentences.english: He made the most uncouth and clumsy gestures of delight.
sentences.chinese: 他做出的表示快乐的动作也是极笨拙、极难看的。

sentences.english: We do have the odd barbarian as below who need to release his uncouth behavior as a result of acute servility .
sentences.chinese: 我们确实有象楼下那样的异类野蛮人， 他们要发泄因极度奴性引起的粗野行为。

detailed_translations.english: behaving and speaking in a way that is rude or socially unacceptable

name: unctuous
trans: adj. 油嘴滑舌的，谄媚的

sentences.english: ...the kind of unctuous tone that I've heard often at diplomatic parties.
sentences.chinese: ...我在外交聚会上经常听到的那种虚情假意的腔调。

detailed_translations.chinese: 油质的；虚情假意的；油腔滑调的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as unctuous, you are critical of them because they seem to be full of praise, kindness, or interest, but are obviously insincere

name: upbeat
trans: adj. 给人希望的，象征好运的

sentences.english: an upbeat message
sentences.chinese: 乐观的信息

detailed_translations.english: positive and making you feel that good things will happen

detailed_translations.chinese: 从底层支持， 加固…的底部
detailed_translations.english: to strengthen or reinforce by passing a rope, cable, or chain around the underside of (an object, load, etc)

sentences.english: He did part-time work as an usher in a theatre.
sentences.chinese: 他曾在一家剧院做兼职引座员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引座员，带位员；接待员；门房
detailed_translations.english: someone who shows people to their seats at a theatre, cinema, wedding etc
to help someone to get from one place to another, especially by showing them the way

sentences.english: The Labour Department figures underscore the shaky state of the economic recovery.
sentences.chinese: 劳工部的数字突出显示了经济复苏的不稳定。

detailed_translations.english: to emphasize the fact that something is important or true

sentences.english: The press have tended to understate the extent of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 媒体想淡化问题的严重程度。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少说，少报；保守地说；有意轻描淡写
detailed_translations.english: to describe something in a way that makes it seem less important or serious than it really is

sentences.english: De Gaulle felt that America had undue influence in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 戴高乐感到美国在欧洲影响力过大。

sentences.english: The kick should be taken without undue delay.
sentences.chinese: 应立即开球，不得无故拖延。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过度的，过分的；不适当的；未到期的
detailed_translations.english: more than is reasonable, suitable, or necessary

sentences.english: The candidate was quite unexceptionable, a well-known travel writer and TV personality.
sentences.chinese: 这个候选人无懈可击—著名的旅行作家和电视名人。

sentences.english: The school's unexceptionable purpose is to involve parents more closely in the education of their children.
sentences.chinese: 学校无可指摘的目的是让家长更多的参与到孩子的教育中来。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone or something as unexceptionable, you mean that they are unlikely to be criticized or objected to, but are not new or exciting, and may have some hidden bad qualities

name: unflappable
trans: adj. 镇定的，从容不迫的

sentences.english: Only his physical gifts and unflappable determination could nullify the Magic's season sweep.
sentences.chinese: 只有他那非凡的身体天赋和镇定的夺冠决心可以让魔术队本赛季对湖人的横扫失去意义。

detailed_translations.english: having the ability to stay calm and not become upset, even in difficult situations

sentences.english: a tall ungainly teenager
sentences.chinese: 一个动作笨拙的高个子少年

detailed_translations.english: moving in a way that does not look graceful

sentences.english: unimpeachable morals
sentences.chinese: 无可指摘的品行

detailed_translations.chinese: 无可指责的， 无可怀疑的
detailed_translations.english: so good or definite that criticism or doubt is impossible

sentences.english: His hair was unkempt and filthy.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发没梳洗，十分脏腻。

detailed_translations.chinese: 蓬乱的，不整洁的；（言语等）粗野的
detailed_translations.english: unkempt hair or plants have not been cut and kept neat

name: unlettered
trans: adj. 未受教育的，文盲的

sentences.english: an unpretentious hotel
sentences.chinese: 简朴的酒店

sentences.english: an unpretentious woman
sentences.chinese: 行事低调的女子

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；含蓄的；不炫耀的；不铺张的
detailed_translations.english: not trying to seem better, more important etc than you really are – use this to show approval

name: unflagging
trans: adj. 不懈的，不知疲倦的

name: unsung
trans: adj. 被埋没的，不知名的

sentences.english: one of the unsung heroes of French politics
sentences.chinese: 法国政坛的一位无名英雄

detailed_translations.english: not praised or famous for something you have done, although you deserve to be

name: unruly
trans: adj. 难驾驭的，不守规矩的

sentences.english: unruly children
sentences.chinese: 难管教的孩子

sentences.english: unruly behaviour
sentences.chinese: 粗暴的行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 不守规矩的；任性的；难驾驭的
detailed_translations.english: violent or difficult to control

name: untenable
trans: adj. 防守不住的，站不住脚的

sentences.english: The scandal put the President in an untenable position.
sentences.chinese: 这桩丑闻使总统处境艰难。

detailed_translations.chinese: （论据等）站不住脚的；不能维持的；不能租赁的；难以防守的
detailed_translations.english: an untenable situation has become so difficult that it is impossible to continue

sentences.english: The rumours will do untold damage to his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这些谣言会给他的名声造成无法估计的损害。

name: untoward
trans: adj. 难以驯服的，难以驾驭的

sentences.english: Monitor child's therapeutic and untoward response to medications; monitor the action and side effects of administered medications.
sentences.chinese: 监视患儿对药物的治疗反应和不利反应，观察药物的作用及副作用。

sentences.english: Any untoward medicaloccurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject administered apharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have a causalrelationship with this treatment.
sentences.chinese: 在用药病人或临床研究对象中发生的任何不幸医疗事件，他不一定要与治疗有因果关系。

name: unwitting
trans: adj. 不知道的，未觉察的

sentences.english: We were unwitting collaborators in his plan.
sentences.chinese: 我们无意中成为他的计划的协作者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不知情的；不知不觉的，无意的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their actions as unwitting, you mean that the person does something or is involved in something without realizing it

detailed_translations.chinese: 使精神错乱；使丧失智能（unwit的ing形式）

name: unwonted
trans: adj. 不习惯的，不寻常的

sentences.english: unwonted freedom
sentences.chinese: 难得的自由

detailed_translations.chinese: 不寻常的， 不习惯的
detailed_translations.english: unusual and not what you expect to happen

sentences.english: His mother summoned him, upbraided him, wept and prayed.
sentences.chinese: 他母亲把他叫来，责骂了他。然后母亲哭着做了祷告。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone angrily that they have done something wrong

sentences.english: We have a duty to uphold the law.
sentences.chinese: 维护法律是我们的责任。

detailed_translations.english: to defend or support a law, system, or principle so that it continues to exist

name: urbane
trans: adj. 彬彬有礼的，文雅的

sentences.english: Neil was urbane, witty, direct, and honest.
sentences.chinese: 尼尔文雅机智，坦率诚实。

sentences.chinese: 他在听课时作了大量笔记。

name: voluptuous
trans: adj. 奢侈逸乐的，沉溺酒色的

name: voracious
trans: adj. 有很大含量的，贪吃的
adj. 贪婪的，如饥似渴的

sentences.english: Pigs are voracious feeders.
sentences.chinese: 猪的食量很大。

sentences.english: Kids can have voracious appetites.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子有时胃口很大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 贪婪的；贪吃的；狼吞虎咽的
detailed_translations.english: eating or wanting large quantities of food

sentences.english: The organismic, "what you can do for your country" implies that government is the master or the deity, the citizen, the servant or the votary.
sentences.chinese: 而后半句" 你能为你的国家做些什么"则意味着政府是主人，或者是神祗，公民只是仆人或者信徒。

detailed_translations.english: someone who regularly practises a particular religion
ardently devoted to the services or worship of God, a deity, or a saint

sentences.english: I can vouch for his honesty.
sentences.chinese: 我可以为他的诚实做担保。

sentences.english: Can you present any references who might vouch for your character?
sentences.chinese: 你能提供一些可以为你的人格作担保的证明人吗？

sentences.english: vulgar behaviour

detailed_translations.english: remarks, jokes etc that are vulgar deal with sex in a very rude and offensive way

name: vulnerable
trans: adj. 易受攻击的，脆弱的

sentences.chinese: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。

sentences.english: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的, 易受影响的

sentences.english: ‘You naughty girl!’ Mom said, wagging her finger at me.
sentences.chinese: “你这个调皮的丫头！”妈妈对我摇了摇手指说道。

detailed_translations.english: if a dog wags its tail, or if its tail wags, the dog moves its tail many times from one side to the other
someone who says or does something clever and amusing

sentences.english: She gave a wan smile.
sentences.chinese: 她无力地笑了一下。

detailed_translations.english: looking pale, weak, or tired

sentences.english: My enthusiasm for the project was waning.
sentences.chinese: 我对这个项目的热情逐渐减退了。

sentences.english: The group’s influence had begun to wane by this time.
sentences.chinese: 此时，这个团体的影响力已经开始减弱。

sentences.english: The door must be warped. It won’t close properly.
sentences.chinese: 这门肯定是变形了，关不严。

if something warps, or if heat or cold warps it, it becomes bent or twisted, and loses its original shape

sentences.english: Therefore, it is important to note that individual situations may warrant including additional characters in the list of special characters.
sentences.chinese: 因此，要注意可能保证把额外字符包括到特殊字符列表中的个别情况，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: Learning incessantly is the surest way to keep pace with the times in the information age and an infallible warrant of success in times of uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: 持续的学习是在资讯时代中跟时代并驾齐驱的最稳当的方法，也是在变动的世代中成功的可靠保证。

sentences.english: At Dean Miller's suggestion, I have allowed her to give the current student organizers the opportunity to propose a program for next semester that might warrant continuation of this event on campus.
sentences.chinese: 根据米勒学监的建议，我允许她给学生机会，让他们给下学期的活动提出一个方案，保证这个活动得以在校园内继续开展。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that something is true

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当理由；许可证，委任状
detailed_translations.english: a legal document that is signed by a judge, allowing the police to take a particular action

name: wary
trans: adj. 小心的，机警的，谨慎的

sentences.english: Keep a wary eye on the weather before you set sail.
sentences.chinese: 出航前要密切注意天气。

sentences.english: She had a wary expression on her face.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上带着小心谨慎的表情。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is wary is careful because they think something might be dangerous or harmful

name: wastrel
trans: n. 肆意挥霍的人，败家子

sentences.english: The government of luxembourg however has recently grown fed up with wastrel youths applying for unemployment benefits while still living with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 然而在卢森堡，政府对那些与父母同住又来领救济金无所事事的年轻人越来越忍无可忍。

sentences.english: The election of Mary Robinson in 1990 was a watershed in Irish politics.
sentences.chinese: 1990年玛丽·鲁滨逊的当选是爱尔兰政治的分水岭。

detailed_translations.english: an event or time when important changes happen in history or in your life

sentences.english: wax crayons
sentences.chinese: 蜡笔

to rub a layer of wax into a floor, surface etc to protect it or make it shine

sentences.english: "They know the routes . . . of the trappers; where to waylay them" (Washington Irving).
sentences.chinese: “他们知道捕猎手走的路线；知道在哪里伏击他们” （华盛顿·欧文）。

sentences.english: There is a welter of information on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 关于这个问题有一大堆乱七八糟的信息。

detailed_translations.english: a large and confusing amount or number of something

sentences.english: Cross decided to beg and wheedle a bit.
sentences.chinese: 克罗斯决定小小地乞求和哄骗一下。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do or give you something, for example by saying nice things to them that you do not mean – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: Companions, the creator seeketh, and such as know how to whet their sickles.
sentences.chinese: 开创者找寻的是伙伴，是那些懂得如何磨快镰刀的人。

sentences.english: If the ox falls , whet your knife.
sentences.chinese: 牛一倒，快磨刀；人遭难，众人踩。

detailed_translations.english: to make the edge of a blade sharp

sentences.english: He has a wonderful whimsical sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 他怪异的幽默感令人惊叹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的；异想天开的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: unusual or strange and often amusing

sentences.english: good wholesome fun
sentences.chinese: 健康有益的娱乐

detailed_translations.chinese: 健全的；有益健康的；合乎卫生的；审慎的
detailed_translations.english: likely to make you healthy

sentences.chinese: 《糖果屋》中那个恶毒的继母

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is morally wrong

sentences.english: Who smile and frown, wince and hiss.
sentences.chinese: 他们微笑和皱眉，畏缩与嘶嘘。

sentences.english: We all wince at the thought of how Xerox utterly failed to innovate on PARC's inventions, allowing Apple and Microsoft to run away with most of them.
sentences.chinese: 我们都退避在想到施乐如何完全的失败再帕洛阿尔托研究中心的发明，允许苹果和微软从他们这儿逃走。

sentences.english: And for the leaders in Bejing to shrink and wince and draw back in the presence of these individuals and their ideas sends a clear message.
sentences.chinese: 北京的领导人对他们的催促显的畏畏缩缩，并不让这些人抛头露面，政府的以对理念给外界发出了一个清晰的信号。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly feel very uncomfortable or embarrassed because of something that happens, something you remember etc

sentences.english: It’s too windy for a picnic.
sentences.chinese: 风太大，不适合野餐。

sentences.english: a cold, windy day

sentences.english: a windy hillside
sentences.chinese: 当风的山坡

sentences.chinese: 迷人的微笑

sentences.english: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.

that is to say; namely (used to introduce statements, as in legal documents)

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

sentences.chinese: 伊莎贝尔房间里的花朵已经枯萎了。

sentences.chinese: 我扣着钱，直到他们完工。

sentences.english: Ian was accused of withholding vital information from the police.
sentences.chinese: 伊恩被控向警方隐瞒重要信息。

sentences.chinese: 即使在凋零的花园中散步，也得学著承认她还是一座花园，你也许一次有一次的失去了朵朵鲜花，但你并没有失去整个花园！

sentences.chinese: 他显得非常淡定，完全没有俗世的忧虑。

sentences.chinese: 他彩票中奖得来的200万英镑意外之财

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you get unexpectedly

sentences.english: Don't wrangle with others over trifles.
sentences.chinese: 别为一些琐事与别人争吵。

sentences.chinese: 在政治谈判中，他“拥有”医疗：美国政府系统突然出现的每个缺点，都将是他的错误——每次约定的推迟、保险的争论、行动的修补。

sentences.chinese: “那事和你想的一样糟吗？”特拉维斯苦笑着问道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 歪斜的，扭歪的；歪曲的；用反语表达幽默的；揶揄的

trans: n. 仇视（或畏惧）外国人（或外国事物）者

detailed_translations.english: a person who hates or fears foreigners or strangers

sentences.english: the yoke of tradition
sentences.chinese: 传统的枷锁

sentences.chinese: …他对教学的热衷。

detailed_translations.english: eagerness to do something, especially to achieve a particular religious or political aim

sentences.chinese: 宗教狂热分子

detailed_translations.english: someone who has extremely strong beliefs, especially religious or political beliefs, and is too eager to make other people share them

sentences.english: Obama will be the zenith of black America for as long as he lives.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马毕其一生都将成为美国黑人运动成就的顶点。

detailed_translations.english: the most successful point in the development of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴致很高的， 热望的

sentences.chinese: 那辆车追上来与杰克并行时，他一下子就认出了驾车的人。

sentences.english: His work was acclaimed by art critics.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品得到艺术评论家的推崇。

sentences.english: Angela Bassett has won critical acclaim for her excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 安杰拉·巴西特因她出色的表演而赢得了评论界的赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something publicly
Acclaim is public praise for someone or something

trans: n.（政策或思想等的）信奉者，支持者

sentences.english: The punishments accorded with the current code of discipline.
sentences.chinese: 处罚与现行的纪律规则一致。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two people, ideas, or statements agree with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 使符合；使一致；调节；授予，赠与，给予

sentences.english: She tried to accustom herself to the tight bandages.
sentences.chinese: 她尝试着使自己习惯那些紧绷的绷带。

sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

sentences.chinese: 我们活在一个贪婪的社会里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 渴望得到的， 贪婪的
detailed_translations.english: wanting to have and keep a lot of possessions

sentences.chinese: 系主任裁决教师间的纠纷。

detailed_translations.english: to officially decide who is right in a disagreement and decide what should be done

sentences.english: his courage in the face of adversity
sentences.chinese: 他面对逆境的勇气

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you have a lot of problems that seem to be caused by bad luck

sentences.english: Calling everyone ‘darling’ is just an affectation.
sentences.chinese: 逢人就叫“亲爱的”很做作。

detailed_translations.english: a way of behaving, speaking etc that is not sincere or natural

sentences.chinese: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

sentences.english: Both sides affirmed their commitment to the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均申明答应停火。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that something is true

sentences.english: Will discuss concepts such as phoneme, morpheme , affix, rules and constraints.
sentences.chinese: 将被提及的概念包括音位、 语素、 词缀、 规则和限制。

sentences.english: After surveying all the structures with "de", we hold that there are three different "de" in modern Chinese, they are auxiliary verb, auxiliary word and affix.
sentences.chinese: 最后，综观现代汉语中与“得”有关的各种结构，本文认为现代汉语中有助动词、助词、词缀三个不同性质的轻声“得”。

detailed_translations.chinese: 黏上， 贴上； 添上
detailed_translations.english: to fasten or stick something to something else
a group of letters added to the beginning or end of a word to change its meaning or use, such as ‘un-’, ‘mis-’, ‘-ness’, or ‘-ly’

sentences.chinese: 老年的各种痛苦

detailed_translations.chinese: 折磨， 痛苦； 痛苦的原因； 灾害
detailed_translations.english: something that causes pain or suffering, especially a medical condition

sentences.english: Vince watched, his mouth agape in horror.
sentences.chinese: 文斯注视着，吓得张大了嘴。

sentences.english: If for some reason you don't have or cannot adopt these values, then you should not worry about agility.
sentences.chinese: 如果因为某些原因您没有或者不能采用这些价值，那么您就不需要为敏捷而操心了。

sentences.chinese: 那男孩敏捷地走上楼来。

sentences.english: As a mother, I agonize over what my children will inherit.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个母亲，我对我的孩子们将要继承的东西感到极度痛苦。

sentences.english: We spent a most agreeable couple of hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常愉快地度过了几个小时。

sentences.english: My parents are quite agreeable to my studying abroad.
sentences.chinese: 我父母很同意我去国外留学。

detailed_translations.english: pleasant

sentences.english: The latest tax proposals will alienate many voters.
sentences.chinese: 最新的纳税提案将失去远许多选民的支持。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that makes someone unfriendly or unwilling to support you

sentences.english: Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc.
sentences.chinese: 黄铜是铜和锌的合金。

detailed_translations.english: to mix one metal with another
a metal that consists of two or more metals mixed together

sentences.english: As a group, they are ambivalent about whether the quality of online content would suffer if companies could not charge for it—34% think so while 30% do not; and the remaining 36% have no firm opinion.
sentences.chinese: 对于如果网站对内容不收费这些内容的质量是否会变差的调查有矛盾：34%的人认为会变差，同时30%的认为不会，而36%的人没有固定的意见。

sentences.english: Looking back on it, I can see how the statement looked ambivalent and a touch arrogant, but it was an honest expression of how I felt, as I began the first campaign since 1982 that I could have lost.
sentences.chinese: 现在回头想想，我能够看出，在这个声明中，我所流露出的矛盾心理和些许的傲慢，但它确实是我内心感受的真实表达，因为这是自1982年以来，我第一次开始进行可能会失利的竞选活动。

detailed_translations.english: not sure whether you want or like something or not

name: anachronism
trans: n.不合时代的人或事物；过时现象
n.时代错误，年代误植（指所叙人、事与时代不符的错误）

sentences.english: The monarchy is something of an anachronism these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今君主制是一种过时的体制。

detailed_translations.chinese: 时代错误；不合潮流的人或物
detailed_translations.english: someone or something that seems to belong to the past, not the present

sentences.english: Marine construction technology like this is very complex, somewhat analogous to trying to build a bridge under water.
sentences.chinese: 像这样的海洋建筑技术非常复杂，有些类似于尝试在水下建筑一座桥。

detailed_translations.english: similar to another situation or thing so that a comparison can be made

sentences.english: Any annex is the integral part of this contract.
sentences.chinese: 本合同一切附件均为本合同的有效组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: to take control of a country or area next to your own, especially by using force

sentences.english: an annotated edition of ‘Othello’
sentences.chinese: 《奥赛罗》的注释本

detailed_translations.english: to add short notes to a book or piece of writing to explain parts of it

sentences.english: The economic troubles antedate the current administration.
sentences.chinese: 这些经济问题早在现任政府就职之前就已出现。

detailed_translations.english: to come from an earlier time in history than something else

sentences.english: ...the voting public's antipathy toward the president.
sentences.chinese: …投票民众对总统的憎恶。

sentences.english: Do notlet animals graze until you are notified that forage in your area is safe.
sentences.chinese: 得到你所在区域的饲料安全的通知前，不要让动物吃青草。

detailed_translations.english: to warn of or indicate (an event, result, etc) in advance

sentences.chinese: 冰川谷

sentences.chinese: 吉利斯先生通常不是那种会积怨的人。

sentences.chinese: 塔夫脱抱怨法律如此有利于罪犯，使得审判看来像是一场运气的游戏。

诘问；激烈质问；以麻梳梳理

sentences.chinese: …军事组织内的传统等级制度。

sentences.chinese: 他拄着T形拐杖一瘸一拐地走入屋内。

sentences.chinese: ...她整天做着单调乏味的工作但收入颇丰的律师丈夫。

sentences.chinese: 在6月的大选中，莫里斯轻松击败了在任的汤姆·史密斯。

sentences.chinese: 特殊许可证今后不得向任何人再行发放。

sentences.chinese: 说我酒后驾车，这真是太荒唐了。

sentences.chinese: 如此大幅度的增长

sentences.chinese: 她目光狠毒，嘴唇紧闭。

sentences.chinese: 她的乳房长了个恶性肿瘤。

sentences.chinese: 这架直升飞机向上冲去，另一架飞机也以相同的移动方向冲了上去。

sentences.chinese: 总统试图操控该活动，使其远离自身。

sentences.english: marginal notes

detailed_translations.english: not part of a main or important group or situation

sentences.english: She sat quietly, meditating on the day’s events.
sentences.chinese: 她静静地坐着，思考着这一天发生的事。

sentences.chinese: 我每天晚上尽量默想半小时。

sentences.english: ...low-paid menial jobs, such as cleaning and domestic work.
sentences.chinese: …工钱少又卑微的工作，诸如打扫清洁或做家务。

detailed_translations.english: Menial work is very boring, and the people who do it have a low status and are usually badly paid

detailed_translations.chinese: 仆人；住家佣工；下贱的人

sentences.chinese: 普鲁斯特的作品反映了其所在的社会和文化背景。

sentences.english: She never felt happy in a student milieu.
sentences.chinese: 在学生中间她从不觉得快乐。

sentences.english: I think we should clear up this misapprehension.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们应该消除这一误会。

detailed_translations.english: a mistaken belief or a wrong understanding of something

sentences.chinese: 英国的国家元首是君主立宪的国王或女王。

detailed_translations.english: a king or queen

sentences.chinese: 该公司垄断了软饮料市场。

sentences.english: He monopolized the conversation all evening.
sentences.chinese: 整个晚上都是他一个人在说话。

sentences.english: Entering the realm of Nirvana is only possible for those who have become pure.
sentences.chinese: 心无杂念，方可入涅。

detailed_translations.english: the final state of complete knowledge and understanding that is the aim of believers in Buddhism

sentences.chinese: 他也许被他对快乐青年时代的环境的怀念影响了。

sentences.english: He achieved notoriety as chief counsel to President Nixon in the Watergate break-in.
sentences.chinese: 在水门事件中，他作为尼克松总统的首席辩护律师被搞得声名狼藉。

sentences.english: The cream contains vitamin A to nourish the skin.
sentences.chinese: 这种护肤霜含有滋养肌肤的维生素A。

sentences.english: a well nourished baby
sentences.chinese: 营养良好的婴儿

sentences.english: The computer course is ideal for novices.
sentences.chinese: 这门计算机课程非常适合初学者。

sentences.chinese: 不建议自行车新手走这条小路。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has no experience in a skill, subject, or activity

name: nullification
trans: n.（尤指法律条文等正式的）废除，废弃

sentences.english: The cold had numbed her fingers.
sentences.chinese: 她的手指冻僵了。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone unable to feel pain or feel things they are touching
a part of your body that is numb is unable to feel anything, for example because you are very cold

name: observant
trans: adj.严格遵守（规章、制度或原则）的

sentences.english: a quiet and observant person
sentences.chinese: 一个寡言而机敏的人

sentences.english: Supervisors are trained to be observant.
sentences.chinese: 主管被训练得敏锐机警。

sentences.english: the writer’s observant eye for detail
sentences.chinese: 这位作家善于捕捉细节的敏锐目光

detailed_translations.chinese: 善于观察的；机警的；严格遵守的
detailed_translations.english: good or quick at noticing things

sentences.english: obsolete weapons
sentences.chinese: 已被淘汰的武器

sentences.english: computer hardware that quickly became obsolete
sentences.chinese: 很快就变得过时的电脑硬件

sentences.english: Will computers render (= make ) books obsolete?
sentences.chinese: 计算机会把书籍淘汰掉吗？

detailed_translations.english: no longer useful, because something newer and better has been invented

sentences.english: the onset of winter
sentences.chinese: 冬天的来临

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始，着手；发作；攻击，进攻
detailed_translations.english: the beginning of something, especially something bad

sentences.english: He was beginning to wonder if he would survive the ordeal.
sentences.chinese: 他开始怀疑自己能否熬过这场磨难。

sentences.english: Teresa had a transplant in 1989 and was just recovering from that ordeal when she suffered a brain hemorrhage.
sentences.chinese: 特雷莎在1989年做了一次移植手术，而正当她刚刚从那可怕的磨难中逐渐恢复时，又患了脑溢血。

sentences.english: Soon the whole terrifying ordeal would be over.
sentences.chinese: 这场恐怖的磨难很快就会过去的。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible or painful experience that continues for a period of time

sentences.english: The ostensible purpose of these meetings was to gather information on financial strategies.
sentences.chinese: 这些会议声称旨在收集金融策略方面的信息。

detailed_translations.english: seeming to be the reason for or the purpose of something, but usually hiding the real reason or purpose
something that develops from something else, as a natural result of it

sentences.english: outmoded ideas
sentences.chinese: 过时的观点

detailed_translations.english: no longer fashionable or useful

sentences.english: The president vetoed the bill, and the Senate failed by a single vote to override his veto.
sentences.chinese: 总统否决了议案，而参议院因一票之差未能推翻他的否决。

detailed_translations.english: If someone in authority overrides a person or their decisions, they cancel their decisions

sentences.english: Hester is overshadowed by her younger and more attractive sister.
sentences.chinese: 她那更年轻而且更有魅力的妹妹使赫斯特黯然失色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使失色；使阴暗；遮阴；夺去…的光彩
detailed_translations.english: If you are overshadowed by a person or thing, you are less successful, important, or impressive than they are

sentences.english: But the various pros and cons should not blindly overwhelm one another.
sentences.chinese: 但是，众多的利弊得失不应盲目的一个压倒另一个。

sentences.english: We try not to think about it because it would overwhelm us to an extent that we would just vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽量不去想它，因为在某种我们能够想像到的程度上他会压倒我们。

sentences.english: For example, in a situation in which several bystanders need to band together to overwhelm a perpetrator, they will be more likely to act collectively than to act alone.
sentences.chinese: 例如, 就有这样一种情况， 在只有几个旁观者需要联合起来才能压倒一个罪犯的情况下, 他们就可能会更多地采取集体行动。

detailed_translations.english: if water overwhelms an area of land, it covers it completely and suddenly

name: overwrought
trans: adj.十分激动的，非常不安的
adj.（装饰、文风等）过分华丽的

sentences.english: Clara was tired and overwrought after all the problems of the last few days.
sentences.chinese: 经历了过去几天的重重困难之后，克拉拉既疲惫又紧张。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过分劳累的，过度兴奋的

sentences.english: No matter it is business palaver or vacation , we ll provide you the best service .
sentences.chinese: 无论是商务洽谈还是休闲度假，这里都将为您提供最完善的服务。

sentences.english: Try whenever possible , if you notice the conversation around you decaying into palaver , to see if you can subtly lead the conversation back to more constructive subjects.
sentences.chinese: 如果你发现在你周遭的谈话已经退化成闲聊的时候，尽你所能将谈话导回到更有建设性的话题上。

sentences.english: Trade is not a panacea for the world's economic or social ills.
sentences.chinese: 贸易不是世界经济或社会弊端的万灵丹。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that something is a panacea for a set of problems, you mean that it will solve all those problems

sentences.english: The lack of a written constitution is a peculiarity of the British political system.
sentences.chinese: 没有一部成文宪法是英国政治制度的一大特点。

sentences.english: Margaret regarded her mother’s peculiarities with a fond tolerance.
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特宽容地看待母亲的怪癖。

detailed_translations.english: something that is a feature of only one particular place, person, situation etc

sentences.english: The school district provides training to help teachers improve their pedagogical methods.
sentences.chinese: 该学区提供培训以帮助教师们改进教学方法。

detailed_translations.english: relating to teaching methods or the practice of teaching

sentences.english: Peel and dice the potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 把马铃薯去皮并切成丁。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the skin from fruit or vegetables
to remove the skin from fruit or vegetables
the skin of some fruits and vegetables, especially the thick skin of fruits such as oranges, which you do not eat

sentences.english: He was one of the most perceptive U.S. political commentators.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是美国最具洞察力的政治评论员之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感知的，知觉的；有知觉力的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their remarks or thoughts as perceptive, you think that they are good at noticing or realizing things, especially things that are not obvious

sentences.english: a perilous journey across the mountains
sentences.chinese: 穿越群山的危险旅程

detailed_translations.english: very dangerous

sentences.english: In so many countries that I covered in Southeast Asia it was a given that the elites would take over public land as a kind of perquisite of power.
sentences.chinese: 在我报道过的许多东南亚国家，精英阶层拥有将公有土地挪为私用的特权，是人尽皆知的常态。

sentences.english: His critics say he's just being silly and petulant.
sentences.chinese: 批评他的人说，他真是又愚蠢又任性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 暴躁的；任性的；难以取悦的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an unreasonably impatient and angry way, like a child

sentences.english: the early pioneers of the Dakota territory
sentences.chinese: 达科他地区的早期拓荒者

detailed_translations.english: someone who is important in the early development of something, and whose work or ideas are later developed by other people
to be the first person to do, invent or use something

sentences.english: He was a quiet, pious man.
sentences.chinese: 他是个文静、虔诚的人。

detailed_translations.english: having strong religious beliefs, and showing this in the way you behave

sentences.english: the pitfalls associated with the purchase of a used car
sentences.chinese: 购买旧车时可能遇到的圈套

detailed_translations.english: a problem or difficulty that is likely to happen in a particular job, course of action, or activity

sentences.english: The Bank of England has a pivotal role in the London money market.
sentences.chinese: 英格兰银行在伦敦货币市场中起着关键性的作用。

detailed_translations.english: more important than anything else in a situation, system etc

sentences.english: a large, placid baby
sentences.chinese: 一个胖胖的、安静的婴儿

sentences.english: She sat still, placid and waiting.
sentences.chinese: 她安安静静坐着等候。

detailed_translations.english: a placid person does not often get angry or upset and does not usually mind doing what other people want them to

sentences.english: a playful little dog
sentences.chinese: 活泼的小狗

sentences.english: Babies are playful and alert when they first wake up.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝们刚醒来的时候很好动，而且反应敏捷。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开玩笑的；幽默的；爱嬉戏的
detailed_translations.english: very active, happy, and wanting to have fun

sentences.english: a man with plebeian tastes
sentences.chinese: 趣味庸俗的男人

detailed_translations.english: relating to ordinary people and what they like, rather than to people from a high social class – used to show disapproval
an insulting word for someone who is from a low social class

sentences.english: a plush hotel
sentences.chinese: 一家豪华酒店

sentences.english: Their casino is the plushest in town.
sentences.chinese: 他们的赌场是城里最豪华的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 豪华的；长毛绒做的；舒服的
detailed_translations.english: very comfortable, expensive, and of good quality
a silk or cotton material with a thick soft surface

sentences.english: Deer have been poached here for years.
sentences.chinese: 多年来这里一直有人偷偷地猎鹿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 水煮；偷猎；窃取；把…踏成泥浆
detailed_translations.english: to illegally catch or shoot animals, birds, or fish, especially on private land without permission

sentences.english: Position the mouse pointer and click.
sentences.chinese: 把光标对准位置并点击。

detailed_translations.english: something that shows how a situation is developing, or is a sign of what might happen in the future

sentences.english: Williams took a more pragmatic approach to management problems.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯在管理问题上采用的是一种更务实的做法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 实际的；实用主义的；国事的
detailed_translations.english: dealing with problems in a sensible practical way instead of strictly following a set of ideas

detailed_translations.chinese: 预谋， 预先考虑或安排
detailed_translations.english: to plan or consider (something, such as a violent crime) beforehand

sentences.english: A person with ambition is the prerequisite to success.
sentences.chinese: 一个人有雄心壮志是成功的先决条件。

sentences.english: Historical changes to the production of embroidered shoes with embroidery into a local evaluation of the level of ingenuity of a girl prerequisite.
sentences.chinese: 历史的变革使绣花鞋的制作与刺绣水平成为当地评价一个姑娘心灵手巧的先决条件。

sentences.english: Anyone has the possibility to succeed, but the prerequisite of success is your own, both industry knowledge learning and the cultivation of innovation ability, requires great effort.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都有成功的可能性，但成功的先决条件在于你自身，无论是行业知识的学习还是创新能力的培养，都需要付出极大的努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必备的， 作为先决条件的

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary before something else can happen or be done

sentences.english: Arriving late is a woman’s prerogative .
sentences.chinese: 迟到是女人的特权。

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["the rights of kings and queens"],"COLLOINEXA":["the royal prerogative"]}
sentences.chinese: 君主特权

detailed_translations.english: a right that someone has, especially because of their importance or social position

sentences.english: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
detailed_translations.english: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

sentences.english: The project aims to provide an analysis of children’s emotions.
sentences.chinese: 该计划旨在对儿童情绪作出分析。

sentences.english: a three-year research project
sentences.chinese: 一项为期三年的研究计划

sentences.english: The scheme will now be extended after a successful pilot project (= a small trial to test if an idea will be successful ) .
sentences.chinese: 试行成功后，该方案现在将得到推广。

sentences.english: The project is funded by Wellcome plc.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目由威康公司资助。

sentences.english: a project manager
sentences.chinese: 项目经理

sentences.english: a geography project
sentences.chinese: 一个地理课题

detailed_translations.english: a carefully planned piece of work to get information about something, to build something, to improve something etc

sentences.english: a proprietary brand of insecticide
sentences.chinese: 专利品牌杀虫剂

sentences.english: proprietary software products
sentences.chinese: 专利软件产品

detailed_translations.chinese: 所有的；专利的；私人拥有的
detailed_translations.english: a proprietary product is one that is sold under a  trade name

sentences.english: How do you test the prototype of the vending machine?
sentences.chinese: 你如何测试一个自动售货机的原型?。

sentences.english: What is the difference between these prototype declaration?
sentences.chinese: 这些原型声明的区别是什么？

sentences.english: But how do you come up with the architecture for this evolutionary prototype?
sentences.chinese: 但是你将如何为这个进化的原型提出系统的架构呢？

detailed_translations.english: the first form that a new design of a car, machine etc has, or a model of it used to test the design before it is produced

sentences.english: Pickpocketing is rampant in the downtown area.
sentences.chinese: 闹市区扒窃活动猖獗。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["rampant inflation"]}
sentences.chinese: 失控的通货膨胀

detailed_translations.chinese: 猖獗的；蔓延的；狂暴的；奔放的
detailed_translations.english: if something bad, such as crime or disease, is rampant, there is a lot of it and it is very difficult to control

name: ravenous
trans: adj.食量大的，贪食的；贪婪的

sentences.english: I’m absolutely ravenous.
sentences.chinese: 我饿极了。

sentences.english: a ravenous appetite
sentences.chinese: 极大的胃口

detailed_translations.english: very hungry

sentences.english: Olivier’s performance redeemed an otherwise second-rate play.
sentences.chinese: 奥利维尔的表演补救了一出本是二流水平的戏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 赎回；挽回；兑换；履行；补偿；恢复
detailed_translations.english: to make something less bad

name: refreshing
trans: adj.令人身心振奋的，提神的

sentences.english: a refreshing drink
sentences.chinese: 一杯提神的饮料

sentences.english: The breeze felt refreshing.
sentences.chinese: 微风让人神清气爽。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提神的；使清爽的；使人重新振作的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel less tired or less hot

detailed_translations.chinese: 使清新；恢复精神（refresh的ing形式）

sentences.english: Beneath the present church were remnants of Roman flooring.
sentences.chinese: 在目前的这座教堂下面还有残余的古罗马地板。

detailed_translations.english: a small part of something that remains after the rest of it has been used, destroyed, or eaten

sentences.english: They reneged on a pledge to release the hostages.
sentences.chinese: 他们违背承诺，没有释放人质。

detailed_translations.english: to not do something you have promised or agreed to do

sentences.english: More vaccines are needed to replenish our stocks.
sentences.chinese: 还需要更多的疫苗来补充我们的储备。

detailed_translations.chinese: 补充，再装满；把…装满；给…添加燃料
detailed_translations.english: to put new supplies into something, or to fill something again

sentences.english: There is a need for further research to replicate these findings.
sentences.chinese: 需要进一步的研究来验证这些结果。

detailed_translations.english: if you replicate someone’s work, a scientific study etc, you do it again, or try to get the same result again

detailed_translations.chinese: 复制品；八音阶间隔的反覆音

sentences.english: But its decline across Europe is not uniform; in each country, the church faces a different mixture of threats and residual strengths.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在欧洲这种萎缩并不均匀，在每一个国家，教会都面对着多种不同威胁和残余的优势。

sentences.english: These, however, have been exposed to the digestive mercies of bacteria in the large intestine, and any residual goodies have been removed from them that way.
sentences.chinese: 然而这些是被暴露到大肠消化道寄生细菌产生的结果，并且任何剩余糖分都是通过这种方式被移除的。

detailed_translations.english: remaining after a process, event etc is finished

sentences.english: The offender must make restitution for the hurt that he or she has caused.
sentences.chinese: 违法者必须为其所造成的伤害作出赔偿。

detailed_translations.english: the act of giving back something that was lost or stolen to its owner, or of paying for damage

sentences.english: The Home Office have resurrected plans to build a new prison just outside London.
sentences.chinese: 内政部重新提出了在伦敦市外建一座监狱的计划。

sentences.english: another failed attempt to resurrect his career
sentences.chinese: 他重振事业的又一次失败尝试

detailed_translations.english: to bring back an old activity, belief, idea etc that has not existed for a long time

sentences.english: Luke had an amazingly retentive memory.
sentences.chinese: 卢克记忆力惊人。

detailed_translations.english: a retentive memory or mind is able to hold facts and remember them

sentences.english: She bent down to retrieve her earring.
sentences.chinese: 她俯身去捡回耳环。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新得到， 取回， 收回； 挽回， 补救； 检索
detailed_translations.english: to find something and bring it back

sentences.english: Day in and day out, the flat crack of the tank guns reverberates through the little Bavarian town.
sentences.chinese: 日复一日地，单调的坦克炮的轰隆声在巴伐利亚的这个小镇上空回响着。

detailed_translations.english: if a loud sound reverberates, it is heard many times as it is sent back from different surfaces

name: rhetorical
trans: adj.言辞华丽（却往往无内涵）的

sentences.english: a speech full of rhetorical phrases
sentences.chinese: 充满华丽辞藻的演讲

detailed_translations.chinese: 修辞的；修辞学的；夸张的
detailed_translations.english: using speech or writing in special ways in order to persuade people or to produce an impressive effect

sentences.english: I don’t want to go through the rigmarole of taking him to court.
sentences.chinese: 我可不想走那些繁琐的程序去起诉他。

detailed_translations.english: a long confusing process or description

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator
sentences.chinese: 无情的独裁者

sentences.english: They have shown a ruthless disregard for basic human rights.
sentences.chinese: 他们冷酷地无视基本人权。

detailed_translations.english: so determined to get what you want that you do not care if you have to hurt other people in order to do it

sentences.english: a computer with an 18-inch colour screen
sentences.chinese: 带18英寸彩色屏幕的电脑

sentences.english: He went on staring at the TV screen .
sentences.chinese: 他继续盯着电视屏幕看。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a television or computer where the picture or information appears

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩蔽， 遮蔽； 放映， 播放； 审查， 甄别
detailed_translations.english: if something screens something else, it is in front of it and hides it

sentences.english: Scrimping on safety measures can be a false economy.
sentences.chinese: 在安全措施方面节省开支可能会得不偿失。

detailed_translations.english: If you scrimp on things, you live cheaply and spend as little money as possible

sentences.english: ...political rivalry and sectarianism within our movement.
sentences.chinese: ...我们这场运动内部的政治对立及宗派主义。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗派主义； 教派意识
detailed_translations.english: Sectarianism is strong support for the religious or political group you belong to, and often involves conflict with other groups

sentences.english: secular education
sentences.chinese: 世俗教育

sentences.english: our modern secular society
sentences.chinese: 我们的现代世俗社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的；长期的；现世的；不朽的
detailed_translations.english: not connected with or controlled by a church or other religious authority

detailed_translations.chinese: 修道院外的教士，(对宗教家而言的) 俗人

sentences.english: In Book One alone there are four primary instances of what we can think of as this primary simile dynamic.
sentences.chinese: 仅第一本里就有四个主要的例证,我们可以看作最初的明喻来源的动力。

sentences.english: Lister said people should follow the 1946 advice of writer George Orwell: "Never use a metaphor, simile, or other figure of speech which you are used to seeing in print.
sentences.chinese: 李斯特说人们最好遵循作家乔治·奥威尔1946年提出的建议：“不要使用那些在各种出版物上频繁出现的暗喻、明喻或其他修辞格。”

sentences.english: The simile is a common device and a useful one, but similes coming in rapid fire, one right on top of another, are more distracting than illuminating.
sentences.chinese: 明喻是常用的修辞术，也很好用，但是像连珠炮式的比喻与其说是富有启发性，不如说是在转移注意力。

detailed_translations.english: an expression that describes something by comparing it with something else, using the words ‘as’ or ‘like’, for example ‘as white as snow’

name: skittish
trans: adj.容易受到惊吓的，胆小的

sentences.english: Some skittish Wall Street investors are staying away from the market.
sentences.chinese: 一些患得患失的华尔街投资者不敢入市。

detailed_translations.chinese: （人或动物）不安的，易受惊的；难驾驭的
detailed_translations.english: an animal, especially a horse, that is skittish gets excited or frightened very easily

sentences.english: I'm never sparing with the garlic.
sentences.chinese: 我从不吝啬使用大蒜。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is sparing with something uses it or gives it only in very small quantities

sentences.english: ‘But … but … I can’t believe … how could you?’ she spluttered.
sentences.chinese: “可……可是……我不能相信……你怎么可以？”她语无伦次地说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劈啪声；急忙说出的话；杂乱的声音

detailed_translations.english: to talk quickly in short confused phrases, especially because you are angry or surprised

sentences.english: I bake them in the oven until they are crisp and then toss them in a wok with chilli and ginger as in my experience customers tend to be squeamish about anything that is soft and squidgy.
sentences.chinese: 我在烤炉里烘焙它们直到它们变的酥脆可口，然后再把它们扔到一口锅里，放上辣椒和生姜，因为据我的经验观察，顾客一般对一些柔软而潮湿的东西感到恶心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易受惊的； 易恶心的
detailed_translations.english: easily shocked or upset, or easily made to feel sick by seeing unpleasant things

sentences.english: a staunch conservative
sentences.chinese: 忠实的保守党党员

detailed_translations.english: giving strong loyal support to another person, organization, belief etc
to stop the flow of liquid, especially of blood from a wound

sentences.english: There's always been a stereotype about successful businessmen.
sentences.chinese: 对成功的商人们总有一种成见。

detailed_translations.english: a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like. Stereotypes are often unfair or untrue.

sentences.english: Children in single-parent families must not be stigmatized.
sentences.chinese: 单亲家庭的孩子不应该受到侮辱。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something is stigmatized, they are unfairly regarded by many people as being bad or having something to be ashamed of

sentences.english: Germany brought on a substitute at half time.
sentences.chinese: 德国队在比赛半场时换上一名替补队员。

sentences.english: substitute goalkeeper
sentences.chinese: 替补守门员

detailed_translations.english: someone who does someone else’s job for a limited period of time, especially in a sports team or school
to use something new or diffe-rent instead of something else

sentences.english: Don't succumb to the temptation to have just one cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 不要屈服于只抽一支烟的诱惑。

detailed_translations.english: to stop opposing someone or something that is stronger than you, and allow them to take control

sentences.english: Their map has since been superseded by photographic atlases.
sentences.chinese: 他们的地图从此被摄影地图册取代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取代，代替；紧接着……而到来
detailed_translations.english: if a new idea, product, or method supersedes another one, it becomes used instead because it is more modern or effective

sentences.english: He became surly and rude toward me.
sentences.chinese: 他变得对我粗暴无礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乖戾的；板面孔的，无礼的；阴沉的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is surly behaves in a rude bad-tempered way

sentences.english: There's so little to go on, we can only surmise what happened.
sentences.chinese: 几乎没有什么可继续进行的，我们只能猜测发生过的事。

sentences.english: It is mere surmise that Bosch had Brant's poem in mind when doing this painting.
sentences.chinese: 博斯画这幅画时头脑里想着勃朗特的诗，这只是猜测而已。

detailed_translations.english: to guess that something is true, using the information you know already
If you say that a particular conclusion is surmise, you mean that it is a guess based on the available evidence and you do not know for certain that it is true

sentences.english: He has had to surmount immense physical disabilities.
sentences.chinese: 他不得不克服严重的身体残疾。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in dealing with a problem or difficulty

sentences.english: He had surpassed all our expectations .
sentences.chinese: 他超越了我们所有的预期。

sentences.english: The number of multiple births has surpassed 100,000 for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 多胎产首次突破了 10 万例。

detailed_translations.english: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

sentences.english: Arms control should not be made into a surrogate for peace.
sentences.chinese: 军备控制不应变成和平的替代物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 代理；代用品；遗嘱检验法官
detailed_translations.english: a person or thing that takes the place of someone or something else

detailed_translations.chinese: 代理；指定某人为自己的代理人

detailed_translations.english: a surrogate person or thing is one that takes the place of someone or something else

sentences.english: electronic surveillance equipment
sentences.chinese: 电子监控设备

detailed_translations.english: when the police, army etc watch a person or place carefully because they may be connected with criminal activities

sentences.english: Most of the criticism has been pretty tame.
sentences.chinese: 评论的大部分内容很乏味。

sentences.english: I decided that teaching was too tame for me.
sentences.chinese: 我最终认为教书对我来说太枯燥。

detailed_translations.chinese: 驯服的，顺从的；沉闷的，乏味的
detailed_translations.english: dull and disappointing

detailed_translations.chinese: 制服， 控制并利用； 驯化， 驯服
detailed_translations.english: to reduce the power or strength of something and prevent it from causing trouble

sentences.english: My hair tangles easily.
sentences.chinese: 我的头发很容易打结。

sentences.english: His parachute became tangled in the wheels of the plane.
sentences.chinese: 他的降落伞缠在了飞机的轮子上。

detailed_translations.english: to become twisted together, or make something become twisted together, in an untidy mass

detailed_translations.chinese: 乱糟糟的一堆， 混乱； 复杂的问题； 困惑
detailed_translations.english: a confused state or situation

sentences.english: the temporal character of human existence
sentences.chinese: 人生的短促

detailed_translations.english: related to or limited by time

sentences.english: I passed on my tentative conclusions to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的初步结论递交给了警方。

sentences.english: The government is taking tentative steps towards tackling the country’s economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 政府正在采取临时性措施来解决国家的经济问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试验性的，暂定的；踌躇的
detailed_translations.english: not definite or certain, and may be changed later

name: thick-skinned
trans: adj.冷漠无情的，不顾及他人感受的

sentences.english: Winning first place must have been quite a thrill.
sentences.chinese: 赢得第一名肯定让人非常激动。

sentences.english: Even though I’ve been acting for years, I still get a thrill out of going on stage.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我演了多年戏，走上舞台我仍然感到十分激动。

sentences.english: It gave Pat a thrill to finally see the group perform live.
sentences.chinese: 帕特终于看到这个乐队现场表演，感到十分激动。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong feeling of excitement and pleasure, or the thing that makes you feel this

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…颤动；使…紧张；使…感到兴奋或激动
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel excited and happy

name: timely
trans: adj.恰到好处的，合乎时宜的

sentences.english: The fight ended only with the timely arrival of the police.
sentences.chinese: 幸亏警察及时赶到，打斗总算停止。

detailed_translations.english: done or happening at exactly the right time

sentences.english: ...a self-made Irish-American property tycoon.
sentences.chinese: …一个靠自己奋斗成功的爱尔兰裔美国房地产大亨。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is successful in business or industry and has a lot of money and power

sentences.english: The country had long been ruled by tyrants.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家长期受暴君统治。

detailed_translations.english: a ruler who has complete power and uses it in a cruel and unfair way

sentences.english: The answers were kept confidential to prevent any partners taking umbrage.
sentences.chinese: 为了防止他们的另一半感到不快，他们的答案都是保密的。

sentences.english: It was decided by a unanimous vote that the school should close.
sentences.chinese: 关闭学校是大家一致通过的决定。

sentences.english: The decision to appoint Matt was almost unanimous.
sentences.chinese: 任命马特的决定几乎是一致通过的。

detailed_translations.english: a unanimous decision, vote, agreement etc is one in which all the people involved agree

sentences.english: unremitting poverty
sentences.chinese: 长期的贫困

detailed_translations.chinese: 不懈的；不间断的；坚忍的
detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long time and not likely to stop

name: wayward
trans: adj.刚愎自用的，不服管束的

sentences.english: a wayward teenager
sentences.chinese: 任性的少年

detailed_translations.chinese: 任性的；不规则的；刚愎的
detailed_translations.english: behaving badly, in a way that is difficult to control

sentences.english: What’s the weather like today?
sentences.chinese: 今天天气如何？

sentences.english: The weather turned bitterly cold.
sentences.chinese: 天气变得很冷了。

detailed_translations.english: the temperature and other conditions such as sun, rain, and wind

detailed_translations.chinese: 经受住；使风化；侵蚀；使受风吹雨打
detailed_translations.english: if rock, wood, or someone’s face is weathered by the wind, sun, rain etc, or if it weathers, it changes colour or shape over a period of time

sentences.english: There is a willful self-destructiveness in the air here as if America has all the time and money in the world for petty politics.
sentences.chinese: 这里的空气里中弥漫着一种故意自我毁灭的气息，为了狭隘的政治，美国好像在全世界有的是金钱和时间。

sentences.english: Even the best ones can be foiled, though, by a sufficiently willful programmer committed to ignoring basic principles of memory management.
sentences.chinese: 但是，即使最优秀的编程人员也可能会被忽略内存管理基本原则的非常任性的编程人员搅乱。

sentences.english: The roses wilted the next day.
sentences.chinese: 这些玫瑰花第二天就枯萎了。

detailed_translations.english: if a plant wilts, it bends over because it is too dry or old

sentences.english: a wily politician
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的政客

detailed_translations.english: clever at getting what you want, especially by tricking people

sentences.english: a wistful smile
sentences.chinese: 怅然若失的微笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 渴望的；沉思的，默想的；引起怀念的；不满足似的
detailed_translations.english: thinking sadly about something you would like to have but cannot have, especially something that you used to have in the past

sentences.english: I managed to wrest the photograph from his grasp.
sentences.chinese: 我设法把他攥在手里的照片夺了过来。

detailed_translations.english: to pull something away from someone violently

name: wrongheaded
trans: adj.固执己见的，坚持（错误观点的）

sentences.english: He told them exactly how wrongheaded they were.
sentences.chinese: 他实实在在地跟他们说他们有多执迷不悟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚持错误的， 固执的
detailed_translations.english: used to describe an idea, plan, or belief that someone has, that is based on wrong ideas that they are not willing to change
